story:
Introducing me and my background

  • Good day. Here I am young and passionate water technology engineer, I am 26 years old and I have studied heat gas and water technology for 8 years. My passion is inventing and creating new products for engineers. All began 8 years ago, when I was 18, after school I worked for international production company. I had to work on very complex projects designing solutions for city water and sewage grid. All of those projects have now been implemented and proven working in city infrastructure. After three years working and seeing competitor solutions I realized that these technologies need improvement. Things need to be done better way. To realize my ideas I decided to change market standards So 5 years ago I decided to make my own company to produce complex solutions for water supply and sewerage, One of new solutions I manufactured was individual fully automated pumping stations. It excited me, to be creating new products in market and replace morally and technically outdated solutions with new ones.

    Briefly describing my campaign and why it's important to me

  • Campaign is about starting production of heat isolated chambers for water and sewerage, to save energy, to be sure that we are not polluting environment with non-tight sewerage systems made from concrete or other poor quality materials. Long life materials with competitive price. Most important to make safer everyday life for people who is caring about sewage and water systems.

    What contributors will help me achieve?

  • .Creating new product what sets new, better standards in the market. New technologies allow us to create cheaper and better quality materials, so projects will get more affordable and sustainable. No more poor quality high maintenance products. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here in more detail:

  • Explaining how much funding I need

-  There is need to build one more factory next to existing one and connect them together as huge one. I have already invested 170 000 Eur to build one factory.

- There is need to buy rotational molding machine and put it in new factory. To produce large dimension components for chambers. This cost around 80 000 Eur,  I have invested 50 000 Eur in molds for rotational molding, but do not have plant. 

- There is need for Injection molding machine and put it in new factory as well, to produce small components for chambers, This machine cost arround 85 000 Eur

- There is need for 11 more additional steel molds for rotational molding, vacuum forming and injection molding,  each mold cost around 5000 Eur, so there is 55000

- At least 10 000 I need to build by my self additional 5 vacuum forming machines.   I have made one by myself.

So at least we have all missing components we can make information campaign to all water works companies that they can get heat isolated chambers, for water knots or sewage pressure and gravity system in great long life plastic design and easier to service this system.

About unique perks.

  • As I can not produce and send to each person huge chamber with pumps inside of it or something like that, I can make remembrance - small chamber on just finished vacuum forming machine, titled - owner of water tech company.

Where the funds go if I don't reach my entire goal.

  • All funds goes to realize this project anyway, there is lot of points to do, there is possibility to build vacuum forming machines and molds, buy roto-molding machine, build one more factory and so on, because there is spend already 400000 Eur in last 5 years. I feel my self investing in better future. 


Explaining more about my campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Firstly we all are drinking water, and if there is poor quality chambers, pipes and system at all then sewerage is going to environment and make dirty our drinking water. Second part is heat insulation for sewerage system, when we release bath, there is hundred liters with warm water, and if we get back spend energy to warm it up, we use less energy for different processes. Thirdly there is lot of people working on pipelines, cleaning sewage systems, survey water chambers and their weekday is getting in bad conditions - concrete chambers with unstable construction, there is risks to get injury, or get infections. This is new, environment friendly product which will improve the system how clean water is being supplied and sewage taken away.
     

   Pointing out my successful, already done things

  • I have made Heat isolated chamber for water meter, so people have this chamber in their garden and nobody from waterworks disturb them at home to take meter readings. until now people had water meter in house, and waterworks companies may disturb people private at their homes. Now it is different. But there is a lot of more system components should be improved in nowadays. 

    There is no difficulties.

  • I can make all these knots and chambers produced in factory not on site, so quality is in different level. We can save energy, and take it out from warm waste water system. We all together can save our environment.
  • Production is not problem, to build machines, design products and get them real is not problem. Problem could be construction companies, they always thinking about money and where to buy materials - system components cheaper.
  • Let them get it cheaper but in good quality and with features about future.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Le pourquoi du comment?

Alors une autre ferme maraîchère? Ouais, une autre. Pour ceux et celles qui ne me connaissent pas, moi c'est Pierre-Antoine. Enchanté by the way. J'ai 25 ans et j'essaie de réinventer la roue. En fait, non, pas vraiment. Mais! D'un autre côté, c'est comme pour les pompes funèbres: il ne manquera jamais de demande pour de la nourriture.

En plus, c'est mon rêve de faire pousser des légumes et d'en vivre. Il me semble que c'est une bonne raison d'essayer de démarrer mon entreprise, non? J'ai fondé Culture B et je me lance. Je me suis déjà commis: le terrain est loué. Alors j'aurais besoin de votre aide pour la suite...

(Photo: Sylvain Lussier)

Ça fait deux saisons que je fais ça en tant qu'amateur. J'ai vendu quelques légumes à gauche et à droite à des amis, à la famille, et cette année, je veux en vendre à vous! Le prochain Dole ou Arctic Gardens, c'est moi.

Sans blague, je ne veux pas devenir immense, au contraire. Si je parviens à me tirer un salaire décent (disons, 147 000$ net par année), je vais être content. Je veux rester petit, garder le contrôle sur tous les aspects du projet. Culture B, c'est:

  • 10 000 pieds carrés à Saint-Basile-le-Grand;
  • près de 30 variétés de légumes cultivés selon les saisons;
  • une surface optimale (un jour!) d'un maximum de 2 à 3 acres;
  • aucun équipement mécanisé d'envergure, pas de tracteur, idéalement (j'attends des nouvelles de Tesla), pas de gaz, du tout;
  • des techniques de culture certifiées biologiques;
  • écouler les produits à l'échelle locale (points de chute et d'achat à Montréal et à Sherbrooke);
  • la plus grande transparence possible quant à l'origine des produits;
  • diversifier constamment les types de légumes cultivés et essayer sans cesse de nouveaux cultivars;
  • miser sur la qualité et la fraîcheur des aliments;
  • sensibiliser mon entourage à l'importance d'encourager l'agriculture de proximité, l'économie locale, des pratiques respectueuses de l'environnement;
  • développer une relation d'amitié (c'est cute) avec les clients et être à leur écoute;
  • vous proposer une alternative appétissante aux laitues flasques vendues dans les supermarchés;
  • réinvestir moi-même dans l'économie locale en m'approvisionnant le plus possible auprès de fournisseurs québécois ou canadiens.

Ça fait le tour? Partez-moi pas là-dessus, je pourrais en parler longtemps.

J'ai donc besoin de votre argent. Oui, de votre argent. Je suis cheap (lire «pauvre») de même. En contribuant à ma campagne de sociofinancement, vous m'éviteriez les intérêts sur les prêts bancaires. Vous m'éviteriez l'endettement tout court. En plus, c'est vraiment à la mode d'être solidaires et de s'entraider.

Mettons que vous me donnez un peu d'argent, j'offre des contreparties. Pis si je vous connais bien, je pourrais peut-être même venir vous aider à déblayer votre entrée ou à déménager. Bref, en 2016, vous seriez ben bloods de m'aider.

Je serai éternellement reconnaissant.

Comment je dépenserais votre argent

C'est pas trop compliqué. Je suis cassé et j'ai besoin de changer de char (c'est vrai en plus, poursuivez votre lecture)!

Je démarre une entreprise, alors essentiellement, je dois acheter de l'équipement qui est ma foi, heureusement assez durable. Je «flauberais» donc les fonds à peu près pour ça:

Selon mes calculs, le montant réel (au pire) frôle les 20 000$. Dans le meilleur des mondes, je pense être en mesure de m'en tirer pour 12 000 à 15 000$.

Si vous me financez à hauteur de 125$, je vais tout le boire en café. Promis.

Si vous me financez à hauteur de 5000$ (mon objectif), je vais boire un ou deux cafés et je vais acheter une bonne partie de l'équipement ci-haut. J'aurai juste à emprunter le reste (ou à obtenir une subvention) et je vais être ben moins stressé. Ne vous gênez pas pour faire exploser l'objectif fixé, je ne suis pas regardant.

Si vous me financez à hauteur de 19 500$, je laisse tout tomber et je pars refaire ma vie au Mexique.

En échange de vos économies, j'offre des contreparties. Au fond, ma campagne de financement reprend un peu le principe de l'agriculture soutenue par la communauté (ASC); vous payez maintenant et recevez la récolte plus tard. Je décrirais bien les forfaits, mais il y a une section pour ça. Déjà que mon texte est long...

Trust me, I am [not] an engineer

Je pense que je suis pas pire avec les plantes. Vous pouvez me faire confiance. En même temps, peut-être qu'on va connaître une catastrophe écologique sans précédent cet été comme l'entrée en éruption du mont Orford. Là, je vous jure d'essayer fort de faire pousser des tomates, mais on va appeler ça un «Act of God».

Ça fait donc deux saisons que je fais ça, et je mange encore des tomates de l'année passée. Pas pire hein? J'avais récolté 175 livres de tomates. Beat that yo. J'ai de l'expérience avec pas mal toutes les cultures que je compte faire cette année et ça marche pas mal bien. Je suis autodidacte. Je n'ai aucune formation officielle reconnue pas le Ministère avec un grand M. Mais j'ai lu beaucoup de livres, je me suis occupé d'un jardin pour un café, j'ai fait du bénévolat scout pour des jardins publics. Ça devrait bien aller, je le jure. Le seul hic, c'est que je n'aime pas le fenouil.

Risques et défis

  • Risque 1: faire faillite. Ceci dit, je ne gage pas ma maison. Je pourrais perdre 20 000$. Au pire. Mettons, vous perdez votre investissement, mais vous sentez valorisé d'avoir encouragé un jeune entrepreneur à poursuivre son plus grand rêve [insérer ici les paillettes, les néons, les licornes et plein d'autres choses scintillantes]. Ou encore, vous vous retrouvez désillusionné des campagnes de sociofinancement et on ne se parle plus jamais.
  • Risque 2: il s'avère que je suis complètement nul et que je n'arrive qu'à faire pousser des radis. On se trouvera des bonnes recettes de radis, qu'est-ce que vous vous que je vous dises?
  • Défi 1: bien prévoir mon calendrier de culture. Ça, pour vrai, c'est pas facile. Mais c'est ben l'fun. Je travaille là-dessus, pas mal tous les jours. Je n'ai pas d'expérience sur cette terre, c'est le plus gros point d'interrogation. Voilà, c'est dit. Je me donne corps et âme pour que ça marche. C'est mon meilleur argument.
  • Défi 2: gérer mes stocks et écouler [complètement] mes produits. Je compte sur vous pour en acheter (pour vrai). Je veux vendre des abonnements à des paniers de légumes, vendre en vrac sur mon site web et offrir des légumes aux points de chute pour compléter les commandes marché style. Si j'ai des surplus, je vais approcher des restaurants et des cafés pour essayer de faire des «deals» ponctuels. S'il m'en reste, je vais les manger. Si je n'ai plus faim, je vais les donner à des organismes communautaires. S'ils ne les veulent pas, enweye au compost!

D'autres façons de [me rendre riche] m'aider...

Vous ne pouvez pas présentement contribuer monétairement à mon ascension vers les paradis fiscaux? Vous pouvez quand même m'aider de différentes manières!

  • Partagez ma campagne! Sur FB, via Indiegogo, sur Instagram, sur Google+, sur Pinterest, sur MySpace, sur SkyRock, par la poste, whatever. Je voudrais que ça devienne viral. J'espère au moins égaler la popularité du Gangnam Style!
  • Partagez l'adresse de mon site web et suivez le compte de Culture B sur FB et les autres médias sociaux. Si vous ne le faites pas, je vais acheter de la pub FB et vous y serez confronté anyway.
  • Inscrivez-vous à un abonnement aux paniers de légumes, ACHETEZ-MOI DES LÉGUMES dans ma boutique en ligne ou transférez-moi une partie de vos REER. Blague à part, faites un petit geste feel-good en achetant quelques légumes biologiques locaux. Y'a juste des avantages: réduction des GES, croissance de l'économie locale, réduction des pesticides et composés chimiques quelconques, des saveurs rehaussées dans votre lunch du mardi midi, investissement dans votre santé et désengorgement à long terme des hôpitaux, etc.
  • Proposez votre aide bénévole. Je ne dirai pas non à deux trois amiEs pour venir m'aider à semer, désherber, récolter, laver les légumes, coller des timbres sur des enveloppes.
  • Envoyez-moi une lettre d'encouragements. Mettons: «Go P-A, faut que tu keep le focus su'a puck pendant 70 minutes! Donne ton 110% pis envoie un vœu à l'univers!» Je vais vous trouver ben fins.

«Décharge de responsabilité à des fins légales, veuillez signer dans la case ci-bas, à côté du X»

1. En contribuant à ma campagne, vous faites acte de foi; afin que tout soit clair, vous reconnaissez être conscient des risques inhérents à l'agriculture et vous me faites confiance quant au contenu des paniers. C'est moi qui va le déterminer. Je ne me m'avance pas sur les dates de livraison ni sur la quantité de la récolte. La météo et les mille et un autres facteurs hors de mon contrôle pourraient augmenter ou diminuer ma récolte et donc vos contreparties. Je n'y peux rien. Cependant, si la récolte est bonne, je vais tout faire pour que vous soyez plus que satisfaits de vos contreparties.

2. Par ailleurs, il y a des limites aux endroits où je vais aller livrer mes légumes. J'ai des intérêts à Saint-Basile-le-Grand, Montréal et Sherbrooke, pour des raisons écologiques et financières, on s'entend que je vais pas mal m'en tenir à ça et n'irai pas virer à Québec ou Chibougamau (non, je n'irai pas à Chibougamau) pour 25$ de légumes. «Loin des yeux, loin des légumes» comme on dit... mais je vais être très reconnaissant. Genre beaucoup, beaucoup, beaucoup.

Partagez l'adresse de mon site web et suivez le compte de Culture B sur FB et les autres médias sociaux. Si vous ne le faites pas, je vais acheter de la pub FB et vous y serez confronté anyway.

Inscrivez-vous à un abonnement aux paniers de légumes, ACHETEZ-MOI DES LÉGUMES dans ma boutique en ligne ou transférez-moi une partie de vos REER. Blague à part, faites un petit geste feel-good en achetant quelques légumes biologiques locaux. Y'a juste des avantages: réduction des GES, croissance de l'économie locale, réduction des pesticides et composés chimiques quelconques, des saveurs rehaussées dans votre lunch du mardi midi, investissement dans votre santé et désengorgement à long terme des hôpitaux, etc.
Proposez votre aide bénévole. Je ne dirai pas non à deux trois amiEs pour venir m'aider à semer, désherber, récolter, laver les légumes, coller des timbres sur des enveloppes.

Envoyez-moi une lettre d'encouragements. Mettons: «Go P-A, faut que tu keep le focus su'a puck pendant 70 minutes! Donne ton 110% pis envoie un vœu à l'univers!» Je vais vous trouver ben fins.


«Décharge de responsabilité à des fins légales, veuillez signer dans la case ci-bas, à côté du X»
1. En contribuant à ma campagne, vous faites acte de foi; afin que tout soit clair, vous reconnaissez être conscient des risques inhérents à l'agriculture et vous me faites confiance quant au contenu des paniers. C'est moi qui va le déterminer. Je ne me m'avance pas sur les dates de livraison ni sur la quantité de la récolte. La météo et les mille et un autres facteurs hors de mon contrôle pourraient augmenter ou diminuer ma récolte et donc vos contreparties. Je n'y peux rien. Cependant, si la récolte est bonne, je vais tout faire pour que vous soyez plus que satisfaits de vos contreparties.2. Par ailleurs, il y a des limites aux endroits où je vais aller livrer mes légumes. J'ai des intérêts à Saint-Basile-le-Grand, Montréal et Sherbrooke, pour des raisons écologiques et financières, on s'entend que je vais pas mal m'en tenir à ça et n'irai pas virer à Québec ou Chibougamau (non, je n'irai pas à Chibougamau) pour 25$ de légumes. «Loin des yeux, loin des légumes» comme on dit... mais je vais être très reconnaissant. Genre beaucoup, beaucoup, beaucoup.

story:
Bring the flavors and spice blends of West Africa, with influences from cuisines around the globe, to your own dinner table – one sauce at a time.

The countries of West Africa have rich cultures and traditions, and each boasts a particularly defined food culture. While each country’s dishes are distinct, there are many commonalities between them, and their similar climates have inspired a variety of foods and flavors that are at once familiar and exotic. Essie Spice and the Essential Sauce Collection were born out of many years of experimenting with traditional West African cooking techniques and spices, and the blending of these techniques with popular flavors from around the world. Born and raised in Ghana, Essie Bartels’ mission was to create sauces and other foods that would demonstrate the vibrant tastes and traditions of her heritage and transport these flavors directly to the American dinner table.  

Are You Familiar with West African Cuisine?

How many African restaurants do you know of? Now count how many of them are West African? Or West African inspired? West African fusion? How many of these restaurants, if you could think of any, would you comfortably host a party or event at, invite friends etc? 

Even in New York City, where nearly all cultures and cuisines are represented, there are very few West African food establishments, brands or eateries where people can enjoy food or purchase products that highlight West African cuisine. Very few restaurants or food brands represent our culture and our food in the United States. Everyone is familiar with Italian, French & even Moroccan cuisine, but so little is known about the foods, techniques, spices, and cooking traditions of Ghana, Senegal or Benin.


Our Story 

Essie Bartels was born and raised in Ghana, and began cooking with the traditional spices of the region at the age of eight in her mother’s kitchen. Some of Essie’s earliest memories involved regularly watching the history, travel, and cooking channels with her father. Every Sunday after church her family would go out to lunch, and each week they would sample a different cuisine, from Chinese to French and everything in between.

When Essie turned 18, she moved to the United States to attend college. She carried on her cooking traditions from home during college and all throughout her 9 years in corporate America. Encouraged by friends in the U.S. who enjoyed her cooking, and inspired by her own desire to showcase her heritage and demonstrate the appeal of West African flavors and cuisine, she began conducting extensive research on native foods and spices. During this time she also traveled to 24 countries, and each time she immersed herself in the region’s cuisine by taking classes and learning various traditions. She studied and became familiar with the foods, flavors, and cooking techniques of Mexico, France, South Africa and Costa Rica. These experiences helped Essie to identify the commonalities with food from each region, as well as what makes each country’s cuisine unique. Essie’s first sauce was born after returning from a trip to Mexico with a bag of Mexican tamarind candies. Reminded of the tamarind fruit that was so prevalent during her childhood in Ghana, Essie melted down the candies to form a glaze and soon her Tamarind OH! marinade was born. 

Today, Essie has been called a “spice mixologist” and a “culinary ‘ambassador’ for West Africa.” Each sauce that followed Tamarind OH! was the result of similar experimentation and the fusion of West African flavors with global cooking traditions. These are concoctions and combinations that come naturally to Essie in her kitchen, and that you can now experiment with in your own home through Essie Spice’s Essential Sauce Collection. 



How Do We Make Our Sauces?

Essie Spice features the finest of ingredients sourced directly from small businesses and producers, and our sourcing begins in Northern Ghana, in partnership with a local businesswoman named Hajia Limata. The dry spices at the heart of all Essie Spice sauces are sourced from Hajia, who has been working with herbs and spices since she was a little girl. As an adult she began selling them at the Makola Market, the biggest open-air market in Accra, the capital of Ghana. The Makola Market is where Hajia met and began supplying Essie’s mother with spices for export to the United States. Essie was able to experiment with Hajia’s spices in the U.S., and her partnership with Hajia was born. Our dried ginger, our grains of selim, alligator pepper & our West African nutmeg are all sourced directly from her kitchen. The impact of Essie Spice on Hajia’s business in Ghana has been tremendous, enabling her to support & educate both her daughter and her granddaughter. 


The fresh ingredients in Essie Spice are sourced from produce distributors in the tri-state area that specialize in exotic ingredients, keeping the business local and the supply-chain short. We use fresh ingredients and premium oils like Coconut & Avocado that are healthy, but also great tasting, complementing the rich spices and flavors of West Africa.

All Essie Spice sauces are packaged in glass jars to avoid BPA and any contamination that can result from heat transfer from plastics; and all of our packaging is made from recycled glass and cardboard, and is 100% recyclable. We produce the sauces in small batches at a local kitchen incubator to ensure quality and to maintain the personal, hand-made touch that our customers have grown to love and expect. They know who makes their sauce and exactly where their spices come from.

Authentic Ghanaian Spices and paired with complementary world flavors. Takes the guess work out of measuring seasoning because all flavor is in there already. Its truly multi-purpose – can serve as a jam, the base for a salad dressing, as a condiment, in a marinade or glaze, and as a cooking sauce and spice blend. They pack a lot of flavor so a small amount goes a long way when cooking your favorite dishes

Made in small batches to ensure attention to detail in an incubator certified under all NYC health codes. They are lab-tested & FDA Approved.

They are all-natural with no artificial coloring, flavoring, and preservatives, 
High in minerals, vitamins and antioxidants
The sauces are low in calories

No MSG or fillers

                             


PRODUCT REVIEWS

Chef Pierre Thiam - Chef, Restauranteur & Cookbook Author. 

EssieSpice Coco-for-Garlic is the perfect blend to revive any sauces or stews.  The sweetness from the coconut oil combined with the sharpness of the garlic and the heat from the chili, together make a happy marriage for any ethnic food lovers. Coco-for-Garlic also makes a fine marinade for grilled meat or fish.

Tamarind Oh brings a sweet and sour goodness that takes me straight back to my childhood in Dakar where spicy tamarind snacks aka “Dakhar Niambaan”, were sold, wrapped on craft paper, in street corners (by the way, Dakar also means tamarind in Wolof language).

My favorite is the Mekko Dry Rub that reminds me of the Hausa spice mixture known as “Kankankan” used on the popular Nigerian grilled meat snack  “Suya”. Mekko Dry Rub can be used as a substitute for the spices on blackened salmon or on grilled steak. It adds a unique intense flavor with subtle hints of Selim pepper.

If you are a heat lover (like me!), the Mango Medley is just for you. It‘s the sauce you can carry along when you travel and want to bring that African kick to your food anywhere anytime. There is nothing like hot pepper to open up one’s palate to flavors. Here, the heat from the habanero is balanced with the sweetness of the mango, which also reminds me of those childhood days in Dakar, when, during the rainy season, we couldn’t wait for the mangoes to ripen. We would simply eat them green with salt and dry chili.

Essie's creativity is fearless, borrowing flavors from other rich food cultures without compromising with the authenticity of the African flavors. The simplicity and quality of the ingredients are good indicators of the integrity of this new brand.

Essie Spice is a welcome addition to the global pantry. 


Alexander Smalls - Chef/Restaurateur of The Cecil & Minton's Restaurant, NYC 

Essiespice is an epicurean wake up call for diners in search of flavor... It is not only a spice collection but a movement...a flavor sensation with every bite you take. Essiespice transforms the ordinary...mundane flavor most dishes suffer from, giving them a bold..exciting kick, pushing the boundaries of what flavorful eating is all about...and more. 

Each Sauce and flavorful spice from the Coco-for garlic...the Tamarind oh, and the Mango Medley...even the very aromatic Mekko dry rub....nothing could be finer than these delightful sauces  spicing up your meat, chicken or fish...not to mention a great vegetarian dip right from the bottle. Essie Spice gives you flavor with each choice you desire.... Pick some up and surprise your taste buds.



Emmet Dennis - Chief Branding & Community Commerce Officer- Sundial Brands

With this dynamic and innovative founder, you will also discover an infectious personality and an amazing work ethic in Essie Bartels. 

Essie Spice is a culturally authentic product with local global appeal.  The spices and sauce blends #breakthewalls of traditional cooking methods with influences from Asian, Caribbean, and South American, and Europe all in these special bottles. Sauces such as  “Tamarind OH!, Mango Chili Medley, and Coco-for Garlic will entice your tastebuds and enhance your daily dishes.  With a sustainable business model that is passionate about community empowerment and development,  Essie Spice is the next household brand name for your next artisanal food creation.”



Chef Michael Zebrowski- Head Pastry Chef; Institute of Culinary Education, NYC.

"Essie has always demonstrated great dedication and a positive, mature attitude in her business endeavors. She is industrious and well-focused, and works with a professional mindset.

I sampled and enjoyed her sauces and even used them in a few dishes. They were unique, traditional and full of robust flavor. I see her dedication to her business and her culinary education as a testament to the work she has put into the sauces. I look forward to greatness for Essie and her one-of-a-kind sauces.


Chef Travis Schultz - Sous Chef; The Mansion at the MGM Grand

Inspired by the soulful foods of her heritage, Essie Bartels presents EssieSpice to the world. Her top-shelf artisan spice rubs, blends and sauces are inspired by her own family recipes that were passed down through generations. You can really taste the heart in what Essie is doing.  I was offered the wonderful opportunity to sample the EssieSpice product line, to which I was extremely satisfied. You can’t argue with good food, and your taste buds don’t lie. 

Every product I sampled exceed my expectations and tasted great  – and with food, that’s what matters most at the end of the day. I highly recommend EssieSpice products for anyone wanting to cook great food. The best part about all of the EssieSpice products is that they are ready to go out of the jar; no need for adjustments.  You don’t need to be a great chef to make great food when you have some EssieSpice in your back pocket or pantry. You just need to taste for yourself to understand. That’s real talk.



What Have We Accomplished So Far?

From year 1 (in 2013) to year 2, Essie Spice doubled the sales of our Essential Sauce Collection. During this time we also expanded our sales platform beyond online orders to include six brick-and-mortar stores, farmers’ markets, in-store demos and pop-up shops. Every Essie Spice in-store demo has resulted in completely selling out of our on-site inventory.

Increased media attention around our popular sauces, a growing social media following (on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter), and exposure from attendance at food events around the tri-state (NY, NJ, CT) area has translated to a consistent growth in demand for Essie Spice sauces and spice blends. We have recently received inquiries and finally landed shelf space from National Retailers Wholefoods Market and ShopRite Supermarkets. We are currently available for sale in the Brooklyn Wholefoods and the Englewood, NJ ShopRite Store. Wholefoods has over 430 stores and ShopRite has over 250 stores. We need to be able to raise the funds to ramp up production to meet demand. With your support we can grow our business to match this demand and begin distributing our sauces to even wider audiences on a regional and national scale.


Since our first year in business, we have donated 10% of the proceeds from our anniversary sale to nonprofit charities that are doing important work in communities around the world. Charities we have supported thus far include Medecins Sans Frontières/Doctors Without Borders, The Abide Family (Uganda), Tatas And Friends (Ghana), The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, and the Kili Summit for Clean Water under the African Development Initiative. As Essie Spice continues to grow our intention is to continue and to expand this important tradition of giving back to our communities.   


What’s the Money For?

Since 2013 Essie Spice has been a labor of love, and with the exception of many helpful friends and family, it has also been a one-woman show. The excitement over and demand for our sauces continue to grow, and we are poised to scale up our business and meet this need head on. We plan to allocate resources from this successful campaign to the following business areas below as we work to put our sauce and spice blends directly in the hands of more consumers and to make Essie Spice a household name.


·  Marketing:  

o  Increase visibility and social media presence through higher frequency of posts and paid advertisements

o  Create digital content in the form of how-to cooking videos

o  Partner with restaurants in NYC and beyond to promote brand

o  Obtain a booth at the 2017 Fancy Food Show at NYC’s Javits Center, a trade show where all major buyers from national and local grocery stores find small businesses to onboard.  

·  Staff:

o  Hire sales professionals for in-store demo’s and farmers’ markets

o  Hire administrative support staff to help with daily tasks from finances & accounting to processing orders and making deliveries

o Hiring production staff to help in making the sauces once demand spikes. 


·  Warehousing and Distribution:

o  Rent a dedicated warehouse space to store sauces and enable production in larger quantities

o  Engage a professional distributor to satisfy growing number of orders placed outside of the tri-state area

o  Ramp up our production capacity as we prepare to expand to new Regional Store locations and other retail supermarket chains.


· Equipment and Shipping:

o  Replace household blender with industrial blender. Production of the Mango Chili Medley and Coco-For-Garlic sauces each require the blending of hundreds of pounds of produce – from fresh garlic to onions, Thai chilies, ginger and Scotch bonnet peppers. An industrial blender will greatly increase our production capacity and efficiency.

o  Acquire other specialized tools. A seed extractor for our TamarindOH! Sauce will extract seeds at a much faster pace and with better accuracy than the kitchen sieve we currently use.

o  We currently use standard shipping boxes that are not designed for our jars, which causes quite a number of accidents during shipping. New shipping boxes, quoted by our manufacturer and designed with our jars in mind, will fit the jars like a glove and reduce movement and accidents during shipment



·  Research and Development:

o  With a small team supporting the every day responsibilities of running Essie Spice, Essie can focus on conducting more research and introducing new and exciting products to the brand. Potential new products include the launch of four spice blends that will represent the four corners of Africa; East, West, South and North. Essie is also developing signature Essie Spice Milks, Nuts, Butters and Oils, that currently cannot be found anywhere but the African continent. Essie is also currently in talks with farmers in the Northern Regions of Ghana to introduce ancient grains like Millet, Sorghum and Fonio which have high nutritional value but are unavailable on the market.

 And she has also begun working with artisans and producers in Kumasi, Ghana to develop the Essie Spice Aprons and Pottery collection. Investing in and partnering with these artisans, who will receive all revenue directly, will impact their livelihoods and the livelihoods of entire communities in Kumasi.

For one little girl, the journey started in her mother's tiny kitchen in Ghana where her love affair with spice was ignited. Her flavorful journey continued all over the globe, spurred by her insatiable appetite for travel. She played with exotic palates; she tested cuisines, she concocted condiments. As her experiments with spices grew, so did the demand for her homemade sauces which all boiled down to what you now find in this jar: bottled up joy handed down through three generations to spice up your life. That little girl was Essie, and this is Essie Spice.

Spread the Spice Gospel

We have invested so much time and money to bring Essiespice to market. Now we need your support to get these sauces and other products of African origin to each household in America and beyond. 

Thanks so much for learning about Essie Spice, and for your support. Please spread the word about our campaign!

•  Tell your friends and family about this campaign and the exciting rewards we’re offering

•  Ask them to share our campaign with their networks using the IndieGoGo share tools!


PERKS & REWARDS FOR YOUR SUPPORT. 



SPICE CHEF- Apron (Female)

The Ultimate gift for the SUPER women in your life; Sister/Mom/Partner or Daughter. Vintage inspired aprons designed by Essie Bartels. Perfectly suited for outdoor/indoor cooking. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric 4 trim. Buttons are made of brass with Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanaian culture & style. Stylish pocket holds phone or spatula & is made of locally sourced leather. Hand stitched with artisans from Kumasi, Ghana; no mass production. Easy to wash & durable


SPICE BABY I - Apron (Girl)

Your little girl wants to help dad & mom in the kitchen. Perfectly suited for her little body & all the messes. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric for the trim. Buttons are made of brass with Traditional Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanainan culture & style. Hand stitched & crafted with artisans that work in Kumasi, Ghana. No mass production in China; made with the utmost care, right in the heart of Ghana by artists that know & love their work . Easy to wash & durable


SPICE COOK - Apron (Male)

The Ultimate gift for the SUPER men in your life; Brother/Dad/Partner or Son. Vintage inspired aprons designed by Essie Bartels. Perfectly suited for outdoor/indoor cooking. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric 4 trim. Buttons are made of brass with Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanaian culture & style. Stylish pocket holds phone or spatula & is made of locally sourced leather. Hand stitched with artisans from Kumasi, Ghana; no mass production. Easy to wash & durable


SPICE BABY II - Apron (Boy)

Your little guy wants to help dad & mom in the kitchen. Perfectly suited for his little body & all the messes. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric for the trim. Buttons are made of brass with Traditional Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanainan culture & style. Hand stitched & crafted with artisans that work in Kumasi, Ghana. No mass production in China; made with the utmost care, right in the heart of Ghana by artists that know & love their work . Easy to wash & durable

SPICE QUATTRO -Set of 4 Aprons

The Family that cooks together, eats together and stays together. Lets stay together with Essiespice . Get everyone decked out in their favorite aprons and impress your dinner and party guests with your impeccable style and support of local Ghanaian Artisans. These aren't mass produced in China... they are made with the utmost care and love, right in the heart of Ghana by artisits that know and love what they do. Easy to wash and durable .Bundle these 4 items and save


SPICE BUD - Female Spiced Out TShirts

Rock out to this 100% Cotton Tshirt for both sexes. Show pride & your fearless spicy attitude. Wear this one -of-a-kind shirt with confidence. This shirt is 100% Cotton and it's designed by Belgian-Ghanaian Artist Manoe Adusei- Sunkwa. It's colorful and symbolic of African style, headdress, neckpieces and fabric.


SPICE BUD -  Male Spiced Out TShirts

Rock out to this 100% Cotton Tshirt for both sexes. Show pride & your fearless spicy attitude. Wear this one -of-a-kind shirt with confidence. This shirt is 100% Cotton and it's designed by Belgian-Ghanaian Artist Manoe Adusei- Sunkwa. It's colorful and symbolic of African style, headdress, neckpieces and fabric.


SPICE GURU - Cooking Class

Come one, come all. This class will be held at the impeccable Hudson Kitchen in Hoboken, NJ for only 8 people. We will learn to make 4 dishes from scratch for a 4-course meal & Drinks. All fresh & natural ingredients using the Essiespice Essential Sauce Collection. Each participant goes home with sauces, & an Essiespice Tshirt not to mention the knowledge of 4 great West-African Style dishes to recreate later for friends & loved ones. Only 2 classes available.



SPICE FLOWER - Pottery

Made from red earth sourced directly from the Ashanti township in Kumasi, Ghana. This pottery set consists of a large serving bowl, a dinner plate and a mug. These are handmade ceramics that have a matte finished glaze This adds a beautiful touch of handmade elegance to the table with a history to match. The rim features a flourish of hand-painted genuine 18-carat gold finish.


SPICE FOODIE - Dinner in Accra

Essiespice + VillaGrace Gh come together to create a one-of-a-kind dinner soiree. This will be a 6 course dinner with unlimited cocktails featuring the best of the region, from spiced snails to fresh sugarcane water and freshly caught lobster. Event will be held in January 2017 for 20 people only.

Essiespice transforms the ordinary...mundane flavor most dishes suffer from, giving them a bold..exciting kick, pushing the boundaries of what flavorful eating is all about...and more. Each Sauce and flavorful spice from the Coco-for garlic...the Tamarind oh, and the Mango Medley...even the very aromatic Mekko dry rub....nothing could be finer than these delightful sauces  spicing up your meat, chicken or fish...not to mention a great vegetarian dip right from the bottle. Essie Spice gives you flavor with each choice you desire.... Pick some up and surprise your taste buds.Emmet Dennis - Chief Branding & Community Commerce Officer- Sundial BrandsWith this dynamic and innovative founder, you will also discover an infectious personality and an amazing work ethic in Essie Bartels. Essie Spice is a culturally authentic product with local global appeal.  The spices and sauce blends #breakthewalls of traditional cooking methods with influences from Asian, Caribbean, and South American, and Europe all in these special bottles. Sauces such as  “Tamarind OH!, Mango Chili Medley, and Coco-for Garlic will entice your tastebuds and enhance your daily dishes.  With a sustainable business model that is passionate about community empowerment and development,  Essie Spice is the next household brand name for your next artisanal food creation.”Chef Michael Zebrowski- Head Pastry Chef; Institute of Culinary Education, NYC."Essie has always demonstrated great dedication and a positive, mature attitude in her business endeavors. She is industrious and well-focused, and works with a professional mindset.I sampled and enjoyed her sauces and even used them in a few dishes. They were unique, traditional and full of robust flavor. I see her dedication to her business and her culinary education as a testament to the work she has put into the sauces. I look forward to greatness for Essie and her one-of-a-kind sauces.Chef Travis Schultz - Sous Chef; The Mansion at the MGM GrandInspired by the soulful foods of her heritage, Essie Bartels presents EssieSpice to the world. Her top-shelf artisan spice rubs, blends and sauces are inspired by her own family recipes that were passed down through generations. You can really taste the heart in what Essie is doing.  I was offered the wonderful opportunity to sample the EssieSpice product line, to which I was extremely satisfied. You can’t argue with good food, and your taste buds don’t lie. Every product I sampled exceed my expectations and tasted great  – and with food, that’s what matters most at the end of the day. I highly recommend EssieSpice products for anyone wanting to cook great food. The best part about all of the EssieSpice products is that they are ready to go out of the jar; no need for adjustments.  You don’t need to be a great chef to make great food when you have some EssieSpice in your back pocket or pantry. You just need to taste for yourself to understand. That’s real talk.
What Have We
Accomplished So Far?
From year 1 (in 2013) to year 2, Essie Spice doubled the sales
of our Essential Sauce Collection. During this time we also expanded our sales platform
beyond online orders to include six brick-and-mortar stores, farmers’ markets,
in-store demos and pop-up shops. Every Essie Spice in-store demo has resulted
in completely selling out of our on-site inventory.Increased media attention around our popular sauces, a growing social media
following (on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter), and exposure from attendance at
food events around the tri-state (NY, NJ, CT) area has translated to a
consistent growth in demand for Essie Spice sauces and spice blends. We have recently
received inquiries and finally landed shelf space from National Retailers Wholefoods Market and ShopRite Supermarkets. We are currently available for sale in the Brooklyn Wholefoods and the Englewood, NJ ShopRite Store. Wholefoods has over 430 stores and ShopRite has over 250 stores. We need to be able to raise the funds to ramp up production to meet demand. With your support we can grow our business to match this demand and begin
distributing our sauces to even wider audiences on a regional and national
scale.
Since our first year in business, we have donated 10% of the proceeds from our anniversary sale to nonprofit charities that are doing important work in communities around the world. Charities we have supported thus far include Medecins Sans Frontières/Doctors Without Borders, The Abide Family (Uganda), Tatas And Friends (Ghana), The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, and the Kili Summit for Clean Water under the African Development Initiative. As Essie Spice continues to grow our intention is to continue and to expand this important tradition of giving back to our communities.   
What’s the
Money For?
Since 2013 Essie Spice has been a labor of
love, and with the exception of many helpful friends and family, it has also
been a one-woman show. The excitement over and demand for our sauces continue
to grow, and we are poised to scale up our business and meet this need head on.
We plan to allocate resources from this successful campaign to the following business
areas below as we work to put our sauce and spice blends directly in the hands
of more consumers and to make Essie Spice a household name.
· 
Marketing:  
o 
Increase visibility and
social media presence through higher frequency of posts and paid advertisements
o 
Create digital content in
the form of how-to cooking videos
o 
Partner with restaurants
in NYC and beyond to promote brand
o 
Obtain a booth at the
2017 Fancy Food Show at NYC’s Javits Center, a trade show where all major
buyers from national and local grocery stores find small businesses to onboard.  
· 
Staff: 
o 
Hire sales professionals
for in-store demo’s and farmers’ markets
o 
Hire administrative support
staff to help with daily tasks from finances & accounting to processing
orders and making deliverieso Hiring production staff to help in making the sauces once demand spikes. 
·  Warehousing and
Distribution:
o 
Rent a dedicated
warehouse space to store sauces and enable production in larger quantities
o 
Engage a professional distributor
to satisfy growing number of orders placed outside of the tri-state area
o 
Ramp up our production
capacity as we prepare to expand to new Regional Store locations and other retail
supermarket chains. 
· Equipment and Shipping:
o 
Replace household blender
with industrial blender. Production of the Mango Chili Medley and
Coco-For-Garlic sauces each require the blending of hundreds of pounds of
produce – from fresh garlic to onions, Thai chilies, ginger and Scotch bonnet
peppers. An industrial blender will greatly increase our production capacity and
efficiency. 
o 
Acquire other specialized
tools. A seed extractor for our TamarindOH! Sauce will extract seeds at a much
faster pace and with better accuracy than the kitchen sieve we currently use. 
o 
We currently use standard
shipping boxes that are not designed for our jars, which causes quite a number
of accidents during shipping. New shipping boxes, quoted by our manufacturer
and designed with our jars in mind, will fit the jars like a glove and reduce movement
and accidents during shipment
· 
Research and Development:
o 
With a small team
supporting the every day responsibilities of running Essie Spice, Essie can
focus on conducting more research and introducing new and exciting products to
the brand. Potential new products include the launch of four spice blends that
will represent the four corners of Africa; East, West, South and North. Essie
is also developing signature Essie Spice Milks, Nuts, Butters and Oils, that
currently cannot be found anywhere but the African continent. Essie is also currently in talks with farmers in the Northern Regions of Ghana to introduce ancient grains like Millet, Sorghum and Fonio which have high nutritional value but are unavailable on the market. And she has also
begun working with artisans and producers in Kumasi, Ghana to develop the Essie
Spice Aprons and Pottery collection. Investing in and partnering with these
artisans, who will receive all revenue directly, will impact their livelihoods
and the livelihoods of entire communities in Kumasi.
For one little girl, the journey started in her mother's tiny
kitchen in Ghana where her love affair with spice was ignited. Her
flavorful journey continued all over the globe, spurred by her insatiable
appetite for travel. She played with exotic palates; she tested cuisines,
she concocted condiments. As her experiments with spices grew, so did the
demand for her homemade sauces which all boiled down to what you now find in
this jar: bottled up joy handed down through three generations to spice up your
life. That little girl was Essie, and this is Essie Spice.
Spread the Spice Gospel
We have invested so much time and money to bring Essiespice to market. Now we need your support to get these sauces and other products of African origin to each household in America and beyond. Thanks so much for learning about Essie Spice,
and for your support. Please spread the word about our campaign! 
• 
Tell your friends and
family about this campaign and the exciting rewards we’re offering
• 
Ask them to share our
campaign with their networks using the IndieGoGo share tools!PERKS & REWARDS FOR YOUR SUPPORT. SPICE CHEF- Apron (Female)
The Ultimate gift for the SUPER women in your life; Sister/Mom/Partner or Daughter. Vintage inspired aprons designed by Essie Bartels. Perfectly suited for outdoor/indoor cooking. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric 4 trim. Buttons are made of brass with Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanaian culture & style. Stylish pocket holds phone or spatula & is made of locally sourced leather. Hand stitched with artisans from Kumasi, Ghana; no mass production. Easy to wash & durable





SPICE BABY I - Apron (Girl)


Your little girl wants to help dad & mom in the kitchen. Perfectly suited for her little body & all the messes. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric for the trim. Buttons are made of brass with Traditional Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanainan culture & style. Hand stitched & crafted with artisans that work in Kumasi, Ghana. No mass production in China; made with the utmost care, right in the heart of Ghana by artists that know & love their work . Easy to wash & durable





SPICE COOK - Apron (Male)


The Ultimate gift for the SUPER men in your life; Brother/Dad/Partner or Son. Vintage inspired aprons designed by Essie Bartels. Perfectly suited for outdoor/indoor cooking. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric 4 trim. Buttons are made of brass with Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanaian culture & style. Stylish pocket holds phone or spatula & is made of locally sourced leather. Hand stitched with artisans from Kumasi, Ghana; no mass production. Easy to wash & durable





SPICE BABY II - Apron (Boy)

Your little guy wants to help dad & mom in the kitchen. Perfectly suited for his little body & all the messes. Apron is 100% Cotton with accents of Malian Bogolan fabric for the trim. Buttons are made of brass with Traditional Adinkra Symbols showing Ghanainan culture & style. Hand stitched & crafted with artisans that work in Kumasi, Ghana. No mass production in China; made with the utmost care, right in the heart of Ghana by artists that know & love their work . Easy to wash & durable



SPICE QUATTRO -Set of 4 Aprons

The Family that cooks together, eats together and stays together. Lets stay together with Essiespice . Get everyone decked out in their favorite aprons and impress your dinner and party guests with your impeccable style and support of local Ghanaian Artisans. These aren't mass produced in China... they are made with the utmost care and love, right in the heart of Ghana by artisits that know and love what they do. Easy to wash and durable .Bundle these 4 items and save




SPICE BUD - Female Spiced Out TShirts

Rock out to this 100% Cotton Tshirt for both sexes. Show pride & your fearless spicy attitude. Wear this one -of-a-kind shirt with confidence. This shirt is 100% Cotton and it's designed by Belgian-Ghanaian Artist Manoe Adusei- Sunkwa. It's colorful and symbolic of African style, headdress, neckpieces and fabric.





SPICE BUD -  Male Spiced Out TShirts

Rock out to this 100% Cotton Tshirt for both sexes. Show pride & your fearless spicy attitude. Wear this one -of-a-kind shirt with confidence. This shirt is 100% Cotton and it's designed by Belgian-Ghanaian Artist Manoe Adusei- Sunkwa. It's colorful and symbolic of African style, headdress, neckpieces and fabric.






SPICE GURU - Cooking Class

Come one, come all. This class will be held at the impeccable Hudson Kitchen in Hoboken, NJ for only 8 people. We will learn to make 4 dishes from scratch for a 4-course meal & Drinks. All fresh & natural ingredients using the Essiespice Essential Sauce Collection. Each participant goes home with sauces, & an Essiespice Tshirt not to mention the knowledge of 4 great West-African Style dishes to recreate later for friends & loved ones. Only 2 classes available.








SPICE FLOWER - Pottery

Made from red earth sourced directly from the Ashanti township in Kumasi, Ghana. This pottery set consists of a large serving bowl, a dinner plate and a mug. These are handmade ceramics that have a matte finished glaze This adds a beautiful touch of handmade elegance to the table with a history to match. The rim features a flourish of hand-painted genuine 18-carat gold finish.






SPICE FOODIE - Dinner in Accra

Essiespice + VillaGrace Gh come together to create a one-of-a-kind dinner soiree. This will be a 6 course dinner with unlimited cocktails featuring the best of the region, from spiced snails to fresh sugarcane water and freshly caught lobster. Event will be held in January 2017 for 20 people only.

story:
Our History

Think of shapes: Imagine you are a circle, living in Circle Country. Then you move to Square Society. You will never become a Square, but that culture starts to embed itself in you. When the time comes to return to your Circle Country (home), you have become a Triangle.

When you become a Triangle, you no longer share common things with your friends and family. You no longer identify with the cultural norms of the place from which you came, but now share a bit of your heart and soul with the places you’ve now also called home. At the same time, you are expected to fit in the same hole when you return to your passport country. Even something as simple as the words you use to describe an experience or your very diverse food palate can set you apart.

I Am a Triangle Founder Naomi Hattaway recognized a need, the need for a community of others who said "me too!"  The Triangle tribe was started in July of 2014 with just 30 members. It began as a tight-knit community discussing the woes of repatriation using Facebook as a platform for support and encouragement.


Our Present Day

Since its beginning in 2014, the I Am a Triangle community has quickly grown to over 8,000 members, from all around the world representing various cultures and countries, who discuss much more than just repatriation. I Am a Triangle community is currently managed and administrated by Naomi Hattaway and Bethany Davidson-Widby. 

The I Am a Triangle community has outgrown the Facebook platform.  Our members spoke, with requests and ideas and expressed needs, and we listened. 

The Future

I Am a Triangle, Inc. will launch its web-based platform on or around January 1, 2017. 

The web-based platform will allow the community to expand and connect more effectively and efficiently.  While some of the content found at the IAAT website will be available to non-members, a large amount of content will only be available to members of the I Am a Triangle community with yearly subscriptions. We want to continue to provide a safe and comfortable environment for our members to share, learn, and grown. 

Members of the I Am A Triangle website will have access to members-only pages which include, but are not limited to: location, group, and topic specific forums, membership directory, writing opportunities, workshops, courses, advertising/classifieds, member news, and an online shop.

Why Are We Raising Capital?

A large amount of professional time and effort is going into the creation of the new platform, and countless hours are devoted to the day to day growth, administration, and overall leadership of the IAAT community.  Membership fees will be used to cover the upfront costs of the launch, as well as costs associated with the day to day operations of I Am a Triangle.  These costs include but are not limited to: website development and hosting, logo creation and trademarking, marketing, operations and administration, legal fees, workshop/course development and hosting, in-person community gatherings and conferences, featured speakers, writer and journalist contributions, and more.  A portion of all membership fees will be donated to various humanitarian non-governmental organizations around the world, with a spotlight on a different organization each month.  We are committed to ensuring that the I Am a Triangle community will meet the needs of our members for years to come.

story:
Reliant Credit Repair: The End of Bad Credit

Hello, my name is Adam Mhrez and I am here to tell you about “Reliant Credit Repair”.  Getting denied by a bank, lender or even department store for a loan can be deflating.  You have paid you bills on time most of the time, you don’t know what you did or can do to get into the world of borrowing.  The hardest part about credit is learning all the ins and outs of the credit score and most importantly how do you fix it.  Having bad credit can keep you from getting a car, a home and yes even certain jobs.

As you can probably relate, hearing the word “denied” is an awful, helpless feeling. That is why I have created “Reliant Credit Repair” and now anyone can easily and effectively fix their credit with our professional help and methods. “Reliant Credit Repair” is an online agency dedicated to helping people clean up their credit score so they can apply for the car or home of their dreams without the worries of being denied.

The goal of this campaign is to reach like-minded people for collaboration, raise money in exchange for early access and rewards, and we also want to spread the word.  The more people we can get using “Reliant Credit Repair” the more functional and successful it will be.  So this campaign will give you the basics on our efforts and progress.  Beyond that we encourage you to ask us questions, donate and get involved.  We developed “Reliant Credit Repair” for your benefit, so enjoy!  We believe we are really onto an easier way to fix your credit with a fraction of the work.

Have you ever been denied for a loan?

Do you want to have a good credit score so you can have a credit card, home and car?

Are you interested in fixing some old errors and mistakes on your credit report but don’t have the time?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

We Make Getting a Good Credit Score Simple!

Welcome to the new and improved way to fix your credit score and report with the click of a button with “Reliant Credit Repair”.  We developed an online platform designed to make getting your credit score back on track a breeze. Current credit repair options come with long-term contracts and 90+ days before you see results, well not anymore. With our platform you can ensure your credit report is free of false charges and allegations!  “Reliant Credit Repair” allows people to take advantage of our simple process that gets results; don’t let your credit score hold you back another day and get started with Reliant today.  We won’t quit until we see the results, we are committed to you and your score!

Our popular culture reinforces the idea that fixing your credit score and report is hard, time consuming and sometimes not worthwhile. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Reliant Credit Repair” client at a time! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in need of a solution for a negative mark on your credit report. As little as $19.99 gets a “Reliant Credit Repair” account started for an individual and can change their ideas about what they can accomplish for the rest of his or her life when they have the ability to get and keep a loan.  Finding out your report can be fixed with ease will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

The biggest issue with having bad credit is all the ways that it affects your life, today and in the future:

1.  High interest rates on your credit cards and loans

2.  Credit and loan applications may not be approved

3.  Difficulty getting approved for an apartment

4.  Security deposits on utilities

5.  You can't get a cell phone contract

6.  You might get denied for employment

7.  Higher insurance premiums

8.  Calls from debt collectors

9.  Difficulty starting your own business

10.  Difficulty purchasing a car

Most people don’t even realize all the implications of a poor score.  But not knowing is not the key, it is time to take control of your score.

Thirty seven percent of people do not even know their own credit score even though it impacts so many parts of their life.– This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution.  That is why we have direct access to the credit bureaus, ability to remove negative items from credit reports in the first 30 days, and we have an open door policy so our customers/clients can walk in and speak with us locally with plans to open offices in NYC, Ohio, Florida, Nebraska, Texas, & California. We are making this taboo topic something that anyone can approach.  This is where we started to envision “Reliant Credit Repair” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

1.  Increased credit limits

2.  Ability to get credit, home loans and car loans

3. Attractive mortgage rates

4.  More negotiating power

When reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to live a life of options.  Our features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed in the industry.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the industry. Our mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our growth.

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s effective and simple for your credit resolution needs. Our company will run the business based on our mission statement of providing everyone with quality, fast service.  I myself have been doing credit repair for 5 years, I did it for free for friends and family and realized that there is a huge market for this and I should take a bite of the market share. I studied computer information systems and worked for many major companies like IBM, Liz Claiborne, Inc, Elie Tahari, LTD, and Giorgio Armani, Inc with titles ranging from IT Support Analyst, Project Management, and Management. I realized that I like working with people and helping to make a difference in peoples lives

How You Can Help

For us to bring “Reliant Credit Repair” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of “Reliant Credit Repair”.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.

We will also be using the funding to:

·  Expand the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise solutions of the “Reliant Credit Repair”

·  Further customize the first version of the “Reliant Credit Repair”

·  Create additional products and services that will compliment “Reliant Credit Repair”

“Reliant Credit Repair” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about $35,000 in order to bring “Reliant Credit Repair” onto the market. That will include marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up.

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Reliant Credit Repair” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

Contributions...

Your generosity and support could make all the difference in the fruition of “Reliant Credit Repair”. 

It would be great to have 35 people to contribute $1,000. But in reality, 1000 people contributing $5 would work too.  Of course you may contribute more.  I will be eternally grateful!  Please share this with anyone you think would be willing to help. 

Old school?  No Problem!

For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via email: (Support@ReliantCreditRepair.com) and I will provide you with a mailing address to send a check or money order to.  I will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like.

Also...

You do not have to have a PayPal account.  They accept credit cards and debit cards.

Please help spread the word!

This has proven to be one of the hardest things I have ever done.  I don't have a million friends to share this with.  But, I have the Internet and wonderful people who want to see me succeed. Whether or not you contribute financially, please use the share tools on this page. Tweeting, sharing on Facebook or any other venues you have at your disposal will greatly enhance our exposure and increase our chances to succeed.  I'm asking for 5 minutes of your time, a $5 contribution, and 5 personal emails.

Here's the link to the Facebook page: Facebook.com/ReliantCreditRepair

Please like and share it.  Feel free to leave a message also.

If you wish to contact us:

Website: www.ReliantCreditRepair.com

Our Social Media Connections:

Instagram: Reliant_Credit

Twitter: @ReliantCredit

Facebook: Facebook.com/ReliantCreditRepair

Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/139036871

Contact Information

Name: Adam Mhrez

Phone Number: 973-500-6860 Ext, 101

E Mail: Adam.Mhrez@ReliantCreditRepair.com

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at Support@ReliantCreditRepair.com

that fixing your credit score and report is hard, time consuming and sometimes
not worthwhile. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Reliant Credit
Repair” client at a time! Help us establish this initiative to serve people in
need of a solution for a negative mark on your credit report. As little as $19.99
gets a “Reliant Credit Repair” account started for an individual and can change
their ideas about what they can
accomplish for the rest of his or her life when they have the ability to
get and keep a loan.  Finding out your
report can be fixed with ease will be life changing. Empower us to make
this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

The biggest
issue with having bad credit is all the ways that it affects your life, today
and in the future:
1.  High interest rates on your credit cards and
loans
2.  Credit and loan applications may not be
approved
3.  Difficulty getting approved for an apartment
4.  Security deposits on utilities
5.  You can't get a cell phone contract
6.  You might get denied for employment
7.  Higher insurance premiums
8.  Calls from debt collectors
9.  Difficulty starting your own business
10.  Difficulty purchasing a car
Most people
don’t even realize all the implications of a poor score.  But not knowing is not the key, it is time to
take control of your score.

Thirty seven percent of
people do not even know their own credit score even though it impacts so many
parts of their life.– This fact
prompted us to dig deeper into a solution. 
That is why we have direct access to the credit bureaus, ability to
remove negative items from credit reports in the first 30 days, and we have an
open door policy so our customers/clients can walk in and speak with us locally
with plans to open offices in NYC, Ohio, Florida, Nebraska, Texas, &
California. We are making this taboo topic something that anyone can
approach.  This is where we started to
envision “Reliant Credit Repair” and all the possible benefits we could bring
to people:
1.  Increased credit limits
2.  Ability to get credit, home loans and car
loans
3. Attractive mortgage
rates
4.  More negotiating power
When
reviewing these benefits, features and much more, it inspired and assured us
that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel if executed properly
we can reach a large market of people in need of an easier way to live a life
of options.  Our features will make us
incredibly qualified to succeed in the industry.  This paired with attention to detail and
quality service will make us a key player if not leader in the industry. Our
mission is to take care of every funder, supporter and customer with the upmost
respect and care.  We feel this will be
the key to our growth.

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched
solution that’s
effective and simple for your credit resolution needs. Our
company will run the business based on our mission statement of providing
everyone with quality, fast service.  I
myself have been doing credit repair for 5 years, I did it for free for friends
and family and realized that there is a huge market for this and I should take
a bite of the market share. I studied computer information systems and worked
for many major companies like IBM, Liz Claiborne, Inc, Elie Tahari, LTD, and
Giorgio Armani, Inc with titles ranging from IT Support Analyst, Project
Management, and Management. I realized that I like working with people and
helping to make a difference in peoples lives 
How You Can Help
For us to bring “Reliant Credit
Repair” to life, we need your support!
Your generous funding will help us get
things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost
of further development, manufacturing and production. More importantly you get
the chance to be one of the first users of “Reliant Credit Repair”.  We will also use our funding to test our
concept to make it better.  We are
committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best
possible solutions.
We will also be using the funding to: 
· 
Expand
the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise solutions
of the “Reliant Credit Repair”
· 
Further
customize the first version of the “Reliant Credit Repair” 
· 
Create
additional products and services that will compliment “Reliant Credit Repair”
“Reliant Credit Repair” needs
pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this
product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our
social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page).
Help us spread the word and get things started!
How We'll Use the Funds
We need about $35,000 in
order to bring “Reliant Credit Repair” onto the market. That will include marketing,
materials, labor and related expenses for start-up. 

We feel so grateful to everyone who has
taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they
could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working
hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute
thanks to all our generous supporters. 
Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what
your donation helped us achieve.  You are
part of our “Reliant Credit Repair” family.
If you cannot donate but you are
interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral
program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!
Contributions...
Your generosity and support could make
all the difference in the fruition of “Reliant Credit Repair”.  
It would be great to have 35 people to
contribute $1,000. But in reality, 1000 people contributing $5 would work
too.  Of course you may contribute more.  I will be eternally grateful!  Please share this with anyone you think would
be willing to help.  
Old
school?  No Problem!
For those of us who don't like making
donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact me via email: (Support@ReliantCreditRepair.com) and I will provide you with a mailing address to send a check or money
order to.  I will post your contribution
on the campaign with your name and I will deliver whatever perk you would like.

Also...
You do not have to have a PayPal
account.  They accept credit cards and
debit cards.
Please help spread the word!
This has proven to be one of the
hardest things I have ever done.  I don't
have a million friends to share this with. 
But, I have the Internet and wonderful people who want to see me
succeed. Whether or not you contribute financially, please use the share tools
on this page. Tweeting, sharing on Facebook or any other venues you have at
your disposal will greatly enhance our exposure and increase our chances to
succeed.  I'm asking for 5 minutes of your
time, a $5 contribution, and 5 personal emails.
Here's the link to the Facebook page: Facebook.com/ReliantCreditRepair
Please like and share it.  Feel free to leave a message also.
If you wish to contact us:
Website: www.ReliantCreditRepair.com
Our Social Media Connections:
Instagram: Reliant_Credit
Twitter: @ReliantCredit
Facebook: Facebook.com/ReliantCreditRepair
Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/139036871
Contact
Information
Name: Adam Mhrez
Phone Number: 973-500-6860 Ext, 101
E Mail: Adam.Mhrez@ReliantCreditRepair.com
If you have thoughts or would like to discuss
a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel
free to contact us at Support@ReliantCreditRepair.com

story:
Short Summary

  •  Dealzpro was founded to help consumers get the best possible prices on big ticket items like televisions, furniture, and appliances. Unfortunately, we cannot disclose our big reveal for being the most innovative shopping website because we need to protect the idea until we get the funds to start it!
  • Contributors will help us get our dream and business up and going!

What We Need & What You Get

  •  We need $2500 to help get our company of the ground to purchase trade marks, copyrights, business licences, and other very important tools to make this business successful.
  • We are still early in the development stage and it's too soon to give too much information about the site yet, but we can say that this will make purchasing and price checking a thousand times easier.
  •  The funds will still go to what we need, but we're gonna have to try more avenues of raising money.

The Impact

  •  It will save consumers hundreds on everyday purchases.
  •  We believe it will change the way online shopping is handled.

Risks & Challenges

  •  We have the brains, mindset, and dedication to get through anything!
  •  We work as a team to get through them, but to be honest, we do not see any real risks because we have planned and gone over the worst case scenarios and there's still a good business that has not been done yet.

Game Plan

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We want help from everyone.  Sure, donations are helpful, but once the site is up,  giving us your feedback is how we will strive to become the better.
  •  Remember to share this with all of your friends and help us, DealzPro to get $2500!
  • If you have any questions contact us at (contact@dealzpro.com) we can't wait to hear from you!

story:
Hello, I would like to thank you for reading what I am passionate about and hope that you will help me and our team by contributing to our project.

I have the privilege of introducing to you the world's 8th business model "The Giving Cycle Business Model". We are looking forward to completing the building of our platform on which it shall function.

The design of the model and how it actually works is amazingly simple but uniquely different from all of the other 7 major business models known. It has the ability to become self-sustaining and is able to live up to all of the claims I make regarding it.  Feel free to visit our website and know that together, we can make a difference.  Individuals, businesses, and nonprofits will each benefit in many ways and benefit each other as well.    

The middle class has always been the engine that has been the driver of our nation's success. Do you believe that America's Middle Class is shrinking?  The unemployment rate is much higher than what has been reported by our government.  Many have lost ( or been laid off)  from their jobs.  Wages for most American's have been declining for over a decade.  Income inequality has continued to rise and health care costs to soar. Do you believe that real change is needed?   If you have answered yes to any of the questions above, then help us by contributing to our funding campaign, and thereby begin to help us restore the American Middle Class and the Sovereignty of the Individual in our country! If You agree that the multiple problems faced by our society today have affected You and Your family, join us now, and become part of the SOLUTION.  We can "Restore America's Middle Class" using "The Giving Cycle Business Model". benefiting all Americans so that America will see better days ahead of her.

Power + Money + People are the tools that get things done and cause changes to occur.  With your help and God's help, we'll bring about changes that will benefit us all in positive ways. Help us achieve our goal.

Please also share with your friends. God Bless America!

Thank you - The Victory In Giving Team! 

Victory In Giving LLC / TheGivingCycle.org

Visit;  www.thegivingcycle.org

We are offering you an awesome perk from one of our Team Members, Josserand Ace ConsultinG. Please take note of this perk featured on this page. It is a $2500 value to only 10 people who contribute at least $99!
