story:
Michelle's Meditation

My name is Michelle Walsh. I am a certified meditation instructor. I began practicing meditation about a year ago, and it has had a powerful, positive  on impact me, and has dramatically changed my life. I am looking to raise funds to invest into my small business so that I am able to provide meditation services, and to teach others how to meditate, so that they can also experience the many benefits meditation has to offer and improve their quality of life. By supporting me in my dream, you will be helping me provide these services in my local area, and also to reach other areas remotely, as well.

I am looking to raise $1000 to purchase equipment and supplies, cover the costs of advertising, rent locations, and help cover the costs of reaching people remotely. I want to reach as many people as I can, no matter the location.

By teaching meditation, I am helping people relax, de-stress, improve their overall quality of life, so that they too can reach their goals and dreams. I've had a very successful and overwhelming response to the services I've been able to offer so far. I've held 2 hour workshops, 6 week courses, and provide one on one sessions, and am wanting to expand on this by reaching people remotely by phone and over the internet. 

I am continually looking for new ways to be able to provide these services. This is my dream. I am passionate, determined, and driven.

Any amount of help you can provide to help me achieve my dream would be greatly appreciated. Please, spread the word and share my campaign with others. I am really excited about this and want to reach out to and help as many people as I possibly can.

Thank you so much for believing in me and supporting my dream.

Michelle

story:
Short Summary:

Hi everyone,

We decided to launch the idea of commercializing insects into many forms of products. But before we go further into this area, we will like to introduce you the team we have built for this amazing experience:

The handsome guy (Bachir El Awad) you see on the video and I (Maxandre Perron-Deschênes) have met at HEC Montreal 2 years ago while we were just starting our bachelor in business. It will have been impossible for us to may be considered that we will have a common project for our future, but most of all a common vision of society. A vision where everyone can have access to an evironment that fit with the respect of human being and nature. Yes, that's what we want and this is the design we think we need to implement on Earth.

Throughout this plan, we also want to promote an ideal where goodness is the main driver for our business. Too many times, the business world has fallen into the trap of capitalism and we can now see the consequence of it: lack of communication, trust, self-honesty and social justice among everyplace this system flourish. In the name of progress, we are not talking, but in the name of humanity we want to share this ideal with you. Concretely, it means that we will create a business plan where our entity will directly share resources with a non -profit organization that is operating in relation with the food industry. Thus, all the profit we will make out of our activities are going to be redirected into the business and the surplus into the non-profit organization that would create a synergy with our business.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Considering that we are now building our network and ideas that are gravitating around a vision that's gradually constructed, we would like to invite you to give our share constructive comments about our project. All the money will be invested into the conception of our products, such as protein bars, pasta and bread.
  • We know it's soon to ask some donation, and you are right, there's no concrecity right now, but by the 8th of August we will post some informations that will make you think twice about the gravity of the impact our social business.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will directly redistribute the money to a Non-Profit Organization that's operating in the food sector. We will make sure this non-profit organization is good for community and that's a strong symbol of social justice by bringing food for the one that didn't have the chance to have an healthy diner to start the day.

 The Impact:

  • The social way of doing business is at the core of how we want to impact people's mentality. As we said, all the profit will be maintained into the operational and investing activities and we will also arrange a partnership with an Non-Profit Organization in order to create a synergy between us and the organization chosen.

 Challenges

  •  During the conception and application of our project we will have many challenges and it would be a real pleasure to outwork them, here are some of them to give you a global picture of what we need to do:

       1) Conceptualisation: Build a solid framework that rely on social values.

       2) Gather Information: Expand our knowledge on the different options of making our products made with insects.

       3) Conceive the Ideal Product: Get in touch with many experts to conceive the ideal products, such as cooks, nutritionist and scientist.

       4) Build a Social Network: Get in touch with all the supplier chain in order to make sure they fit with our social mind set that will reduce negative extarnality produce by our activity.

       5) Market the Business: Inform our potential consumers through different sources of media: social media, email, and be to be that will take place into different environment, such as college, university, sport events and many others.




Other Ways You Can Help

  • For the others that have watched the video and  read the brief description of our project and that are still not convinced by us. I invite you to leave your comments and get in touch directly with us via the platform. All the ideas are more than welcome, but most of all your implication into this project would be amazing and Trust me you will have huge amount of fun working with us.
  • Oh yes and do not forget to use Indiegogo share tools, apparently it's good for our marketing ;)

story:
We started Tom Cridland, our fashion brand, with a £6,000 government start-up loan 2 years ago when we were 23. We have campaigned extensively for sustainability in the industry with The 30 Year Sweatshirt and designing clothing is true labour of love for us.

We are keen to give back and support aspiring young entrepreneurs, as well as those in the developing world who deserve the opportunity to start businesses and work their way out of poverty. We also want to campaign for a greater focus on nurturing entrepreneurial talent and providing basic business training in our education systems across the world.

In this spirit, 5% of The Entrepreneur’s Shirt campaign will be donated to Young Enterprise to inspire and equip young people in Britain to learn and succeed through entrepreneurial endeavour. Based on research statistics published by FreshMinds, students who participate in Young Enterprise programmes have a better understanding of business than their peers and are twice as likely to start-up their own company. 

Small businesses are the lifeblood of any healthy economy and, yet, in the developing world it is nigh on impossible for many people to have the chance to work their way out of poverty through entrepreneurship. 

DEKI is a revolutionary charity that changes that and a further 5% of The Entrepreneur’s Shirt campaign will also be donated to them to help them give people in countries like this the chance to create sustainable livelihoods by providing access to micro-grants and business training.

Together we can provide greater support to aspiring entrepreneurs who need it and lead a trend towards greater business training in our education systems. As our video demonstrates, this will only be possible with your help!

Choose a shirt in your favourite colour and you’ll have made a difference. Thank you so much for your support, it means so much to us and we can’t wait to deliver you The Entrepreneur’s Shirt.

About Young Enterprise

There’s a crisis in the UK. Youth unemployment is having a devastating impact on today’s young people. With 70% of employers reporting that school leavers are not work ready and nearly one million young people without a job, we want to ensure that the talent and potential of our young people is not lost. In order to do this we need to address the lack of practical business education in our schools and create a skilled and prepared workforce. 

We believe each young person should leave education having developed skills and experience in communication, team working, problem solving, creativity and resilience which can be developed through Young Enterprise. Their programmes offer a journey from gaining knowledge through to developing skills and changing attitudes, arming young people with the confidence to aim high and the knowledge and skills to succeed. Today’s young people are facing an uncertain future. Each year Young Enterprise empowers over 200,000 under 25s to realise their potential, but there are hundreds of thousands more who need their help.

5% of your pledge for The Entrepreneur's Shirt will go directly to giving young people in the UK invaluable business training, something Tom Cridland want to support as the brand itself was started with a £6,000 government start-up loan just two years ago.

About DEKI

Right now millions of families around the world are facing a daily struggle of poverty. This means parents are unable to afford regular meals, clean water, basic healthcare and education for their children. 18% of children in Uganda never go to school and 66% will never complete their education. In Malawi, 50% of children under five are suffering from malnutrition. To compound this daily struggle, social inequalities often block individual's. In South Sudan, for example, women are unable to access bank loans to help kick-start their their businesses due to gender discrimination. 

DEKI is a microfinance charity that believes in opportunity not poverty. They provide ethical micro-loans and business training to people in Africa offering a vital hand up rather than a handout. Through DEKI, individual lenders have the opportunity to lend from just £10 directly via the crowdfunding website deki.org.uk. 100% of all money lent goes directly to the chosen entrepreneur and lenders are paid on average in 12 months. Even a small initial investment can help a number of people to raise themselves out of poverty. With the capital to start a business, DEKI entrepreneurs cannot only turn their lives around, they can lift others around them out of poverty too. This is shown through improved communal access to secure sources of food and clean water, education, healthcare and employment.

5% of your pledge for The Entrepreneur's Shirt will go directly to an entrepreneur in the developing world as a micro-grant and not a micro-loan, as Tom Cridland do not expect to be repaid for their donation to DEKI.

About Tom Cridland

Tom Cridland is an international sustainable fashion brand with customers on six continents, known for producing luxury clothing in unique colours.

Tom has been designing clothing since the age of 18, when he sold nearly £3,000 worth of "SWINE 09" t-shirts in a single week of school and donated all the profits to Médecins Sans Frontières.

In January 2014, aged 23, he founded Tom Cridland, specialising solely in creating the perfect pair of trousers. He quickly built a vertical luxury menswear brand that specialises in what CNBC describe as "quality over quantity retail". Tom believes that retail markups are inefficient and unfair on the customer, who ends up paying higher prices for no reason.

Tom founded his eponymous menswear brand upon the simple principle of making truly luxurious clothing and selling it direct to customer online and, as THE GUARDIAN said, "high-spec material and production seem to be his thing". 

The EVENING STANDARD describe Tom as "a tailor to the stars" and, indeed, Tom Cridland trousers have quickly become well known from London to Los Angeles and, as FORBES note, have been "donned by celebrities such as Leonardo DiCaprio, Hugh Grant, Stephen Fry, and Daniel Craig". Tom Cridland have also made clothing for the likes of Ben Stiller, Jeremy Piven, Rod Stewart, Nigel Olsson, Brandon Flowers, Robbie Williams, Nile Rodgers, Michael Portillo, Stephen Merchant, Frankie Valli, Neil Young, Danny McBride, Miley Cyrus, Clint Eastwood and Kendrick Lamar.

In 2015, Tom launched The 30 Year Sweatshirt, a sustainable fashion project in the form of a luxury cotton crewneck backed up with a 30 Year Guarantee. This was acclaimed by everyone from the BBC to THE INDEPENDENT to THE HUFFINGTON POST and Tom continued this momentum by launching The 30 Year T-Shirt immediately afterwards. THE TIMES noted this was "a campaign against planned obsolescence in the fashion industry" and THE TELEGRAPH praised the project highly, saying "Tom Cridland is back with his most ambitious project to date: a t-shirt that will not show any signs of wear and tear until 2045." Praise in newspapers was matched by television coverage, with features on CBS NEWS, REUTERS and NBC's THE TODAY SHOW.

2015 also saw word spread internationally about the Tom Cridland brand and the 30 Year projects, with coverage including SYDNEY MORNING HERALD, EL PAIS, CCTV and THE HINDUSTAN TIMES. Tom was also invited to write regularly for THE HUFFINGTON POST and now has his own column on the website.

2016 began with the opening of the first ever Tom Cridland bricks and mortar shop, a pop-up located on the iconic King's Road in London throughout January and February. BBC NEWS were present on its first day to record an in depth interview with Tom about his 30 Year Collection.

The 30 Year Jacket was released at the end of February and featured in both FORBES and THE GUARDIAN, with the latter citing that the Tom Cridland brand is "...appealing to a new consumer". THE TELEGRAPH cited The 30 Year Jacket as evidence that "menswear can lead the race for sustainable fashion", whilst praising Tom Cridland's attempts at creating timeless clothing as “faultless".

Tom Cridland's buy less, buy better philosophy also caused a stir in the United States early this year, with both THE NEW YORK TIMES and THE ATLANTIC featuring it in their publications ahead of the brand's official American hard launch from their new base in Los Angeles in March. Tom subsequently embarked on a US promotional tour in April, appearing across national television and radio including NBC, CBS and National Public Radio.

Tom Cridland was then a finalist in the Cool Companies Competition hosted by FORTUNE in California in May, with the magazine arguing if "more designers were like Cridland, one day “fast fashion,” could be as “out” as last season’s designs are today". Hot on the heels of the competition, Tom and The 30 Year T-Shirt were then featured on FOX NEWS and then, in June, in THE IRISH TIMES, DAILY EXPRESS, IL SOLE 24 ORE and, again, in the DAILY MAIL and on CNBC.

June also saw Tom Cridland included in the Sustainia100 and nominated for the international Sustainia Award for The 30 Year Sweatshirt. A committee led by Arnold Schwarzenegger reviewed businesses and sustainable solutions across the planet, with over 4,500 on the year’s long list, before choosing the final Sustainia100.

Tom Cridland were highlighted, post-Brexit, in July in the DAILY EXPRESS as an example of a UK business "going full-steam ahead with plans for growth in the aftermath" and, during the same month, BLOOMBERG, reviewed The 30 Year Sweatshirt as "The Only Sweatshirt You'll Ever Own". 

At Tom Cridland we are passionate about building a brand slowly, working up to a full line but developing every product meticulously before launching it. As FAST COMPANY described what Tom Cridland offer, "...there's now more choices for people who want ethical, relatively affordable clothes that are built to last".
story_txt:
We started Tom Cridland, our fashion brand, with a £6,000 government start-up loan 2 years ago when we were 23. We have campaigned extensively for sustainability in the industry with The 30 Year Sweatshirt and designing clothing is true labour of love for us.
We are keen to give back and support aspiring young entrepreneurs, as well as those in the developing world who deserve the opportunity to start businesses and work their way out of poverty. We also want to campaign for a greater focus on nurturing entrepreneurial talent and providing basic business training in our education systems across the world.
In this spirit, 5% of The Entrepreneur’s Shirt campaign will be donated to Young Enterprise to inspire and equip young people in Britain to learn and succeed through entrepreneurial endeavour. Based on research statistics published by FreshMinds, students who participate in Young Enterprise programmes have a better understanding of business than their peers and are twice as likely to start-up their own company. 
Small businesses are the lifeblood of any healthy economy and, yet, in the developing world it is nigh on impossible for many people to have the chance to work their way out of poverty through entrepreneurship. 
DEKI is a revolutionary charity that changes that and a further 5% of The Entrepreneur’s Shirt campaign will also be donated to them to help them give people in countries like this the chance to create sustainable livelihoods by providing access to micro-grants and business training.

Together we can provide greater support to aspiring entrepreneurs who need it and lead a trend towards greater business training in our education systems. As our video demonstrates, this will only be possible with your help!
Choose a shirt in your favourite colour and you’ll have made a difference. Thank you so much for your support, it means so much to us and we can’t wait to deliver you The Entrepreneur’s Shirt.



About Young Enterprise
There’s a crisis in the UK. Youth unemployment is having a devastating impact on today’s young people. With 70% of employers reporting that school leavers are not work ready and nearly one million young people without a job, we want to ensure that the talent and potential of our young people is not lost. In order to do this we need to address the lack of practical business education in our schools and create a skilled and prepared workforce. 
We believe each young person should leave education having developed skills and experience in communication, team working, problem solving, creativity and resilience which can be developed through Young Enterprise. Their programmes offer a journey from gaining knowledge through to developing skills and changing attitudes, arming young people with the confidence to aim high and the knowledge and skills to succeed. Today’s young people are facing an uncertain future. Each year Young Enterprise empowers over 200,000 under 25s to realise their potential, but there are hundreds of thousands more who need their help.
5% of your pledge for The Entrepreneur's Shirt will go directly to giving young people in the UK invaluable business training, something Tom Cridland want to support as the brand itself was started with a £6,000 government start-up loan just two years ago.

About DEKI
Right now millions of families around the world are facing a daily struggle of poverty. This means parents are unable to afford regular meals, clean water, basic healthcare and education for their children. 18% of children in Uganda never go to school and 66% will never complete their education. In Malawi, 50% of children under five are suffering from malnutrition. To compound this daily struggle, social inequalities often block individual's. In South Sudan, for example, women are unable to access bank loans to help kick-start their their businesses due to gender discrimination. 
DEKI is a microfinance charity that believes in opportunity not poverty. They provide ethical micro-loans and business training to people in Africa offering a vital hand up rather than a handout. Through DEKI, individual lenders have the opportunity to lend from just £10 directly via the crowdfunding website deki.org.uk. 100% of all money lent goes directly to the chosen entrepreneur and lenders are paid on average in 12 months. Even a small initial investment can help a number of people to raise themselves out of poverty. With the capital to start a business, DEKI entrepreneurs cannot only turn their lives around, they can lift others around them out of poverty too. This is shown through improved communal access to secure sources of food and clean water, education, healthcare and employment.
5% of your pledge for The Entrepreneur's Shirt will go directly to an entrepreneur in the developing world as a micro-grant and not a micro-loan, as Tom Cridland do not expect to be repaid for their donation to DEKI.

story:
IT'S OUR MOST EXCITING SEASON YET! Hard to believe we're launching our 10th season. Incredible. It's been an amazing year: we dedicated ourselves to building infrastructure: hiring 2 staff members, increasing our annual budget by $20,000 and paying more of our artists. And the impact has been HUGE! Not only is the organization running a lot more smoothly but our events are more powerful and more packed than ever. (Funny how that works...)

This coming season, we've got even more fantastic stuff coming up: we're moving to a new, larger venue in NYC. On top of all that, we'll be presenting more performance, visual art, food, live music, games, community interaction, storytelling and all of the other juicy stuff that folks have come to expect from our events.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? This campaign accounts for 20% of our annual budget. But how does that break down, exactly? We'll tell you.

$25 -- pays for gas and partial tolls for Chris and Bobby to drive into NY city for each monthly service--one way!

$50 --covers childcare for one service.

$100 -- pays for a stage manager for one service.

$150 -- pays for two featured performers or one session of rehearsal space.

$200 -- covers the costs of one coffee hour.

$500 -- covers our rent for one service.

$1000 -- covers musicians and artists for one month. Or, pays for airfare and rental car for Chris and Bobby to get to LA.

$2500 -- covers half the cost of one service.

THE IMPACT. The Secret City continues to grow in the most amazing ways. Thousands of people have taken part in our events in NYC, LA and Woodstock. We've done so much with the participation of our amazing donors and friends. With your continued support, we'll continue to present the most exciting mix of artists and performers and to make the events that only The Secret City can make,providing community interaction, artistic engagement and our own special brand of spiritual haven to artists and art lovers.

WHAT ARE THE RISKS TO THIS CAMPAIGN SUCCEEDING? You may be thinking, "Hey, The Secret City is  a non-profit corporation now with a growing annual budget, why do they still need me?" The truth is, yes, we've been growing steadily since we started, but we still depend on this annual crowd-fund. Our organization was born at the dawn of social media and the foundation of our donor base comes via crowdfunding. So, please know how crucial it is for us to make this goal. 

THE BIG FINISH! Ok, all you art lovers, you know how this part goes: please give as generously as you can and then share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and community at large. And, you can share our fantastic pitch video anywhere you like--cuz it's funny and short and cute. And it features OUTFITS!!

THANKS! We're gonna go BIG this season and we're are so excited to have you continue the amazing, joyful, colorful ride with us. THANK YOU for being such a vital part of our program, our growth, our exciting new season: thank you for beingOUR COMMUNITY. 

With love.

Chris Wells
Founding Artistic Director

story:
About me and my vision

Hello! I am Madeleine Gong. I was born and raised in Miami. Graduated college in Los Angeles. Lived in New York City for 11 years where I had my son Oliver. Moved back to LA where I had my daughter Sophie. I love calling the Greater Newburyport area home. I was blessed to discovered my true passion later in life...my true calling, your children! For the last 13 years I have been providing music & movement classes and birthday parties to hundreds of families out of the Amesbury Plaza studio. Over the years I have seen the clear need for an indoor play space for the six and under crowd. An open play space for them to not just play but also learn and explore through spontaneous free play. An indoor space for parents to connect while their kids play. A space to offer community events pertaining to young families such as infant/child CPR classes, new mothers group, special speakers. The new IBZ will immediately address these needs. 

Mr. Rogers said it best, "Play is often talked about as if it were a relief from serious learning. But for children play is serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood.". 

 

Where we stand today

A lease has been secured at the Rangeway Plaza/167 Elm Street in Salisbury (next door to the Dinosaur Mini Golf). Renovations are underway and we will be opening our doors in January 2017. It is time to complete our play and party center with the most important and funnest detail...play equipment that is as safe and playful as the rest of our space. Your contribution will allow IBZ to provide the most durable products available (made in the USA) for your itsy bitsy ones.

 

Ways you can help

See our perks to the right and find the one that works best for you and your family. If you do not have children under six years old and you share our vision your contribution will go toward the IBZ scholarship fund to be distributed to local families. 

 

Other ways you can help

No perks for you..no worries. I would be so very grateful if you could help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign! Please share with your friends and family on Facebook! Like Albert Einstein said,"Play is the highest form of research."

story:
Hi, I'm Jess. I LOOOOOOOOVE ice cream! I also love what's happening in my little corner of the world and I'm very excited to start serving my ice cream and frozen treats in West Sacramento. It's a simple formula really; I scoop the best ice cream there is and you leave happy. 
The Washington neighborhood is growing up rapidly, and we can't wait to be a part of it's renaissance over the next few years. If you've had a chance to try any of our ice cream at the giveaways we've been having we hope you agree we will be a great addition to the area as it develops. Cool, little neighborhood shops (like ours) run by people who live there and give back to the community are so important to community growth. We strive to be a part of the community and take great pride in where we live. 
We will be the first chef-driven, farm to fork (crop to cone?), small batch, craft  ice cream and frozen treat shop in the area. Our ingredients are sourced from our neighbors and served to our friends. 

We are planning the final push to get open quick. There were a few surprises along the way and we are making a last minute fundraising effort for a few things to finalize our plan.

We have a goal of $10,000 to finance the following:
  • a few fees from the city and county that surprised us.
  • our popsicle molds
  • some equipment that broke during the construction phase.
  • patio furniture and umbrellas (Sacramento sun can get to you, we want you to be comfortable)
To do this we have a few options for you to help support the shop:
We've enlisted Greg Berger from pomedesign.net to design a shirt that will only be available to this offer. You also have a chance to get the first hats. Pretty cool, huh?
And, of course, there will be ice cream! The ice cream will be available at a few levels; a pre-paid scoop and a chance to try it before everyone else,  a coupon for a free pint of any of our flavors, the opportunity to create your own flavor and get a free gallon of it, a weekly offer for a year, and even a chance to have your flavor featured in our shop and an ice cream social for up to 15 people. 
Please share this with anyone you know who likes ice cream (which is everyone really!). We look forward to serving you some of the best ice cream you've ever had. Thank you in advance for any help you can give.

story:
Tea with Strangers: Overview

The idea behind the "Tea with Strangers" project is simple. We take our tea sets, go sit in public places (parks, squares, streets, etc.), prepare tea according to Chinese traditions, and invite complete strangers to join us for a cup of tea! We offer the tea for free, but in return we ask strangers to share an interesting story from their life. We share our stories, they share theirs. People leave, we’ll probably never see them again. They continue their way, we stay and greet new strangers. Same-same, but different. Different stories, different lives.

The stories and the photographs that we collect during our tea ceremonies, are later published on our website and Facebook page, so that others can follow the stories of strangers we meet and share tea with.

​Initially, the project was started in Yerevan, the capital of Armenia. But we hope to travel to other cities and other countries, and collect stories there, too. So far we’ve visited the cities of Gyumri and Etchmiadzin in Armenia, and Isfahan, Iran.

Our aim is to erase any borders between people who may seem to be strangers to each other, but we’re all water from different rivers after all.

Our project came to life thanks to the Awesome Foundation Yerevan Chapter. The initial funds of $1000 we were granted were used to purchase all the necessary items for a traditional Chinese tea ceremony (several tea pots, cups, tea ceremony deck, instruments, etc.) as well as various types of Chinese tea. We also purchased a portable gas stove.

But since we never ask strangers to pay for the tea we offer to them, we cover all the expenses ourselves. And as the project grows, we need your support to keep it alive and develop it.

The funds raised will be used for the following purpose:

  • Design and production of "Tea with Strangers" booklet or a zine (we want to print the stories and photos in the format of a zine or a booklet and distribute it for free to strangers who join our gatherings);
  • Web hosting service (our website is currently hosted on a free hosting website, we want to move a paid hosting and also hire an expert web designer to help us improve the website itself);
  • Voice recorder (we hold the tea ceremonies in public areas, and it is often very noisy around, so we need a good voice recorder to record the stories that strangers share with us);
  • We want to purchase a portable table for tea ceremonies as well as a suitcase that we'll use to carry all of the tea ceremony items;
  • Larger clay tea pots (more and more people attend our gatherings, and we realized we need larger tea pots to brew tea);
  • New tea ceremony items and tools to replace the damaged ones;
  • Tea (and finally, we constantly need to purchase Chinese tea for our tea ceremonies).

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • If you can donate us one of the items mentioned above, that's even better!
  • Or maybe you can help us with our website? 
  • Spread the word. You can help us by sharing the campaign among your friends.

 

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us by the following email:

info@teawithstrangers.org

 

Sincerely,

Arty & Nane

Tea with Strangers

 

Check out the stories and photographs on our website:

http://teawithstrangers.org

 

Follow us on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/teastrangers/

Short Summary

Our mission at ECO zero-waste market is to create a more convenient way of living zero-waste and helping the community divert as much trash from the landfills as we possibly can. 

ECO zero-waste market (opening in late 2017), will be Ireland's First Zero-Waste store.  Selling over 350 food products and countless household and personal zero-waste items 100% package free.

ECO zero-waste market  will be a resource center for zero-waste education, holding monthly workshops.

ECO zero-waste market will be giving back 1% to the community. Partnering with local non-profit organizations with a focus on food education, marine and coastal conservation.

What We Need & What You Get

Help the Emerald Island become "Greener" and help us open ECO zero-waste market, Ireland's First Zero-Waste store.

Opening any new store cost a lot of money. ECO zero-waste market is looking at 140,000 euros for their start up cost,  with the majority of the needed funds coming from loans. The cost alone for the gravity dispensers - 350 in total is 39,000 euros.

Our dream of changing the way we all shop needs your help! We hope the community is as excited about ECO zero-waste market as we are.

  • We have rewards! Of course, everything we are offering for rewards is zero-waste which is why we encourage you to come and visit us once the doors are open to receive your rewards. However, we know that not everyone lives in Cork that would like to show support so we are more than happy to send you something via snail mail.
  • If we do not reach our goal, we are still going to use every cent towards ECO zero-waste market, which is why we have opted for flexible funding. Every little bit helps and will have a HUGE impact on helping us make our zero-waste dreams come true! 
  • Worse case we will have to scale back our 400+ items, but we don't want to have to do that. We want ECO zero-waste market to be prefect!

The Impact

ECO zero-waste market, a completely zero-waste retailer serving bulk food items, household products, cosmetics, toiletries and cleaners 100% package free. At ECO zero-waste market you will be able to find hard to find do-it-yourself ingredients for the products you can make at home.  ECO zero-waste market will be the place to go to learn more about this lifestyle, discover how to become a more sustainable individual and learn how to live a greener life.

We at ECO zero-waste market are hoping to lead the paradigm shift, making zero-waste living  easier, more accessible and cheaper for everyone.

Risks & Challenges

As with any large project like this, there is the possibility of unforeseen circumstances such as not being able to open as soon as we would like. Please be assured that it would take the 750,066 t of  Ireland household waste landing directly on US to stop this project from happening.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone has the money sitting around for funds like this, BUT you can still help!

  • Please share this with as many people as you can. Post it to Facebook, tweet about it, tell people in real life!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
FINAL DAY PERK!

Limited edition Apocalypse tee design by Kenny Fajardo


At Missconstrued, we love art, fashion, killer hair and tattoos. We are a boutique and gallery after all, but we are also so much more.  We are a dream factory where friends and community members come together to find encouragement and support on the road to achieving their goals. These dreams are now closer to reality as we make the next move in our careers by expanding our work space… and  we need your help!

Our story begins in October 2011 with an empty storefront space in Phoenix on the infamous 5th street on Roosevelt Row. Getting a boutique and gallery together with just the little money we had in savings was no easy task, but with a little elbow grease and a lot of blood, sweat, and tears we made it and we’re still putting in 80-hour work weeks and juggling multiple jobs to continue building the rest.

We have grown at a remarkable speed. From just a small studio housing 20 local artists, we now carry over 70+ local artists handmade goods and artwork, we are home to Hair or Dye Salon, and we also are home to Kenny Fajardo, a super talented tattoo artist. We have poured so much of ourselves and of our resources into creating this space; and we have outgrown it.   While our team of visionaries, dreamers, and do-it-yourselfers have been proving themselves capable of the impossible since our inception, it is hard to imagine being able to complete even the bare minimum build out on a new location without your help. We chose Grand Avenue for our location because it is has strong roots with the arts and is truly a neighborhood where we feel like Missconstrued belongs. Surrounded by art galleries and in an urban setting, we fit right in!! 

We are moving to gain an additional 3,000 square feet of space! This will allow us to expand to the square footage necessary for all of the following: 

1.  Build a manufacturing facility on site for our cut and sew production, screen printing services and mass merchandising. 

2. Expansion for Hair or Dye Salon to allow for more stations, which in turn creates more jobs for talented stylists in the valley.

3. Increasing our team of tattoo artists, and collection of fine art . 

4. More square footage allows us to carry MORE artwork, MORE hand-made goods and MORE local fashions and accessories!

5. in addition, a private patio for events, guests and our team to enjoy.

6. Give us the opportunity to push our business to the next level and create a firm foundation for the rest of our years to come!

Helping us with our new transition to a bigger space not only provides all of the above, but it helps keep the arts alive on Roosevelt Row. With your help, we can build a foundation for years of support and growth on Roosevelt Row! We plan to put our final plan into place, in hopes of franchising in other states.

We are dedicated to the growth of the community and our team. This is only the beginning!! Reanna started this company from inside her parent's garage and in just 5 years she has opened a store-front and expanded to bring in nearly 100 artists together from several mediums ranging from fine art and handmade goods to tattoos and hair art! Think of the possibilities that can happen with this new foundation and the tools we need to succeed! Its an amazing feeling, and we want everyone to be a part of it! 



NEW PERK RELEASED 04/28/2016

TATTOO FLASH SETS
FLORAL:

STAR WARS:

ADVENTURE TIME: 

ALICE IN WONDERLAND:



We are literally bursting out of our location! Not only do we have all these services under one roof that is only 1,000 square feet of space, but we have no proper waiting space for our clients, our parking spaces for employees and clients are disappearing by the day, and we have literally came to a space issue that needs desperate attention! 

Here is a list of things we need to purchase in the next few months. Every milestone helps us get so much closer to our goal!  We have priced out and negotiated on used supplies and more to be as frugal as possible, while also ensuring we have the tools necessary to sustain growth for the next 10 years!

Milestone #1 ---------------$5,000

Flooring - $2,000

Security Cameras - $1000

Security Doors - $600

Bathroom remodels x 2 - $1000

Plumbing build out - $400

Milestone #2 --------------$10,000

  2 shampoo bowls - $2,000

 Lighting for 2 units - $1,200

Towels, Aprons, Mixing supplies and sanitation - $400

large Mirrors x4 - $400

Washer & Dryer - $400

Back bar and Retail - $600

Milestone #3 -------------- $13,500

Tattoo Chairs/Beds - $500

Tool Boxes x 3 - $400

Seating for Customers - $400

Security Cameras - $400

Mirrors x3 - $300

Misc Sanitation Supplies - $400

Electrical and Booth Build out - $1,100

Milestone #4 ----------------- $23,000

Outside Signage (2 buildings) - $2,500

Grid wall for an additional 1,000 Square feet - $650

Surround sound for both shops - $400

Back Patio Build out - $1,000

Landscape build out - $2,000

Cabinets for Sweatshop $1,000

Business Cards for Team - $250

Register System for 2nd Counter - $600

Salon Chairs x 6 - $1000

Administrative Desk & Supplies - $500


We are confident that our move will be as seamless as possible for our customers and artists due to the fact that we are only relocating 2 miles away from our current foundation. We have carefully picked a location where our signage is visible from the interstate. We have a corner location, with our store front facing major cross-streets (15th Avenue, Roosevelt and Grand Ave), We plan to use our signature purple exterior and street art for easy identification. We will rely on our strong social presence to market our services which this new location.  With First Friday being a huge promotional tool for us on 5th Street, we plan to bring the traffic to Grand with our creative First Friday events and exhibits. 

If you cant make a contribution, that's ok, you can help in other ways!! You can share this with your friends, the community and more! 


Here is a little photo gallery of the transitions we have overcome in these last few years....

THANK YOU ALL for your SUPPORT!!!

story:
Scroll Down To Discover Great PERKS To Choose From!....

 

Say HELLO to THE LOOP!

The World's First Family Drone

 

 

...

 

Ever considered that today’s consumer drones are either too professional or gimmicky for everyday family use? 

Ever thought that consumer drones focused on features that seemed to compliment only the extreme lifestyles?

We certainly do, and because of this we are working hard to make professional level drone technology available to everyone at a more practical level, focusing on portability, sharing, ease-of-use, and fun that is available literally out of the box.

 

The Loop – A Family Drone at Professional Levels

What makes The Loop the family drone?

Simple, we have developed the Loop to offer features that reflect the values that families hold dear in todays world. 

To reflect this, The Loop embodies the four family values that XenoSky follow…

 

This doesn't mean that the Loop is just another gimmicky drone toy that isn't taken seriously... not at all. In fact, we have designed The Loop to also offer professional level features and functionality that any drone enthusiast can take advantage of. In fact, the Loop is the world's first drone that offers features attractive to all consumer levels, from fun n games to professional photography... The Loop can do it all, without destroying father’s pocket book!

 

The World's First Family Drone

 

The Loop is packed with the usual features found on all professional level consumer drones, but with added functionality that makes flying the drone attractive to all who want to have fun and share their experiences with friends and family.

 

    This is why the Loop comes featured as part of our Family Pack!

     

     

    The Family Pack - 1: The Loop Drone, 2: The GiMA 1.0 Hand-Held Gimbal, 3: The Slimline Bag, 4: SuperView FPV Goggles, 5: APP Supporting Light-Finger Sky-Writing, 6: Our 4k Action Camera

    ...

    Family Pack Features:

     

    The Loop Drone = Portability

     

    No bigger than the size of a standard Tablet, The Loop is both easy to store and quick to operate. The automatic folding arms mechanism allows for easy practical storage, offering simple assembly that will have you flying high in a matter of minutes.

    That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?

    Well for one thing, The Loop is much more portable than other drones at this level, meaning that there is no real need for dedicated suitcases for transport! But if you were the type that enjoys ‘everything in its place’, then we have designed a slimline bag that comes with every ‘family-pack’ purchase, which is smaller than your standard backpack!

    Foldable Storage!

     

    Fit in Many Small to Medium Sized Bags

     

     

    Our Slimline Carry Case

    The Loop in Folded Form

    Quick Setup into Flight Mode

     

     

    The Loop

     

     

    Portable Gimbal System = Practicality

     

    The Loop’s undercarriage can be detached and assembled to our portable Gimbal System we call the GIMA 1.0. Extremely useful for when you need fast professional hand-held photography. Re-attach to the drone with very little effort, and take your photography back to the skies.

    That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?

    Well basically, the drone comes with its own gimbal system which can be detached to form the GIMA Hand-held Gimbal. This system gives you functionality that matches other high-end portable gimbals, but without the cost. The GIMA is formed using the undercarriage of the drone itself, and means that you are not only able to take extremely steady recordings in the skies, but also on the ground. With the GIMA, steady hands are not required.

     

     

     

    Render of the GiMA Hand-Held Gimbal System

     

     

    Our 4k Action Camera - Front

     

     

     

     

    FPV Goggles = Sharing

     

    Immerse yourself in the world of FPV, as our ‘SuperView’ goggles place you directly into the pilot’s seat. The HD FPV experience captured by our own 4k Action Camera, means that you can experience the sense of flying in all its majesty, allowing your imagination to run wild, and to wonder… ‘Is this how a superhero see’s the world?’. Turn on the Live Sharing feature and invite your friends & family to ‘see what you see’ from anywhere in the world using our Smart APP.

    That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?

    Well put simply, the FPV Goggles (called SuperView) give you a view from the drone itself as it flies, so make sure you’re sitting down comfortably! Installing our APP means that you can turn on live streaming on your smartphone which fits neatly in the SuperView’s casing, and share live video to anywhere around the world… so granny can enjoy your experiences while sitting by the fire.

     

     

     

     

     

    Light-Finger Sky-Writing = FUN!!!

     

    Expand your creativity with our ‘Light-Finger Sky-Writing’ feature, which provides an unprecedented level of control. With just a swipe of your finger, you can have The Loop zooming, swooping and looping around the skies with an ever increasing beauty of light and shape.

    That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?

    Well put simply, you are able to draw whatever shapes in whatever color you desire, and press GO! The Loop will take off and automatically draw your images in the night-sky for you, leaving you to concentrate on the photographs. Can it be easier than that?

     

     

    Actual Loop Sky-Writing Test

     

    Demonstration Video

    Please note: The Controller used in the video is our testing controller and we are currently manufacturing a new controller design.

     

    Standard LOOP FEATURES

     

     
    NOTE: Many of the features listed above are currently in development, and we need your help to complete. If you feel as we do and want to see these features realized and the drone successfully launched, please donate by using one of our fabulous listed options!
     
     

    EVOLUTION

     

    We work hard to make sure that we are always moving forward, enhancing features or correcting issues. This is why the Loop is continuously evolving.

    The concept that pushed us to develop The Loop drone is simple…

    Many drone products in the market come across as either being too professional or gimmicky, and led us to come up with our own drone tackling the issues of portability, ease-of-use, and FUN!!!

    We wanted a drone that bridged the gap, and gave families a practical option that not only could go toe-to-toe with some of the best, but would not break the bank. More than that, a drone that came with features and accessories in an all-in-one pack that made the experience as easy and pain free as possible.

    ‘Family Values with Professional standards’, as The Loop represents our passion and belief of making drone technology more family friendly.

     

    3D Folded

    3D in 'Flight' Mode

     

     

    Many early morning hours were spent going over the initial designs, as we wanted something portable while remaining strong and reliable.
     

    3D Printing of Prototype Underway!

    Putting the Loop Together

    Our First Prototype- 3D Printed

    The First Loop Prototypes Constructed - Without the Gimbal

    With designs complete and confidence high, we were ready to construct our first prototype… it was an exciting day with great eagerness to get flying!
     

    The Loop - Size Comparison

     

    Our first flight!

     

     

     

    Early Battery Tests

    We decided to add an active and easy to read LED display to show remaining power levels of the battery, with alarm notification for charging.

     

    WHY XENOSKY IS DIFFERENT

     

    Unlike many other drone companies, we are not trying to change the world through constant technical innovation, our goals are different. We just want to provide ways to make drone technology and experiences more accessible to the mass market.

    By focusing on this, we are able to ensure that our products present more practical and viable solutions to those who just want to enjoy the fun aspects of aerial photography at professional levels, without breaking the bank.

    Located across 2 continents (America and Asia), we are a collection of professionals who are working hard to match what the market wants. As such we are always open to input, so please talk to us... We are listening.

     

     

     

    WE NEED YOU

     

    Although we are a small but dedicated team who has worked extremely hard to make the Loop a reality, we are not there yet.

    But what will we do with your money?

    Your donations will enable us complete our project and bring drone technology down to earth... sounds odd, but we feel that drones are not as easily accessible, fun to use or as practical in everyday lives as they should be.

    So we want to address this and make 'The World's First Family Drone' a reality...  help us make this happen.

    We need your help to get us past the finish line. How to help? Simple… donate!

    We have come up with a range of donation choices for you, and hope that the rewards on offer more than show our commitment to saying a special ‘thank you’ to everyone who supports us.

    More than that, we are a company that values your input, and welcome any suggestions you may have for us to move forward… seriously, send us a comment, an email, a postcard if you wish!

     

     

    DONATION OPTIONS

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    Many thanks to all of those who have believed in us thus far, especially to Drone Media, who have been stern supporters all the way.

     

     

     

    We are also to be found on...

     

     

    TIMELINE

     

     

    Specs

    Drone Specs

    Gimbal Specs

     4K Camera Specs

     

    FAQs

    Here are 5 questions that we have already been asked, even before our campaign had begun! So we thought we would add them as FAQs from the beginning, but watch out for more as the campaign grows.
     
    • 1 - When will the Loop be available?
    Our target month is July 2016, and we are full steam ahead to achieving this. If there is any issue that comes up, you all will be the first to know.
     
    • 2 - Can I control the Loop using my Smart device?
    Absolutely! One of our features that we are working on is control using Smart Devices. It will be part of our APP offering and will cover iOS and later on Android, so watch out for the updates!
     
    • 3 - Where is your company located?
    We are located in two countries, in both California USA and Shenzhen China. Our contact details are listed in this campaign and you are more than welcome to contact us.
     
    • 4 - Why are you crowdfunding?
    Well, we have done almost all of the hard work already. We are now at the point where we will focus on finishing our targets and start mass manufacturing for the global markets. This needs a certain level of investment, and gives us an opportunity to showcase our project to you before launch day comes.
     
    • 5 - Do I need to register for a UAS license from the FAA to fly?
    Yes, but we can help you with that. Each person who purchases one of our perks containing a drone, will be supported by us to help register your UAS license. If you want to find out more, please go here... https://www.faa.gov/uas/registration/
     
    • 6 - Why doesn't the Goggles or Hand-Held Gimbal come with the Early Bird Packs?

    Both the SuperView FPV Goggles and the Hand-Held Gimbal (GiMA) are separate items, and therefore are extra cost to manufacture. Because of this, they are included as one-stop-shop complete solution that we call, The Family Pack!

     

     

    • 7 - Does the Loop Drone support most action cams on the market?
    Yes. The Hand-Held Gimbal and the Drone itself supports all popular action cams in the market today. This includes the GoPro Hero ranges of Camera.

     

     

    • 8 - Will the controller come with the Drone?
    Yes. The look of the controller is currently in development and is the reason there is no pictures to show yet, but when they are available we will show them on the updates!
    Please contact us directly if you have further questions
     

    Risks and challenges

     

    Sadly, no venture is without risk, but rest assured we have the team and experience to make sure the risks are minimal. Every possible step has been taken to ensure we can deliver at the prices quoted in the donations list, that we are working effectively with our team of professionals, and that we are keeping our ear to the ground and are open to all suggestions and information given to us.

    In addition, we will ensure that we are fully transparent and should any progress or hindrance occur, the community will be the first to know.

    Every waking hour is set to achieving this one goal of completion and delivery and no other project, past, present or future, exists to distract us from it.

    We have set the delivery time during the month of July this year, and are extremely confident that the deadline will be met, even if we encounter unforeseen circumstances, as we have allowed for generous lead-times.

Ever considered that today’s consumer drones are either too professional or gimmicky for everyday family use? 
Ever thought that consumer drones focused on features that seemed to compliment only the extreme lifestyles?
We certainly do, and because of this we are working hard to make professional level drone technology available to everyone at a more practical level, focusing on portability, sharing, ease-of-use, and fun that is available literally out of the box.
 
The Loop – A Family Drone at Professional Levels


What makes The Loop the family drone?
Simple, we have developed the Loop to offer features that reflect the values that families hold dear in todays world. 
To reflect this, The Loop embodies the four family values that XenoSky follow…
 


This doesn't mean that the Loop is just another gimmicky drone toy that isn't taken seriously... not at all. In fact, we have designed The Loop to also offer professional level features and functionality that any drone enthusiast can take advantage of. In fact, the Loop is the world's first drone that offers features attractive to all consumer levels, from fun n games to professional photography... The Loop can do it all, without destroying father’s pocket book!

 

The World's First Family Drone
 

The Loop is packed with the usual features found on all professional level consumer drones, but with added functionality that makes flying the drone attractive to all who want to have fun and share their experiences with friends and family.
 

This is why the Loop comes featured as part of our Family Pack!
 
 

The Family Pack - 1: The Loop Drone, 2: The GiMA 1.0 Hand-Held Gimbal, 3: The Slimline Bag, 4: SuperView FPV Goggles, 5: APP Supporting Light-Finger Sky-Writing, 6: Our 4k Action Camera

...

Family Pack Features:
 

The Loop Drone = Portability
 
No bigger than the size of a standard Tablet, The Loop is both easy to store and quick to operate. The automatic folding arms mechanism allows for easy practical storage, offering simple assembly that will have you flying high in a matter of minutes.
That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?
Well for one thing, The Loop is much more portable than other drones at this level, meaning that there is no real need for dedicated suitcases for transport! But if you were the type that enjoys ‘everything in its place’, then we have designed a slimline bag that comes with every ‘family-pack’ purchase, which is smaller than your standard backpack!
Foldable Storage!
 

Fit in Many Small to Medium Sized Bags 
 

Our Slimline Carry Case

The Loop in Folded Form


Quick Setup into Flight Mode


 
 

The Loop
 
 

Portable Gimbal System = Practicality
 
The Loop’s undercarriage can be detached and assembled to our portable Gimbal System we call the GIMA 1.0. Extremely useful for when you need fast professional hand-held photography. Re-attach to the drone with very little effort, and take your photography back to the skies.
That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?
Well basically, the drone comes with its own gimbal system which can be detached to form the GIMA Hand-held Gimbal. This system gives you functionality that matches other high-end portable gimbals, but without the cost. The GIMA is formed using the undercarriage of the drone itself, and means that you are not only able to take extremely steady recordings in the skies, but also on the ground. With the GIMA, steady hands are not required.
 

 
 Render of the GiMA Hand-Held Gimbal System
 

 
Our 4k Action Camera - Front
 

 

 
 

FPV Goggles = Sharing
 
Immerse yourself in the world of FPV, as our ‘SuperView’ goggles place you directly into the pilot’s seat. The HD FPV experience captured by our own 4k Action Camera, means that you can experience the sense of flying in all its majesty, allowing your imagination to run wild, and to wonder… ‘Is this how a superhero see’s the world?’. Turn on the Live Sharing feature and invite your friends & family to ‘see what you see’ from anywhere in the world using our Smart APP.
That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?
Well put simply, the FPV Goggles (called SuperView) give you a view from the drone itself as it flies, so make sure you’re sitting down comfortably! Installing our APP means that you can turn on live streaming on your smartphone which fits neatly in the SuperView’s casing, and share live video to anywhere around the world… so granny can enjoy your experiences while sitting by the fire.

 



  
 

 
Light-Finger Sky-Writing = FUN!!!
 
Expand your creativity with our ‘Light-Finger Sky-Writing’ feature, which provides an unprecedented level of control. With just a swipe of your finger, you can have The Loop zooming, swooping and looping around the skies with an ever increasing beauty of light and shape.
That’s the blurb, but what does it really mean?
Well put simply, you are able to draw whatever shapes in whatever color you desire, and press GO! The Loop will take off and automatically draw your images in the night-sky for you, leaving you to concentrate on the photographs. Can it be easier than that?

 




 



Actual Loop Sky-Writing Test

 
Demonstration Video

Please note: The Controller used in the video is our testing controller and we are currently manufacturing a new controller design.
 
Standard LOOP FEATURES
 

 
NOTE: Many of the features listed above are currently in development, and we need your help to complete. If you feel as we do and want to see these features realized and the drone successfully launched, please donate by using one of our fabulous listed options!  
EVOLUTION
 
We work hard to make sure that we are always moving forward, enhancing features or correcting issues. This is why the Loop is continuously evolving.
The concept that pushed us to develop The Loop drone is simple…
Many drone products in the market come across as either being too professional or gimmicky, and led us to come up with our own drone tackling the issues of portability, ease-of-use, and FUN!!!
We wanted a drone that bridged the gap, and gave families a practical option that not only could go toe-to-toe with some of the best, but would not break the bank. More than that, a drone that came with features and accessories in an all-in-one pack that made the experience as easy and pain free as possible.
‘Family Values with Professional standards’, as The Loop represents our passion and belief of making drone technology more family friendly.
 





3D Folded


3D in 'Flight' Mode



 
 
Many early morning hours were spent going over the initial designs, as we wanted something portable while remaining strong and reliable. 

3D Printing of Prototype Underway!

Putting the Loop Together

Our First Prototype- 3D Printed


The First Loop Prototypes Constructed - Without the Gimbal
With designs complete and confidence high, we were ready to construct our first prototype… it was an exciting day with great eagerness to get flying! 

The Loop - Size Comparison
 Our first flight!  

 
Early Battery Tests
We decided to add an active and easy to read LED display to show remaining power levels of the battery, with alarm notification for charging.

 
WHY XENOSKY IS DIFFERENT
 
Unlike many other drone companies, we are not trying to change the world through constant technical innovation, our goals are different. We just want to provide ways to make drone technology and experiences more accessible to the mass market.
By focusing on this, we are able to ensure that our products present more practical and viable solutions to those who just want to enjoy the fun aspects of aerial photography at professional levels, without breaking the bank.
Located across 2 continents (America and Asia), we are a collection of professionals who are working hard to match what the market wants. As such we are always open to input, so please talk to us... We are listening.
 
 
 
WE NEED YOU

 
Although we are a small but dedicated team who has worked extremely hard to make the Loop a reality, we are not there yet.
But what will we do with your money?
Your donations will enable us complete our project and bring drone technology down to earth... sounds odd, but we feel that drones are not as easily accessible, fun to use or as practical in everyday lives as they should be.
So we want to address this and make 'The World's First Family Drone' a reality...  help us make this happen.
We need your help to get us past the finish line. How to help? Simple… donate!
We have come up with a range of donation choices for you, and hope that the rewards on offer more than show our commitment to saying a special ‘thank you’ to everyone who supports us.
More than that, we are a company that values your input, and welcome any suggestions you may have for us to move forward… seriously, send us a comment, an email, a postcard if you wish!
 
 
DONATION OPTIONS
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 Many thanks to all of those who have believed in us thus far, especially to Drone Media, who have been stern supporters all the way. 
 

 
We are also to be found on...

 
 
TIMELINE
 
 Specs Drone Specs


Gimbal Specs


 4K Camera Specs


 
FAQs
Here are 5 questions that we have already been asked, even before our campaign had begun! So we thought we would add them as FAQs from the beginning, but watch out for more as the campaign grows.
 

1 - When will the Loop be available?
Our target month is July 2016, and we are full steam ahead to achieving this. If there is any issue that comes up, you all will be the first to know.
 
2 - Can I control the Loop using my Smart device?
Absolutely! One of our features that we are working on is control using Smart Devices. It will be part of our APP offering and will cover iOS and later on Android, so watch out for the updates!
 
3 - Where is your company located?
We are located in two countries, in both California USA and Shenzhen China. Our contact details are listed in this campaign and you are more than welcome to contact us.
 

4 - Why are you crowdfunding?
Well, we have done almost all of the hard work already. We are now at the point where we will focus on finishing our targets and start mass manufacturing for the global markets. This needs a certain level of investment, and gives us an opportunity to showcase our project to you before launch day comes.
 
5 - Do I need to register for a UAS license from the FAA to fly?
Yes, but we can help you with that. Each person who purchases one of our perks containing a drone, will be supported by us to help register your UAS license. If you want to find out more, please go here... https://www.faa.gov/uas/registration/

 
6 - Why doesn't the Goggles or Hand-Held Gimbal come with the Early Bird Packs?
Both the SuperView FPV Goggles and the Hand-Held Gimbal (GiMA) are separate items, and therefore are extra cost to manufacture. Because of this, they are included as one-stop-shop complete solution that we call, The Family Pack!
 
 
7 - Does the Loop Drone support most action cams on the market?Yes. The Hand-Held Gimbal and the Drone itself supports all popular action cams in the market today. This includes the GoPro Hero ranges of Camera. 
 
8 - Will the controller come with the Drone?Yes. The look of the controller is currently in development and is the reason there is no pictures to show yet, but when they are available we will show them on the updates!
Please contact us directly if you have further questions

 
Risks and challenges
 
Sadly, no venture is without risk, but rest assured we have the team and experience to make sure the risks are minimal. Every possible step has been taken to ensure we can deliver at the prices quoted in the donations list, that we are working effectively with our team of professionals, and that we are keeping our ear to the ground and are open to all suggestions and information given to us.
In addition, we will ensure that we are fully transparent and should any progress or hindrance occur, the community will be the first to know.
Every waking hour is set to achieving this one goal of completion and delivery and no other project, past, present or future, exists to distract us from it.
We have set the delivery time during the month of July this year, and are extremely confident that the deadline will be met, even if we encounter unforeseen circumstances, as we have allowed for generous lead-times.

story:
With your backing, we can fund Craft Cannabis’ digital advocacy, events, and government consultation efforts.

Tee: Leaf by Artist Jamie Biziness ($30 CDN + Shipping)

Tee: Raven by Artist Jamie Biziness ($30 CDN + Shipping)

Imagine a world where Craft Cannabis is as accepted as craft beer is today.


We are building a movement, to celebrate Craft Cannabis culture, and bring your voice and your values to decision makers.

Through creative advocacy, we are bringing together a network of Canadians who agree that high quality, locally produced and sustainable craft cannabis products must be an essential part of any new legal framework.

We believe a fair market for cannabis can exist in the emerging regulatory environment while providing consumer safety, outstanding quality, economic opportunities and creating a world-class connoisseur culture.


Why raise these funds now?

Canada is set to legalize the sale of recreational cannabis, but there's a problem: a dozen large firms are in an ideal situation to capitalize when recreational cannabis use is legal; attracting big interests who stand to acquire them.

Big business has a lot to gain and is equipped with the resources to push their agenda forward. But that doesn't mean we can't convince decision-makers about the importance of craft products.

If we work together to advocate for sensible policies to promote a safe, fair and progressive cannabis market — local economies and small business will be empowered to realize the full benefits of legalization. 

We must make sure that the new rules benefit many, not just a few big business interests. 

Together we can assure that Canada has the best Cannabis regulation in the world. 

Funding Breakdown



Your contributions help:

  • Mobilize a consumer network across the country,
  • Define and advocate for craft cannabis solutions,
  • Educate: using internet advocacy and consumer-lead research,
  • Engage the government with targeted lobbying efforts,
  • Launch nation-wide actions to pressure decision-makers for our cause.

Learn more about Craft Cannabis and read our full constitution at www.craftcannabis.ca/about-CCABC.

story:
If user want to offer or receive help the process is as easy as 1-2-3. He or she login to www.tobekind.net and enter a wonderful experience. Here is philosophy of service ToBeKind:

 

 

Using the service is very straightforward. There are two ways people can connect. Let’s check them out:
 
 
 
 

There’s the joy that comes from good deeds. There are three main elements on our web service, that work in the system to motivate people to be kind on our web service and inspire them to help other people without money. It creates our system of rewards.  

The video below is very explanatory concerning how ToBeKind works in real action.

 

 

Any Internet user who needs or wants to help online. No matter what kind of help user provide: local or remote. The location barrier is disappears via our web service. Imagine someone who needs a French language tutor and he/she lives in the small town where there is none who can help. Imagine now that someone in the French countryside is eager to help. This is the situation where ToBeKind comes in. The good deeds link up. ToBeKind connects them and help is provided.

ToBeKind makes it possible!

Some indicative needs for online help are: lessons, domestic help, consultation, donation of things and much more.

Sometimes, when we need assistance we feel helpless, we believe that there is no one out there to help. No need to feel that way. One of the fundamental stones of ToBeKind project is the belief that there are people eager to help spread all over the world. And because there are several people who wish to help, you may choose the one that can best meet your needs and thank the others. Moreover, you can do your own research on the platform and locate a specialist that can help.

ToBeKind project works the other way round too. Do you wish to offer your help? Create a task with your expertise and wait for people who need your specialization to respond. You can also check the list of people asking for some help and offer your assistance — good deed, indeed! We also have a rewarding system for users who provide help and do kind things on ToBeKind project.

On a friendly car drive almost a year ago founder Artyom Davydov couldn’t help noticing that everyone who was in the car needed help that they could not give to each other. He starts to think how great it would be  to have a web service to connect people with different skills to help each other and do good deeds. The idea grew and soon after it became a promising project. A team was formed and work started by developing the concept of web service, analyzing the target audience and, on the basis of the material obtained, creating a unique solution how to motivate people to help each other without real money.

The headquarters are in Prague, but the team consists of specialists from different countries making the ToBeKind experience multinational. They are all inspired by the kindness of this project and they support it with dedication.

 

The main aim is to fund the completion of the project which is currently at 70%. We need your help to reach 100% and launch this great project. Programmers, designer and copywriters need to work on it.
Next is the promotion of the project during the launch phase. As we are talking about an global project, the marketing campaign must run in several languages. The importance of marketing should not be underestimated. 
The more users sign in, the more chances users will have to receive help. 
As a non-profit project funding is also needed in order to maintain quality of the service, including: 

- Technical services (programmers, copywriters, designer, technical support)
- Marketing promotion.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jesse Domingo! I am from Redmond, Washington. I have been living here quite sometime and know that there are not a lot of entertainment activities in Redmond. But of the entertainment that we have one has been growing in popularity, Escape Rooms.

Escape Rooms are a live action thrilling experience where teams are locked into a themed room and have a certain amount of time to escape. They escape by solving the puzzles and riddles given in the room. If they successfully  escape they have won the game.

There are a couple of Escape Rooms in the area, but they are quite expensive.  My goal in this project is to create a fun and exciting Escape Room at an affordable rate.

The reason that I am passionate about this is because I love how puzzles and games can create a strong community.  Games and puzzles have helped me grow, first by creating new friendships, and discovering confidence in myself.  I want my Escape Room to be a place where I can see people grow together just like I have.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for this Escape Room to open in a timely manner we need to get the funding as soon as possible.  This money will go secure the potential locations we have scouted out and to fill our Escape Rooms.

We are going to be opening up two rooms! We have our two themes already sorted out. We are going to be doing an: Alien Abduction and  The Witch's Candy House. ( Hansel and Gretel Theme) Go to our website to see our description of each of our rooms.

Your investment in in our escape room is very important to us.  Which is why we want to reward you by supporting us. We plan to give our supporters who pledge over admission into one of our escape rooms. please took at all of our perks and the descriptions.

The Impact

This project will impact the local community by giving a new and exciting place to play games and grow as a community.

It will also help bring diversity of entertainment in the Seattle area. As well open up an opportunity for new and future escape rooms.

Risks & Challenges

The risk in this project is not being able to get enough money for this project in a timely manner. It will delay our progress which we will update you on if that is the case. But we will keep moving forward to bring you the experience. We will not disappoint you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any of these things will help us tremendously! Please if you do not want to donate to our campaign please do some (preferably all) of the following.
  • Tell other people about this campaign!
  • Please Like our Facebook page at ttps://www.facebook.com/thecrypticcube/
  • Vist our Website at http://www.thecrypticcube.com/
