story:
The Corporate Rebels story

We believe the way most organizations are run is outdated. The result: 87% of employees is disengaged, which means they spend their time on work that doesn't make them happy. As Corporate Rebels, we are on a mission to change this. Our mission is to make work more inspiring and fun. 



We do this by learning from pioneers in the field of employee happiness - from entrepreneurs that have built happy workplaces to authors that write about them and professors that study the field. Check out our Bucket List full of inspirational people here. By sharing their unique stories we inspire organizations and employees that work could (and should!) be a lot more inspiring than it currently is. 

In January 2016 we started our search. We have quit our jobs out of a combination of frustration and inspiration. Frustration from our first 2.5 years of working in the corporate world. Inspiration from the stories of organizations that show there is another, more positive way. 


Why Crowdfunding?

Since we started our search, the story has gained considerable interest. A lot of people feel that a change is needed and they are both happy and surprised to see there are solutions out there. Newspapers, magazines, organizations, and the people around us are interested in the subject and are really keen to hear more about it. 

This momentum is something we want to build upon. We want to use it to move our search for happiness at work to the next stage. In order to do this, we decided to start this crowdfunding campaign. With this campaign, we invite everyone, from employees to employers, to contribute to our mission.

The additional funding would give us an extra boost, shifting Corporate Rebels into the next gear. 


What will the money be used for?

All the funding we receive from this crowdfunding campaign will be used to further fuel our mission. At this moment, we finance everything ourselves with our personal savings. 

We believe in happiness at work, and we believe that passion, hard work, and perseverance will lead to amazing things. 

Luckily, there are like-minded people. They join forces and donate valuable time, energy and expertise to support our cause.

This combination of personal savings, time and effort, allows us to do the following:


What we already do:

  1. Visiting happy workplaces and meeting the Bucket List pioneers
  2. Sharing the unique stories to inspire change
  3. Share the learnings through blog posts and talks
  4. Convincing the world that the way we work has to change
  5. All of this freely available in the public domain


The additional funding raised with this campaign allows us to use our momentum to help Corporate Rebels to the next stage. It allows us to add more activities and increase our impact.


What else we want to do:

  1. Expand the Bucket List. Additional funding allows the Bucket List to expand. In this way, your can learn from more inspiring pioneers and their unique stories of radically different workplaces.
  2. Remain independent. We believe in sharing an independent story; objective, unbiased, and honest. With funding, Corporate Rebels can be more selective with sponsorship, forming links only with organizations that share our mission. By remaining impartial we can provide you with real and honest information.
  3. Organize meetups and events. Additional funding allows us to organize quarterly meetups and additional events with all those interested. During these meetups, you are invited to share your insights and views while we share our latest inspiration face-to-face. You'll be able to meet like-minded people and further strengthen the movement.


How much do we need?

The more funding we receive, the farther our mission can go. We've set the goal for this campaign at € 15.000, but this is flexible, not fixed. Every euro we raise will boost our mission.


Other ways to help us

You don't have to spend money to help us. Here are some other ways you can join the movement:

  • Inform us about more amazing workplaces and inspiring people to add to our Bucket List.
  • Connect us to organizations that are searching for inspiration; we'd love to give presentations and workshops about what we learn.
  • Introduce us to conferences/press/media so we can further grow our reach.
  • Good with a videos and editing? We're looking for the next Martin Scorsese to make a short Corporate Rebels video.
  • Social media expertise. We're learning quickly, but we could still use expertise to increase our social media reach.
  • Provide feedback. Let us know what you think about Corporate Rebels. This helps us to continuously improve.
  • Share our story. We would highly appreciate you sharing this crowdfunding campaign, our website, or social media to further increase our reach.

Our mission is to make work more inspiring and fun. 



We do this by learning from pioneers in the field of employee happiness - from entrepreneurs that have built happy workplaces to authors that write about them and professors that study the field. Check out our Bucket List full of inspirational people here. By sharing their unique stories we inspire organizations and employees that work could (and should!) be a lot more inspiring than it currently is. 
In January 2016 we started our search. We have quit our jobs out of a combination of frustration and inspiration. Frustration from our first 2.5 years of working in the corporate world. Inspiration from the stories of organizations that show there is another, more positive way. 


Why Crowdfunding?

Since we started our search, the story has gained considerable interest. A lot of people feel that a change is needed and they are both happy and surprised to see there are solutions out there. Newspapers, magazines, organizations, and the people around us are interested in the subject and are really keen to hear more about it. 
This momentum is something we want to build upon. We want to use it to move our search for happiness at work to the next stage. In order to do this, we decided to start this crowdfunding campaign. With this campaign, we invite everyone, from employees to employers, to contribute to our mission.
The additional funding would give us an extra boost, shifting Corporate Rebels into the next gear. 

What will the money be used for?

All the funding we receive from this crowdfunding campaign will be used to further fuel our mission. At this moment, we finance everything ourselves with our personal savings. 
We believe in happiness at work, and we believe that passion, hard work, and perseverance will lead to amazing things. 
Luckily, there are like-minded people. They join forces and donate valuable time, energy and expertise to support our cause.
This combination of personal savings, time and effort, allows us to do the following:

What we already do:


Visiting happy workplaces and meeting the Bucket List pioneers
Sharing the unique stories to inspire change
Share the learnings through blog posts and talks
Convincing the world that the way we work has to change
All of this freely available in the public domain


The additional funding raised with this campaign allows us to use our momentum to help Corporate Rebels to the next stage. It allows us to add more activities and increase our impact.

What else we want to do:



Expand the Bucket List. Additional funding allows the Bucket List to expand. In this way, your can learn from more inspiring pioneers and their unique stories of radically different workplaces.


Remain independent. We believe in sharing an independent story; objective, unbiased, and honest. With funding, Corporate Rebels can be more selective with sponsorship, forming links only with organizations that share our mission. By remaining impartial we can provide you with real and honest information.


Organize meetups and events. Additional funding allows us to organize quarterly meetups and additional events with all those interested. During these meetups, you are invited to share your insights and views while we share our latest inspiration face-to-face. You'll be able to meet like-minded people and further strengthen the movement.




How much do we need? The more funding we receive, the farther our mission can go. We've set the goal for this campaign at € 15.000, but this is flexible, not fixed. Every euro we raise will boost our mission.

    
Other ways to help us

 You don't have to spend money to help us. Here are some other ways you can join the movement:


Inform us about more amazing workplaces and inspiring people to add to our Bucket List.

Connect us to organizations that are searching for inspiration; we'd love to give presentations and workshops about what we learn.
Introduce us to conferences/press/media so we can further grow our reach.
Good with a videos and editing? We're looking for the next Martin Scorsese to make a short Corporate Rebels video.

Social media expertise. We're learning quickly, but we could still use expertise to increase our social media reach.

Provide feedback. Let us know what you think about Corporate Rebels. This helps us to continuously improve.

Share our story. We would highly appreciate you sharing this crowdfunding campaign, our website, or social media to further increase our reach.

story:
How It All Started

Do you remember that  “Not Again!” moment when you jump into the shower, turn on the water and you suddenly discover the soap left in the soap case is barely enough to wash your face not to talk of your entire body.

At this point, you have an option of jumping out of the shower wet to risk falling or sustaining injuries, or just wash your face with water, and you know the rest…..

According to a recent survey, an average middle-aged individual does not jump into the shower until thereabout few minutes before its time to leave the house, and monitoring the level of soap in the shower is hardly on their to-do list.

Soap Stacker is a multiple bar soap dispenser that can hold up to 4 bars of soap in the shower at any given time.

The product is cleverly designed to prevent the steam and water in the shower area from getting into the case, protecting the soap that is not currently in use.

It is easy to use, and fits perfectly on any bathroom wall be it glass, or plastic.

It is economical, transferable, and needs no technical expertise.

All you have to do is just clean and stick the case to the wall of your shower area, open the case side to load the bar soap, reserve the last bar for the “in-use” space at the bottom of the case.

Also, you can hang your sponge or washcloth under the dispenser to avoid cluttering your shower area. 

Where Do You Come In?

I need your support, backing and donations to bring this product to the market. 

Here are the steps taken and completed so far:

  • The patent has been filed and fully paid for.
  • Several prototypes have been made to ensure a high quality and functional product is made.
  • Tooling has been fully paid for, and completed.
  • Mass production stage - your backing and support is needed to complete this stage

Your Impact

Bar soap usage and acceptability is currently making a 360 U-turn with the advent of natural and specialty soap products.

Soap Stacker cannot come at a better time than this, as many bar soap producers have attested to the viability of the product and I'm looking forward to getting this fantastic product into the bathroom wall of bar soap users around the world.

I am also looking forward to launching bar soap as a gift item for occasions like House warming, Birthdays, Baby showers, etc.

Backing this project will go a long way in making this dream a reality, and your support will be rewarded with the product as soon as it lands in our fulfillment center.

Product Drawings 

Finished Product


Risks & Challenges

The only true risk you are taking is whether or not you like the product. I can assure you that this product is meticulously crafted to take the frustrations users face in the shower area away once and for all.

Bringing a new product into the market involves a lot of ground work and funding. I have taken bold steps to ensure time and resources are not wasted on needless issues.

A committed entrepreneur should not wait for backers to fund the idea from conception to final stages without putting enough skin in the game.

  • All the expenses on the project up till this moment have been fully paid for without sourcing for assistance or support elsewhere.
  • I have sourced everywhere around the world to find a manufacturer that can produce a safe product at the cheapest possible price.
  • Not all plastic materials are safe; I have sourced for top quality PC material to be used in the final production.

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate your time, support, encouragement and trust. Please help me spread the news to your friends, co-workers, and relative to support this project by:

  • Sharing our campaign via your social media platforms and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Encouraging them to pledge their support to this project.

If you're reading this message that means you made it to the bottom of the campaign page and I want to say thank you for taking the time to see what I have been working on :)

'TA

story:
Why scoleoo? 

Have you ever been to a foreign city trying to find something worth doing … quickly? Imagine you and your family looking for a playground or a saturday afternoon activity, you on a business trip having one evening for yourself. You know there is something close by that would fit your needs. There has to be! But how do you find it? Well, you „ask“ the internet. … for hours. Finally the kids are screaming, the evening gets too late, you are annoyed and tired and most likely you end up somewhere where you don’t like it. That was it: your time! Shouldn’t there be a solution for the question: How do I find something quickly, that is worth doing, that is easy to reach and that fits the exact time gap available?

Our free time leaves opportunities for having great times. It should be enjoyed. This time is precious. This time is yours. It is nothing to be wasted.

And yet people spend a lot of time just searching for things that they consider worth doing. On the other hand there are a lot of neat things to do, that people often don’t find. 

We think this needs to be changed! 

What you get 

Scoleoo is our attempt to offer a complete overview about possible activities.

Everywhere. 

For everyone.

We go beyond the metropoles and big events. It's about all day distractions like a good path to take a walk, a local sports game, an amateur theater playing, a library, social gatherings like regional festivals. These things are relevant for communities that seek to become fellowships. These things are relevant for integration. Not only for refugees, but also for those who moved within a country or who just changed life situations. As a parent you need to know about other things than before and as a senior you won't bother about going to playgrounds. People change and they permanently have to learn. Why not learn from one another? 

Scoleoo would like to become a helpful tool that enables everyone to share ideas, to inform and to inspire people when it comes to their free time planning. 

How we do that? 

Scoleoo will reduce the information about activities to what is necessary. This allows us to cut down the use of any language to a minimum, in order to make scoleoo usable universally. It also opens the possibility to cover peripheral regions with our service, because it requires less editorial work. 

Scoleoo will use this standardized data to create a very efficient search. In contrast to other event platforms we take in account the timeframe the searching person has and the timeframe the activity is going to occupy. The results you get will show only those activities that you are able to do. Because everything else is not relevant. You will be able to make a good decision within minutes!

By matching the time slots we will create a timeline in wich you can arrange multiple activities by drag and drop. Organizing a trip to an unknown region becomes extremely easy.

On top of that we plan additional services, such as providing traffic informations, ticket selling, reservations or cooperations with taxi agencies to make scoleoo a real one-stop-platform for leisure time planning. 

 

What else is great

  1. Our pricing system prevents small players from being outcompeeted and opens doors for those who are always in the shadow. Uncommercial posts and displaying basic informations will be for free. Commercial posts cost 1,99€ per event/opening day or less. All these payed posts will have the same size and will be shown in the same way. Our goal is to create the possibility of gaining customers for an event for all players and to make our site attractive for them by offering a fair marketplace . 
  2. We won't collect our users data with the intention to sell it. The data we collect will be given by choice and only be used to improve our own service.
  3. The data we collect will be stored in Europe with European security standards. 

It is hard to believe, but this combination of features does not yet exist!

 

In order to shape the idea we ran a lot of user interviews which proved impressively that we are on the right track. 

 

People want this site!

 

BUT: The way to this vision is not easy. 

 

We need to...

... extend our coding-team in order to make this page run very smoothly

... reach out to potential customers wich includes traveling in order to win them over for our idea even before we have a big audience. 

... run a marketing campaign to inform people about our site in order to gain users and motivate them to share their ideas. 

And that's what we need the money for. 

 

If we make it...

we will be able to launch a first version of scoleoo by March next year and you will be able to share and find activities and to post your event or business. 

 
From then on we will run marketing and sales campaigns to encourage people to use scoleoo and to improve its content. 
As quickly as possible will we then add more services. Having run a lot of user interviews we now have a vision about what people want us to build. It's our goal to cope with that. How fast this will happen depends of course highly on the resources we have, for example to hire coders and other talented experts.
 
As easy as that: The more money we get, the faster will scoleoo become the site the user want it to be.
 
 

Risks and challenges

 

We face several risks. 

  • Not being able to reach the crowd with our message why scoleoo is a good thing to use. It is going to take some time until scoleoo will have reached the point where it can provide content for all the regions we have in mind. Also the functionality of the timeline is not ready yet. But only then it will scoleoo enfold its full value proposition: to serve as an universal site for all destinations. In the beginning people might not find any activities for the region they search in. We face the challenge of making those people come back and try again. 
  • Getting outcompeted. We are neither google, nor facebook, nor AirB'n'B. We don't have a lot of content already in place, we don't have a huge team of developers available and we don't have millions of stock capital. We do the programming with a very small team, we research, we talk to users and to customers. So now we face the challenge of turning these differences into our advantage: Insights about users and customers reach us instantaneously. We have to be very efficient to not waste any money so we need to prioritize and optimize our processes. We are extremely flexible. We are independent. If we chose to rather take a taxi company as a partner that has e-cars, we do so. If our pricing could be optimized in terms of revenue, we can decide to stick with our fair version, just because we want it. We don't have to go for the economically better way because of some stockholders. And we won't sell our data. 
 

Scoleoo is a lean startup with all the advantages and disadvantages that come along with it. 

 

Other ways to help us

 

That is easy:  

  • Share ideas! Put in your knowledge about your home and get inspiration about the rest in return. 
  • Spread the news! Let other people know about scoleoo, share us on facebook, like us, recommend us... the more people know, the better it gets.  

 

That's it! Our big vision of making a good contribution to society. 

Help us to realize it by backing us! 

Thank you!

 

Our Perks

The super cool cap: 

 

The super cool sweater that's included in our fan paket: 

 

The super cool hammock: 

And the super cool Haveagreatday umbrella (our favourit!): 

And of course the packages for the posts. For the pros!

story:
Short Summary

Dance Marathon is a charitable organization that last year raised $1,201,216 for an amazing cause. However this charity has come at a price: the physical well being and sanity of the over 1,000 dancers who participate in the marathon. By raising $1,201,217 (just one dollar more than last year's amount), Sherman Ave hopes to free these dancers from the prison of their own creation, and finally end Dance Marathon, once and for all. With your donation, not only will you be giving money to a good cause, but you will be sending a clear message to Dance Marathon and their inhumane labor practices. Plus more importantly, you won't have to do Dance Marathon! And isn't that a reward in itself?

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise one dollar more than the 2016 Dance Marathon, proving once and for all that you don't have to dance to raise money for charity. What a novel concept! If you donate, here's where your money is going:

  • 75% of profits will go to GiGi's Playhouse, the only nationwide network of Down syndrome achievement centers for children and adults with Down syndrome, offering free educational and therapeutic programs that unleash confidence and promote continuous improvement. Through these programs, campaigns and community engagements, GiGi’s aims to change the world’s outdated perception of individuals with Down syndrome in a movement toward global acceptance for people of all abilities. You can learn more info here.
  • 25% of profits will go to Sherman Ave website maintenance so we can keep up the fight against injustice, wherever and whenever duty may call. Heh, duty. 

Plus, we have some perks for you for donating:

  • If you donate $5 to our campaign, you will receive a "0 Hour Club" sticker, created and designed by Sherman Ave! Put it on your laptop, your water bottle, or even your cat! Let the world know that you haven't done DM, and you're not afraid to show it!

The Impact

Once we free these dancers from their prison-tent, they'll finally be able to live their lives without being burdened by the need to dance to "Mr. Brightside" or having to change into a different arbitrary theme every 3 hours. And more importantly, we will never have to have another Dance Marathon, ending the blight that has plagued this campus for the past 42 years. 

Here are just a few of the things that these dancers will be able to do instead of dancing:

  • Eating
  • Sleeping
  • Finally write that play they've been putting off
  • Watch at least 3 seasons of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. That finale-- OMG!
  • Travel to Australia. Say hi to the kangaroos for me!
  • Tell the man of their dreams they love him and then spend the remaining 29 hours making sweet sweet love
  • Creating a beautiful and intricate sand sculpture, then taking that sculpture apart, grain by grain, as a representation of the splendor of the fleeting nature of life and our reality 
  • Not dancing

Wow! It would almost be a crime NOT to donate!

Risks & Challenges

Dance Marathon is probably going to have a fit when they see this. Oh well!

 

So please consider donating to this worthy cause. And keep on not dancing!!!!

story:
Really, Why REELLYOU

                                                        

In a world currently overloaded with negativity and excess information, our platform will provide:

  1. The inspiration board feature through picture, video, text, and voice over inspires you on what’s important to you and attracts other relevant inspirational information that you desire. We know a HUGE part of success is inspiration, inspiration that leads you to the resources that make you better.
  2. The interactive connection map feature helps you invest in your relationships in a unique way. The map is color coded to allow you to visually see where you can build on complementary relationships, like-mind relationships, mentorship opportunities, and peer-coaching opportunites within your own personal network.
  3. The success timeline feature allows you to document and focus on your personal progress through picture, video and text. You and your friends can visually see and look back on all of the growth you've had toward your goals.

 

 A Little Bit of Background

The REELLYOU idea was birthed in a small room in Quincy, Massachusetts by Michael Alli, a young entrepreneur. The idea was conceived while thinking about the joy he experienced when collaborating with his supportive personal development network, organizing his notes and plans for the future, and brainstorming new ideas. He felt blessed by the people around him and believed because of them he was that much closer to his goals. He then decided to create a platform that inspires and helps others reach their goals as well. He wanted a platform that goes beyond posting the drama of the most recent political debate. He wanted a tool that helped people share life lessons, stories of personal experiences, quotes and much more.

 

 

 

But Can You Really Do it?

 

Michael Alli, Kristen Ransom, and Junior Arroyo combined, have years of experience in the field of personal development and computer programming.

Michael Alli has over 10 years of experience in personal development. He has been a student of some of the most prominent people in the personal development community such as Jim Rohn Tony Robbins, Les Brown, Darren Hardy, Bob Proctor and Zig-Ziglar. His entrepreneurship experience came from building hundreds and hundreds of entrepreneurial teams geared toward financial empowerment and personal development. He Currently coaches public narrative at Harvard University with the ARC Leadership LLC, and has a passion for entrepreneurship and personal development.

 

Kristen Ransom is the CEO and Founder of IncluDe Innovation a software development company that developed the mockups of REELLYOU. She and Junior Arroyo both have user interface, user experience design talent. Kristen's team of developers at IncluDe have over 20 years of combined web development experience. 


Readied with a full detailed budget, that will take us through to the production of our MVP. We are currently in the midst of assembling the rest of the team that will be released as it becomes finalized.

 

In order to make all of this a reality, we need to lay the foundation and that foundation includes YOU!

 

What we need

 

What Do YOU Get?

We have put together a list of great perks and are constantly adding more! If by chance you don't see a perk for the amount that you want to contribute, send us a message and ask us for something. We may think it's a WONDERFUL idea and not only award you that perk, but add it to the list for others to share! 

 

I Want to Donate, But I Can't.

We know not everybody has the ability to donate. But you can help us out by spreading the word. Please share this story with us on Facebook, Twitter, and beyond. You never know. Your grandmother's-hairdresser's-god-daughter's-best friend's cousin may be able to. 

 

Thank you and God Bless,

Michael, Kristen, Junior

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Ben, and I first met Govinda in 2010 when he was the farm manager at the Sustainable Agriculture Development Program of Nepal. Govinda told me about his dream and asked if I could help him to establish his own NGO to contribute positively to the present and future of Nepal, and I gladly agreeed to do what I could. 
  • This campaign is close to my heart. Over the years, Govinda and I have worked together - with the help of many other awesome people - to realise his dream. After 6 years of concerted effort, we have almost realised the full extent of Govinda's dream!
  • Your contribution will help Govinda realise his dream, by allowing him to build accomodation for his family,  farm workers, visiting farmers and school groups, and volunteers. It will ultimately allow Govinda to host Nepali farmers and school groups for training and education sessions and programs. Your contribution will in the long run, help make Nepal a more sustainable and equitable place for all who call it home.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To realise this goal, we need to raise $18,000. All of these funds will be spent on the construction of the buildings required to accomodate Govinda's family,  farm workers, visiting farmers and school groups, and volunteers. I can personally vouch for Govinda. His integrity, honesty, and what he refers to as his "duty" has and continues to inspire me. 
  • As part of this campaign, we are offering a number of awesome perks! These perks will differ given the amount you donate and are all something to get excited about.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will be utilized to construct the buildings of most importance. This would include a house for Govinda's family and farm workers, and a building for visiting farmers and school groups. In time, appropriate accommodation would be built for foreign volunteers who wish to  learn about organic, sustainable agriculture and Nepali culture.

The Impact

  • This project is incredibly valuable to Govinda and the world at large. With unsustainable agricultural practices, and global inequality at unprecedented levels - not to mention the very real link between the two - projects like this are becoming ever more valuable.
  • Mountain View Eco Farm has a proven track record with respect to organisation goals, and fundraising success and accountability. In 2013, we managed to raise $4000 to purchase farm animals and equipment, and so far, Govinda has demonstrated a great deal of entrepreneurship, tenacity and hard-work.
  • If you don't believe us, feel free to check out Mountain View Eco Farm's website or Facebook page. Even better, head over to Nepal and check it out for yourself.

Risks & Challenges

  • We realize that fundraising can be challenging, and that funds can be hard to come by. We believe however, that we have the enthusiasm, the drive and the tenacity to ensure that our goal is reached.
  • Our plan is to promote this campaign as wide and far as possible, utilizing our extensive social networks in Nepal and internationally and through the promotion of our campaign through online articles and communities of people sympathetic to our cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If for whatever reason you can't contribute financially, we'd love it if you could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to promote this campaign.

And that's all there is to it  :)

story:
The Nerd's Closet is the more social Social Network for nerds, geeks, dystopia addicts, and sci-fi aficionados. Our aim is to create an inclusive environment for people who are tired of being trolled, harassed and pushed around to engage in civil discourse on topics ranging from Game of Thrones to Pokemon to Dungeons & Dragons. In short anyone with any interest or opinion is allowed to contribute as long as you are willing to learn, be respectful, and don't mind being called a nerd! That's why strongly discourage trolling, inappropriate or discriminatory language (PG-13), and online harassment. Those who violate our guidelines will be subject to cyber-banishment of the worst possible kind!



Hi. We're The Nerd’s Closet. We are a group of extremely motivated and talented high school seniors and programmers from Chicago, Illinois. We are trying to help make the internet a safer, more positive place by limiting the amount of harassment present online. Our next project is to create an online community that embodies our goals, while also being diverse and collaborative.  But we need your help.

We need to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of launching the community or it cannot reach its fullest potential. So we're turning to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering TNC swag like t-shirts and headphones, Gift Cards, and even the chance to be part of our team! Your contribution will help us finalize and secure our community, and further, it will help make the internet a much more fun, positive place. Thanks!



The Nerd’s Closet is an online community that aims make the internet a safer, more positive place by limiting the amount of harassment present online. We want to be a safe place where users can discuss, create and innovate together without the fear of having their opinions ridiculed. Our aim is to create a self-sufficient, full-fledged internet experience that is removed from the negativity that the internet has become infamous for. But promoting a positive environment does not mean that our community will be boring or less functional than other communities. We will still have a blog, a forum, and even a custom social media network for you to enjoy. Other anti-harassment online communities tend to act as a support system to help people who have already been harassed online, which is wonderful, but it doesn’t prevent the problem. The Nerd’s Closet is different because it provides a harassment free space where you can do everything that you normally do on the web; shop, chat, play games, etc., that just happens to be harassment free.


 

Our plan is to always put our users first; as such, it is our goal that a great majority of our content, style, and tone is created by our users. This ensures that everyone's voice is heard (provided they contribute, of course!) .


According to a Pew Research Center survey, 40% of people have been harassed online, and 73% of people have witnessed someone else being harassed . Among people between the ages of 18 and 29, this figure jumps up to 92%. For too long, many people have been suffering because they feel unsafe or unsupported. With The Nerd’s Closet, you’ll enter a place where you can feel safe and loved, a place where you can fearlessly speak your mind. The Nerd’s Closet is creating a different kind of internet, where diversity, equality, and tolerance are valued over negativity and bickering. We want to start an internet revolution. But we need your help to make it a reality.




A Little More About Some Specific Rewards:
  1. Becoming a Blogger (Planet Pack and higher): This reward offers contributors to be a official blogger on our site. All users, can submit articles and post on our blog, but bloggers receive extra perks, like promotion of their post and special access to the forums and social networks as a contributors. Quality bloggers can apply to receive compensation. 
  2. Printing T-Shirts that You've Designed (Constellation Pack Ultra): This reward allows you to get t-shirts of your own design printed by us through Printful. Just email us your design at business.thenerdscloset@gmail.com. Make sure you design is in an image file (.png, .jpg, etc), and that it's 8 colors or less.
  3. Helping Design Our Site (Galaxy Pack Ultra): This reward allows you to choose the design of our site. We'll contact you, via email, phone, or social media (your preference), where you'll get your chance to tell us your ideas about our theme, color palette, and mascot. You'll be listed on our site as a designer, and you'll get special access to our social network and forums. If we like your work, we may just hire you!
  4. Joining our Team (Universe Pack): This reward allows you to join our team permanently! We'll give you a role dependent on your skills. Please note that all of the TNC team members are not paid a salary as of now, and you would only be receiving a portion of the profit. We'll contact you, via email, phone, or social media (your preference) to discuss your skills and discuss contract agreement.
  5. Tech Gift Basket (Universe Pack Ultra): This gift basket contains a plethora of randomized gift cards, tech accessories, and more. The total basket will contain all new items, and the retail value will be around 300-500 dollars, so you won't be getting any cheap products.

 As with all online endeavors, there are bound to be hiccups along the way. However, the team working on the project is very capable of handling any problems that come our way, such as: 

  • User Security/Privacy

    • We understand that creating a harassment-free online space means that our community and users will inevitably lead to trolls and hackers attempting to disrupt or destroy it. The Nerd’s Closet has anticipated these threats, and will enact the following steps to ensure our users privacy and security (these are just a few):

      • Two factor authentication

      • Moderated accounts, submissions and messaging

      • Strict anti-spam rules

      • SSL

      • Utilizing a Web Application Firewall

  • Monetization

    • While the money you contribute will keep The Nerd’s Closet running for a year, the site needs to be profitable after that for the community to stay open. In the short term, we will create an online store with collectibles, video games, and other items to support ourselves with minimal ad revenue. In the long term, we may explore a subscription service.

  • Freedom of Speech

    • Our community will face the challenge of potential users who will believe this community inhibits their First Amendment rights. Because The Nerd’s Closet is a private space, we have the right to set our own rules about what is considered harassment or not. For more information, click here.

  

Every dollar helps, but if you can't donate, you can still help us reach our goal! By sharing this fundraiser via Twitter, Facebook, or email, you can help us spread the news! The bigger our social network, the more likely we will reach our goal! You can also check out our website and see how we're progressing. Or, consider joining our community, or helping us out by donating your time and talent instead. 
Thank you for reading, and we hope you consider donating today!

The bigger our social network, the more likely we will reach our goal! You can also check out our website and see how we're progressing. story:
Short Summary

The International Vegan Collaborative's mission is to support those that want to live, eat and work vegan. This campaign is intended specifically to help vegans live--as in places to live, or places to stay--from short-term (such as couchsurfing, bed & breakfasts, and vacation timeshares) to long term (finding vegan roommates,  renting a room in a vegan home, or creating vegan communities). 


My name is Deborah Brister and I'm the Executive Director of the International Vegan Collaborative. We started the Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates campaign because we want to ensure that every person that becomes vegan has the support and resources available to stay vegan. This includes human resources like the people closest to us--those sharing the same home. For vegans, the people that stay with us, visit us, and live with us, can be difficult to be around if they do not support the vegan lifestyle. 


Our mission is simple: make it as easy as possible to connect vegans with vegans. Up to this point, we have been doing this through our database and social media. We have helped many vegans connect, nationally and internationally, however we have been doing it on a personalized basis to ensure privacy is maintained.  Extensive effort, on our part, is given to those serious about finding the right tenant, roommate, host or guest. We are a volunteer-based organization and due to the massive explosion of new vegans, we have outgrown this system and now need to become more efficient and automated. Therefore, this campaign is to provide funding for a new, customized program and mobile app that vegans can use to interact with each other much easier, quicker and safer than ever before. 

With a dedicated website and mobile app, specifically designed for vegans, we hope to pinpoint more compatible vegan roommates, guests, hosts and landlords. In addition, we want to provide greater opportunities for those interested in living in vegan communities and group living spaces, even including vegan senior cooperative living. We want to improve the way vegans live--for the rest of their lives.


What We Need 

We are asking $3000 to create the IVC Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates program and mobile app. We are seeking to create a simple-to-use program that will easily, quickly and safely connect vegans to other vegans looking for short to long term living/vacationing homes/spaces/communities. 

Why is this different from other housing/roommate finder apps?

The central focus is on connecting vegans. It’s not just a little checkbox on a generic broad housing/roommate finder app. We put veganism as the first and foremost consideration when selecting a new home whether it’s for one day, a week, a year, or longer. The most important consideration is sharing space with like-minded compassionate vegan housemates or roommates.

The app will do four things:

1)  Connect vegans with a whole continuum of vegan living situations from short to long term (couch-surfing to B & B’s to vacation timeshares to renting).

2)  Consider a whole continuum of vegan lifestyles and attitudes to ensure best matches between roommates.

3)  Provide opportunities to privately organize and build vegan groups and develop larger cooperative living if desired.

4)  Integrate vegan businesses and restaurants into searches to support and strengthen vegan communities.

We want to get this app running as an automated program and anticipate eventually charging a minimal monthly or annual fee to use it (Note that all donors of this Indiegogo campaign will receive a free lifetime pass to use this service). Anticipating growth in the coming one to two years, we will then generate enough revenue to have a 2.0 version created. 

What You Get

The perks for this campaign include:

$5: Free lifetime access to the IVC Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates app and website and an International Vegan Collaborative (IVC) piglet sticker. 

$20: One of four IVC custom animal prints suitable for framing, a piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.

$50: An IVC adult t-shirt, children's t-shirt, or baby onesie with our custom animal prints plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.

$75: An IVC farmers market tote-bag, plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.

$100: A custom individually numbered IVC copper and gemstone necklace, plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.



The Impact

This project is valuable because it supports all vegans who need a new place to relax, a new home, or a new roommate. The mobile app and website go beyond typical roommate sites as veganism is the focus, not an afterthought. This is all about building relationships, building a great vegan home and  building amazing vegan communities. 



Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute. That's okay. Getting the word out through your social media, facebook,  Meetup or other groups would be huge for us!  Also, if you're interested in volunteering for the International Vegan Collaborative, please contact us. We'd love a hand or two :)

My name is Deborah Brister and I'm the Executive Director of the International Vegan Collaborative. We started the Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates campaign because we want to ensure that every person that becomes vegan has the support and resources available to stay vegan. This includes human resources like the people closest to us--those sharing the same home. For vegans, the people that stay with us, visit us, and live with us, can be difficult to be around if they do not support the vegan lifestyle. 



Our mission is simple: make it as easy as possible to connect vegans with vegans. Up to this point, we have been doing this through our database and social media. We have helped many vegans connect, nationally and internationally, however we have been doing it on a personalized basis to ensure privacy is maintained.  Extensive effort, on our part, is given to those serious about finding the right tenant, roommate, host or guest. We are a volunteer-based organization and due to the massive explosion of new vegans, we have outgrown this system and now need to become more efficient and automated. Therefore, this campaign is to provide funding for a new, customized program and mobile app that vegans can use to interact with each other much easier, quicker and safer than ever before. 
With a dedicated website and mobile app, specifically designed for vegans, we hope to pinpoint more compatible vegan roommates, guests, hosts and landlords. In addition, we want to provide greater opportunities for those interested in living in vegan communities and group living spaces, even including vegan senior cooperative living. We want to improve the way vegans live--for the rest of their lives.


   

What
We Need 
We are asking $3000 to
create the IVC Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates program and mobile app. We are
seeking to create a simple-to-use program that will easily, quickly and safely
connect vegans to other vegans looking for short to long term
living/vacationing homes/spaces/communities. 
Why is this different from other housing/roommate
finder apps?
The central focus is on
connecting vegans. It’s not just a little checkbox on a generic broad
housing/roommate finder app. We put veganism as the first and foremost consideration when selecting a new home whether
it’s for one day, a week, a year, or longer. The most important consideration
is sharing space with like-minded compassionate vegan housemates or roommates. 
The app will do four things:
1) 
Connect vegans
with a whole continuum of vegan living
situations from short to long term (couch-surfing to B & B’s to vacation
timeshares to renting).
2) 
Consider a whole continuum of vegan lifestyles and attitudes
to ensure best matches between roommates. 
3) 
Provide
opportunities to privately organize and
build vegan groups and develop larger cooperative living if desired.
4) 
Integrate vegan businesses and restaurants into searches to support and strengthen vegan
communities.
We want to get this app running as
an automated program and anticipate eventually charging a minimal monthly
or annual fee to use it (Note that all donors of this Indiegogo campaign will
receive a free lifetime pass to use this service). Anticipating growth in the
coming one to two years, we will then generate enough revenue to have a 2.0
version created. 
What
You Get
The perks for this
campaign include:$5: Free lifetime access to the IVC Vegan Housing Vegan Roommates app and website and an International Vegan Collaborative (IVC) piglet sticker. 
$20: One of four IVC
custom animal prints suitable for framing, a piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.
$50: An IVC adult t-shirt,
children's t-shirt, or baby onesie with our custom animal prints plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.
$75: An IVC farmers market
tote-bag, plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.
$100: A custom individually
numbered IVC copper and gemstone necklace, plus a framable print, piglet sticker and lifetime access to website and app.The
Impact
This project is
valuable because it supports all vegans who need a new place to relax, a new home, or a new roommate. The mobile app and website go beyond typical roommate sites as veganism is the focus, not an afterthought. This is all about building relationships, building a great vegan home and  building amazing vegan communities. 


Other
Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't contribute. That's okay. Getting the word out through your social media, facebook,  Meetup or other groups would be huge for us!  Also, if you're interested in volunteering for the International Vegan Collaborative, please contact us. We'd love a hand or two :)

story:
Tenemos traducción en español abajo

Vous trouverez une traduction en francais plus bas.

 

Why should you help us

Before you go further, here are the main reasons to help us :

- Local social impact : Lanquin is a very poor farming area where most people struggle to make a living. By donating, you will directly help finance the creation of a sustainable farming project (tuqtuqilal), including "permaculture" farming and a cacao cooperative initiative.

The revenues generated by our shop will be largely (more than 50%) reinvested into these projects.

The goal is to increase the quality of life of the local farmers and introduce their cacao to international fine cacao market, aiding the sustainable development of the local community, who largely subsist on no more than a dollar a day!

- For the chocolate! : If you never plan to visit Lanquin, then you may feel that you don't care about all that... which is fair enough. But you could feel, perhaps, that tourists visiting the area, as well as the people living here permanently, should have access to great chocolate. We want to make that a reality. Everyone would be very grateful of your support, and that will hopefully make you feel very good!

- For education : Our chocolate tour aims to teach people about chocolate and cacao in general, but more importantly, we teach how to make incredible "bean to bar" chocolate at home. The goal is for people to realize that chocolate is in fact very easy to make! So there should be no reason for anyone to go out and buy the overly processed 'chocolate' that is sold in supermarkets. The chocolate revolution needs you!

 

INTRODUCTION

Hey everyone.

My name is Esteban, also referred to around here as the "chocolate wizard"!

For the last 4 years I have been living around the area of Semuc Champey, Guatemala, working extensively  with cacao. I have gained experience running a chocolate tour for Utopia Eco-Hotel for 3 years, and for the last year I have been working on a local cacao farm.

I am now working to create a small chocolate house in the village of Lanquin, were hundreds of tourists pass daily to visit the nearby park.

I am looking to provide excellent quality chocolate products for the tourists, but also for the local Maya population.

For the last 3 months, I have been creating an testing different products (blocks of chocolate, chocolate balls, granola bars, etc...) to evaluate the market potential. With just one volunteer going around for a few hours per day, it is easy to see that the potential is huge!

After all... people tend to love chocolate!

(our chocolates displayed in a shop in town)

I already have the equipment for small batch chocolate making, stocks of products, knowledge of the town and its market potential, and contact with cacao farmers and tourist industry.

What I need help with mostly is the initial investment, which would cover: fridge, gas stove, furniture, etc... with your help, we can offer the village of Lanquin its new favorite shop:

THE LANQUIN CHOCOLATE HOUSE

 

The products :

I have been making chocolates for years, and I have heard so many time that it was the best chocolate that people have ever had. I am therefor very confident in its success!

Our main products will be chocolate balls, which we already sell to both locals and tourist. We only do straight chocolate flavors for now but with a shop we could diversify.

Imagine chocolate infused with cardamom, vanilla, chili pepper, granola mix, peanut butter, honey... the possibilities are endless.

 

We will also sell blocks of chocolate, hot chocolate drinks, crepes (I'm French after all...), ice cream, and other delicious healthy homemade treats.

 

Truly the candy-man shop!

 

The location :

Because a successful shop is mostly a matter of great location, we are happy to announce we have managed to secure an incredible spot.

It is in the very center of the village, on the side of the street going to the national park, so EVERY tourist will pass by on their way to Semuc Champey. 

Tourists visiting the village on foot will almost certainly stop at the shop (would you not visit a chocolate house?!) and tourists who drive past the shop on their way to the park will be left with a strong chocolaty impression in their minds. 

The shop itself is split into two sections, consisting of a kitchen and crafting area in the back, and a section in the front to both showcase, and sell our products. At the front there is a large window so that we can sell directly on to the street.

Truly the perfect spot (and i personally know the owners)

The costs :

We are located in a very rural part of Guatemala where life is still pretty cheap. The rent will be of Q1500 (200$) per month (including water and electricity). Taxes are 5% of the profit, and the salary for 1 employee is around Q2000 (250$) (which could increase with a commission based if things go well). So, at least at the beginning, we only need to sell around 400 bags of chocolate balls to pay for production costs and ALL the business costs.

So far, a single volunteer, working casually for a few hours a day sells an average of 200 bags per month. So, with a permanent and more famous location, as well as a diversity of products, I have no doubt that this objective can be reached.

But delicious treats are not the only thing we offer. One of the main purposes of the shop will be to advertise our chocolate workshop :

THE LANQUIN CHOCOLATE TOUR

This tour is running already (years of experience has shown it to be very popular) but lacks publicity and general awareness. A fixed location from which to advertise will greatly help to establish the tour as a permanent feature of Lanquins tourism industry.

It will also give us a place were we can sell tickets and answer direct questions from tourists. For now, we only receive bookings via the internet or local partners. The tour has enormous income potential, and the shop will also allow us to attract potential customers through allowing them to try the chocolate...

 

THE CACAO COOPERATIVE

One of the biggest projects we are undertaking is to try to create a sustainable high quality market for the cacao of the area. For that, we are currently working with small cacao farmers and bigger farms to regroup them under a cooperative structure.

 One of the main goals would be to start making high quality cacao beans by increasing the quality of the fermentation and drying processes.

As a shop we would benefit from the cooperative, as we would purchase cacao directly from them. Moreover, as tourists continue to buy our products, it could help put the cacao from Lanquin into the international fine cacao market. We are already in contact with many chocolatiers across the globe that are ready to give it a chance!

Most importantly, it could represent an enormous increase in income for the local farmers, as well of pride in their work!

 

You can visit our website to know more about it : http://lanquinchocolate.com

 

What do We Need ?

 

1) 3 months location for the shop : 500$

Once again, this is a fantastic location in the very center of the village (which can have THOUSANDS of local people on market days!) with excellent visibility and great inside potential. And we are already on good term with the owners.

3 months worth of upfront capital should be plenty to get everything started, and running smoothly.

 

2) 3 months salary for 1 employee : 800$

We want at least 1 local employee to work at the shop and help us there. Ideally we will need 2.

It is a great job opportunity around here, where the job market is extremely restricted. We will also use the help of volunteers (mostly to have English speaking people in the shop with more awareness of tourists desires and sales techniques).

The goal is to train the locals to become efficient caretakers of the shop, as well as productive sales representatives.

While the local minimum wage is around Q 1200, we intend to pay a base of Q 2000 and, with time, they will receive commission on sales, and potentially end up with a very good, steady salary. This kind of development would please us a lot!

 

3) Furniture and decoration : 900$

Whilst hard to evaluate, we have every intention of being frugal. We live in an area that produces a lot of wood for construction, so we can purchase material for cheap. A very good friend of mine is a wood-worker and he is looking for a place to showcase his work, so we will be able to work out a discounted price in exchange for his expertise. 

We don't need very much to start. A few shelves and tables, a big paint job inside, a few plants, nice lamps and it would all be ready. We will continue to make it nicer as we move forward! 

We also have a big window that opens on to the street, so even if the inside is not completely finished, we can already start selling.

Most important will be the outside decoration, because that's what will bring people in. For that, we will start by printing some big vinyl posters, and in the future we want to find a person to paint the entire facade with Mayan chocolate theme decoration.

 

4) CACAO! : 400$

Buying good cacao here is not as easy as it should be, and hopefully will be, soon!

It would be too long to explain it all here (you'll find more on that topic on our website) but we are currently working with a permaculture farming project to create a local cacao cooperative, in order to produce high quality cacao beans.

In order to support that, we are ready to purchase our cacao at least double the normal local prices.

With that much, we should easily last the 3 first months. and if not... it will mean that we sold a lot which is perfect. Then we'll just get more!

We also intend to sell cacao beans directly to customers from the shop.

 

5) Fridge and stove : 700$

Even if we could start without them they will make our life much easier and less stressful in term of supply and demand.

Many of our products need to be refrigerated (crepe doe, jams, chocolates, etc...) to stay good for longer time period. We are in the middle of the jungle and it gets really hot and humid here.

ALL of our products are very healthy, natural and homemade, and they don't have any preservatives in them, so refrigeration is crucial.

The gas stove will primarily be used to roast the cacao, and make crepes and bread. And, in the future, why not make several other cakes and delicious bakery goods (I'm allowed to dream of jungle croissants!).
 

The Impact

This project could become very big, both for the people living in Lanquin, and for visitors:

- Obviously, it will give everyone a place to make their stomach happy, buy good chocolate, homemade natural products, healthy snacks, etc...

- Lanquin is mostly dependent on tourism so we intend to expand the "chocolate reputation" of the area, which is a big cacao producer. We intend for our chocolate tour to become a main attraction of the area, and something which draws in tourists from all over Guatemala!

- The creation of the cacao cooperative could end up bringing local cacao into the international market for fine chocolate. We are in touch with many bean to bar chocolate makers from around the world, and they are always interested in fine, sustainable cacao like ours. For the local farmers, it could mean a 5-10 times increase of their usual income.

- It will also create new jobs in the area, and if it works very well then we could start a bigger chocolate factory project, that could potentially export chocolate around the globe!

 

Risks & Challenges

Hard to say...

Once again, we have been conducting sale experiments over the last few months and so far it has been very well received.

Much of the local population, and most of the hostels in the area are now aware of our products, so it should not take long to start.

The real danger would be if someone else did it before us!

One of the challenges would actually be if we end up selling much more than anticipated, because we only have equipment for small scale business... but hey... if we make too much money and not not enough products, then we will happily buy better machines and hire more employees!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have good painting skills, we will take a volunteer to help us with all the painting job.

We will also take volunteers to help us with the chocolate making and in the shop when it opens. You can check our workaway profile here : WORKAWAY

If you can and want to help in any other way, feel free to contact us and we can see what we can do.

 

 

--- FRANCAIS --- FRANCAIS--- FRANCAIS ---

 

 

Pourquoi nous aider ?

Avant d'aller plus loin, en voici les raisons principales  :

- Impact social :

Lanquin est un village rural où la plupart des gens vivent avec moins de 1$ par jour. En soutenant notre projet, vous participerez directement à la création d'un projet d'agriculture durable (le projet "Tuqtuq'ilal") ainsi qu'à la mise en place d'une coopérative pour le cacao.

Les revenus générés par la boutique seront en grande partie (plus de 50%) réinvestis dans ces projets. Le but étant d'augmenter significativement le niveau de vie des fermiers locaux et d'introduire leur cacao sur le marché international aidant ainsi au développement des communitées locales.

- Pour le chocolat! :

Si vous n'avez pas l'intention de visiter Lanquin, vous vous dites peut-etre que tout cela ne vous concerne pas...! Mais peut-être pourriez-vous juste vous dire que les touristes de passage ainsi que les résidants permanents devraient pouvoir avoir accès à du chocolat de bonne qualité, ce qui n'est pas le cas actuellement. Nous voulons faire de cela une réalité.

Nous offrons également des cours de confection de chocolat maison, donc on se sait jamais... peut-être une de vos connaissances passera un jour par ici et reviendra vous voir avec son propre chocolat... et vous apprendra à son tour à faire le vôtre !

En tout cas, tout le monde vous remerciera de votre aide et notre espoir sera que vous y trouviez de la joie  :)

- Pour la formation :

Nous mettons l'accent sur deux aspects : la production et la consommation.

D'une part, nous allons travailler avec les fermiers locaux pour introduire de meilleures techniques de production de cacao afin d'en augmenter sa qualité et sa valeur.

D'autre part, nous voudrons apporter de nouvelles connaissances à nos visiteurs et leur faire prendre conscience qu'un chocolat de haute qualité peut se préparer dans n'importe quelle cuisine. Le 'Tour Chocolat' est destiné à leur apprendre la technique de fabrication à partir de fèves de cacao ainsi que l'histoire du chocolat.  Libérons-nous du joug de l'industrie du mauvais chocolat , dangereux pour notre santé !

La révolution du chocolat a besoin de vous!

 

Pour en savoir plus, je vous invite à visiter notre site (anglais et espagnol) : http://lanquinchocolate.com

 

INTRODUCTION

Bonjour tout le monde.

Je m'appelle Esteban, aussi connu par ici comme le "chocolate wizard"!

 

Je vis depuis 4 ans dans les environs de Semuc Champey, Guatemala. J'ai aquis mon expérience en faisant des "tours chocolats" à "Utopia Eco Hostel" pendant 3 ans et j'ai ensuite passé 1 an a travailler dans une ferme de cacao locale.

Je travaille maintenant à la création d'une petite chocolaterie dans le village de Lanquin où des centaines de touristes viennent quotidiennement visiter le parc national.

Je cherche à fournir du chocolat de haute qualité à la fois aux touristes et à la population locale maya.

Pendant les 3 derniers mois, j'ai créé et mis à l'essai toute une gamme de produits (blocs de chocolats, boules de chocolats, beurre de cacahuète, barres granolas, glaces, etc...) afin de tester le marché potentiel. Avec seulement un volontaire travaillant quelques heures par jour, le potentiel apparaît très large.

Après tout, les humains ont tendance à aimer le chocolat !

(Nos chocolats exposés dans une boutique de la ville)

Nous possédons déjà l'équipement nécessaire pour faire le chocolat, nous avons un stock de produits en réserve, nous connaissons bien la ville et ses habitants, son marché potentiel ainsi que les fermiers et l'activité touristique.

Nous avons besoin de votre aide principalement pour l'investissement initial, ce qui inclut : frigo, gazinière, fournitures, décoration, loyer et salaires. Avec votre aide, nous pourrions offrir à Lanquin sa nouvelle boutique favorite :

"THE LANQUIN CHOCOLATE HOUSE"

 

Les produits :

Je fais du chocolat depuis des annees et j'ai entendu tellement souvent qu'il était parmis le meilleur chocolat que la plupart des gens ont pû goûter; de ce fait, je suis très confiant quant au succès de l'opération!

Notre produit principal sera la Boule de chocolat, que nous vendons déjà à la fois aux touristes et aux locaux. Pour le moment nous ne faisons "que" saveur chocolat mais avec une boutique nous pourrions nous permettre de  varier grandement notre gamme.

Imaginez des chocolats à la cardamome, vanille, piment, granola, beurre de cacahuète, miel, etc... les possibilités sont infinies et beaucoup de ces épices peuvent être produites localement.

Nous avons aussi l'intention de faire de la vente directe de fèves de cacao

 

J'offrirais également des blocs de chocolats, des chocolats chauds, des crèpes (apres tout je suis francais!), des glaces et tout un tas de délicieuses choses faites maison.

 

Bienvenue chez le "candyman"

La location :

Parce que le succès d'une boutique est grandement lié à son emplacement, nous sommes heureux d'annoncer que nous avons sécurisé un des meilleurs spot de la ville.

La boutique sera extrêmement centrale, sur la rue principale. Tous les touristes passeront devant au moins 2 fois en allant visiter le parc national.

Ceux qui visiterons le village à pieds, s'arrêterons sûrement (après tout, il s'agit d'une chocolaterie, dur de résister n'est-ce pas?!) et ceux qui seront dans les camionettes en partance pour le parc ne pourrons que se rappeller de notre belle devanture et de son gros signe "LANQUIN CHOCOLATE"...

Le local est séparé en deux et nous donne la possibilité d'aménager un espace cuisine et confection et un espace boutique et restaurant. Nous disposerons également d'une grande ouverture sur la rue ce qui facilitera grandement la vente.

C'est vraiment l'emplacement parfait!

 

Les coûts :

Nous sommes situés dans une région très rurale du Guatemala où le coût de la vie est très bas. La location du local sera de Q1500 par mois (170 euros) incluant eau et électricité. Les taxes sont de 5% du chiffre d'affaire et le salaire pour un employé est d'environ Q2000 (230 euros) mais qui pourrait augmenter significativement avec un systeme de comission par vente. Donc, au moins pour le départ, nous aurons juste besoin de vendre environs 400 sac de boules  en chocolat par mois pour couvrir tous nos frais.

Pour l'instant, un seul volontaire vend en moyenne 200 sacs par mois sans difficultés. Avec une boutique permanente et connue ainsi qu'une plus grande diversité de produits, je n'ai aucun doute que nous atteindrons largement cet objectif.

Mais nous ne visons pas qu'à remplir l'estomac de nos clients. L'un des principaux objectifs de la boutique sera d'assurer la promotion de notre "classe de chocolat"

 

"THE LANQUIN CHOCOLATE TOUR"

Le tour est déjà en fonctionnement (et des années d'expérience passées ont prouvé qu'il était très populaire) mais manque de visibilité. Avec un emplacement fixe pour en faire la promotion, nous espérons que notre tour deviendra une des attractions touristique clé de Lanquin.

La boutique nous offrira la possibilité de faire goûter notre chocolat aux gens ce qui est la forme la plus efficace de promotion. Pour le moment, nous ne recevons des reservations que via internet ou certains hôtels partenaires. Correctement implanté, ce tour offre d'enormes perspectives financières et éducatives.

 

La coopérative de cacao

 

Un des plus gros projets auquel nous participons est la création d'un marché durable et de haute qualité pour le cacao local. Pour cela, nous travaillons à regrouper petits et grands fermiers en une coopérative.

Un des objectifs principaux étant de réintroduire de bonnes techniques de fermentation et de séchage du cacao qui ont malheureusement été perdues au fil du temps, principalement à cause des prix ridiculement bas du marché local et du fait que le prix de vente ne change pas en fonction de la qualité du cacao...

En tant que chocolaterie, nous bénéficierons de la coopérative en nous y fournissant directement. Mais le but est de réussir à introduire le cacao de Lanquin sur les marchés internationaux et pour cela nous sommes déjà en contact avec de nombreux chocolatiers dans le monde prêts à lui donner sa chance!

Plus important, cela représentera une énorme augmentation du niveau de vie des fermiers locaux ansi que de la fierté de leur travail!

 

De quoi avons nous besoin ?

 

1) 3 mois de location pour la boutique : 500$ (420 euros)

Encore une fois, l'emplacement de ce local est parfaitement idéal autant en terme de visibilité que d'aménagement et nous sommes en bons termes avec les propriétaires.

Trois mois devraient suffire pour bien démarrer notre activité.

 

2) 3 mois de salaire pour un employé : 800$ (700 euros)

Nous souhaitons au minimum un employé local pour nous aider à la boutique mais notre but est d'en embaucher deux.

Il s'agit d'une excéllente perspective d'emploi par ici oú le marché de l'emploi est extrêmement restreint. Nous ferons également appel a l'aide de volontaires notamment pour avoir des vendeurs parlant anglais et avec une meilleure compréhension des désirs des touristes ainsi que de techniques de vente.

Le but étant d'entraîner nos employés locaux à devenir de bons vendeurs et a apprendre une nouvelle langue. A terme, avec un système de commission sur les ventes, ils pourront sécuriser un très bon salaire dans des conditions de travail agréables. Et cela nous ferait très plaisir!

 

3) Fournitures et décoration : 900$ (750 euros)

Il s'agit là d'un coût difficile à évaluer mais nous avons l'intention d'être tres économiques. Nous vivons dans une zone qui produit du bois de construction et nous pouvons donc l'obtenir à bas prix. Un très bon ami travaille le bois et cherche une facon d'exposer son travail donc nous allons pouvoir nous entraider sur ce point.

Nous n'avons pas besoin de beaucoup pour nous lancer : Quelques étagères, tables, peinture, quelques plantes, lampes et cela sera déjà très bien. Nous continuerons à rendre l'endroit plus agréable au fur et à mesure. Nous disposons d'une fenêtre pour vendre directement sur la rue ce qui nous permettra de démarrer la vente même si l'intérieur n'est pas complètement fini.

 

4) CACAO! : 400$ (330 euros)

Il n'est pour l'instant pas si simple de trouver du bon cacao dans la région mais comme nous l'avons déjà expliqué, cela devrait changer assez rapidement avec l'introduction de techniques d'agriculture durable ainsi que la création d'une coopérative de cacao.

C'est un sujet assez complexe que nous expliquons plus clairement sur notre site internet.

Pour le moment nous payons déjà le double des prix locaux au fermiers qui produise du bon cacao.

Ce montant nous permettrait de couvrir largement nos frais d'achat de cacao pendant au moins trois mois et sinon cela veut dire que nous vendons bien plus que prevu ce qui est parfait.

 

5) Frigo et gazinière : 700$ (585 euros)

Une bonne partie de nos produits nécessitent d'être refrigerés (pâte à crèpe, confitures, chocolats, etc...) afin de se conserver correctement. Nous vivons au milieu de la jungle et il peut faire très chaud et humide.

Tous nos produits étant sains et fait maison, ils ne contiennent pas de conservateurs.

La gazinière quant à elle servira principalement à faire les crepes et à torréfier le cacao mais nous pourrons également ajouter du pain frais au menu et diffuser notre art national le plus célèbre et peut-être un jour... nos propres pains au chocolat (faire de la pâte feuilletee dans la jungle s'avère très compliqué... mais j'ai le droit de rêver!).

 

L'impact

Ce projet pourrait prendre beaucoup d'ampleur, à la fois pour les touristes et les locaux :

- Cela offrira à tout le monde un lieu pour satisfaire son palais, manger du bon chocolat, des produits naturels, sains et faits maisons, etc...

- Lanquin dépend largement du tourisme; notre projet pourrait augmenter sa réputation pour le chocolat. Après tout, il s'agit d'une zone fortement productrice de cacao. Nous espérons faire de notre tour une des attractions phare de la ville afin d'attirer plus de monde et inciter les visiteurs à rester plus longtemps.

- La création de la coopérative de cacao pourrait propulser le cacao local sur les marchés internationaux de cacao de haute qualité.  Pour les fermiers locaux, cela pourrait multiplier de 5 a 10 fois leurs revenus.

- Nous allons aussi créer de nouveaux emplois et dans un futur un peu plus lointain on pourrait imaginer l'élargissement de la production de chocolat...

 

Les risques

Difficile à dire...

Encore une fois, nous avons conduit des expériences de ventes durant les derniers mois et jusqu'à présent cela s'est plutôt bien passé.

Beaucoup de gens au village connaissent nos produits et demandent ou les acheter.

Le vrai danger serait que quelqu'un d'autre ne le fasse avant nous!

 

Autre façon de nous aider

Si vous êtes un peintre talentueux en visite au Guatemala, nous avons besoin de vous!

Nous prenons aussi des volontaires, vous pouvez visiter notre page ici : WORKAWAY

Et si vous souhaitez nous aider de quelques autres façon, n'hésitez pas, nous sommes ouverts à toute propostion.

 

MERCI

 

-- ESPAGNOL -- ESPAGNOL -- ESPAGNOL --

 

Por qué deberías ayudarnos

Antes de que vayan más lejos, aquí están las razones principales para que nos ayuden :

- Impacto social local: Lanquin es un área agrícola muy pobre, dónde la mayoría de la gente lucha para ganarse la vida. Mediante la donación, usted va a ayudar directamente a financiar la creación de un proyecto de agricultura sostenible, incluyendo agricultura de “permacultura” y una iniciativa de cooperativa de cacao. Los ingresos generados por nuestra tienda serán en gran medida (más del 50%) reinvertidos en estos proyectos. El objetivo es aumentar la calidad de vida de los agricultores locales, e introducir su cacao en el mercado internacional de cacao fino, además del desarrollo sostenible de la comunidad local, de la cual la mayoría sobrevive con no más de $1 al día.

- Por el chocolate: si nunca ha planeado visitar Lanquin, entonces debe sentir nada de esto le importa… lo que es bastante justo. Pero podrá sentir, a lo mejor, que tanto los turistas que visitan el área, como la gente que vive permanentemente aquí, debería tener un gran acceso al chocolate. Nosotros queremos hacer esto una realidad. Todo el mundo estaría muy agradecido por su apoyo, y eso ¡ojalá le haga sentir muy bien!

- Para la educación: Nuestro tour de chocolate pretende educar a la gente sobre chocolate y cacao en general, pero más importante, nosotros enseñamos como hacer increíble chocolate del “grano a la barra” en casa. El objetivo es que la gente se dé cuenta que el chocolate es verdaderamente fácil de hacer. Entonces, no debería de haber ninguna razón para nadie de salir e ir a comprar el chocolate extremadamente procesado que se vende en los supermercados. ¡La revolución del chocolate le necesita!

Puede visitar nuestra web para saber más sobre esto: : http://lanquinchocolate.com

 

Introducción

Hola a todos

Mi nombre es Esteban, también conocido en los alrededores como “el mago del chocolate”

En los últimos 4 años he estado viviendo alrededor del área de Semuc Champey, Guatemala, trabajando extensamente con cacao. He ganado experiencia llevando un tour de chocolate para Utopía Eco-Hostal por 3 años, y en el último año he estado trabajando en una granja local de cacao.

Ahora estoy trabajando para crear una pequeña casa del chocolate en el pueblo de Lanquin, donde cientos de turistas pasan cada día para visitar el parque cercano.

Estoy buscando proporcionar productos de chocolate de excelente calidad para los turistas, pero también para la población Maya.

En los últimos 3 meses, he estado creando y probando diferentes productos (bloques de chocolate, bolas de chocolate, barras de granola, etc.) para evaluar el potencial del mercado. Con solo un voluntario dando vueltas por unas pocas horas al día, es fácil ver que ¡el potencial es enorme!

Después de todo…. ¡La gente tiende a amar el chocolate!

(nuestros chocolates en una tienda del pueblo)

Ya tengo casi todo lo que necesito –incluyendo el material para una pequeña partida de chocolate, productos en stock, conocimientos sobre el pueblo y el potencial de su mercado, y contacto con los productores de cacao y la industria del turismo.

En lo que necesito ayuda, es más que nada en la inversión inicial; lo que cubriría una nevera, estufa de gas, mobiliario, etc. Con su ayuda le podemos ofrecer al pueblo de Lanquin su nueva tienda preferida:

LA CASA DE CHOCOLATE DE LANQUIN

 

Los productos :

He estado haciendo chocolate durante años, y he oído muchas veces que era el mejor chocolate que la gente ha probado en su vida. Por lo tanto, me siento muy confiado en su  éxito.

Nuestros productos principales serán las bolas de chocolate, las cuales ya hemos vendido tanto para los locales como para los turistas. Solo hacemos sabores directamente de  chocolate por ahora, pero con la tienda se podría diversificar. Imagine chocolate infundido con cardamomo, vainilla, chiles, granola, manteca de maní, miel… las posibilidades son infinitas.

 

También venderemos bloques de chocolate, chocolate caliente, crepas (soy francés después de todo…), helado, y otras delicias sanas y hechas a mano.

 

¡Ciertamente la tienda del hombre de los dulces!

 

La localización:

Debido a que el éxito de una tienda depende en gran medida de una fantástica ubicación, estamos felices de poder anunciarles que lo hemos manejado para asegurar un punto increíble.

Está en el centro del pueblo, en el lado de la calle dónde se va para el Parque Nacional, así pues, CADA turista va a pasar por delante en su camino hacia Semuc Champey.

Los turistas que visiten el pueblo a pie van seguramente a detenerse en la tienda (¿usted no visitaría una casa del chocolate?) y los turistas que manejan por delante de la tienda en su camino para el parque se llevarán una gran impresión de chocolate en sus mentes.

La tienda en si está dividida en dos secciones, consistiendo de una cocina y área de elaboración en la parte trasera, y una sección en el frente para mostrar y vender nuestros productos. En la parte delantera también una extensa ventana, por la cual podemos vender directamente a la calle.

Verdaderamente el lugar perfecto (y conozco a los dueños personalmente)

Los costes :

Estamos localizados en un área realmente rural en Guatemala dónde la vida es aún bastante barata. La renta será de 1500 quetzales al mes (incluyendo agua y electricidad).
