campaign_city: Kasirwa Village, Tanzania, United Republic of

story:
Hello everybody!

 

Frist at all let me thank Thomas Radcliffe, my English friend who polished up this project for me.


I'm Mihály Suba from Hungary, working and living in the UK right now and planning to move to Transylvania where my mum is from.
I've worked in various industries from logistics, through cleaning, maintenance, worked as a caretaker and worked in hospitality and catering. I have gathered a lot of experience, and built great relationships.
I also have several hobbies which have guided me to this plan. Because my mother is from Transylvania, every summer, as a child,  I got the opportunity to see the landscape, feel the smells and tastes, and enjoy this beautiful place I have also had the opportunity to meet awesome people  who live there in really poor conditions, but despite that they have all been open-hearted and hospitable. This is what I want to show you, on a more personal level than a normal sightseeing holiday.
Ever since I can remember I was interested in farming, traditions, festivals, trips, and adventure. There is nothing I can think of that would allow me to enjoy those things more than this! ;)
 

But before all the rest, allow me to introduce my team to you:

My permanent team will be the two people I'll employ from the beginning, but all these people mentioned helped me on my trips, and gave me good advice and support in whatever way they could for which I'm really grateful.

Zalán Bakó

Who will be our driver, caretaker, and farm commissioner. Born and raised here in the Seclerland, he is from one of the oldest families in the village, which to this day is still farming. Zalán personally has a passion for farming and is also member of the local folk dance club.
 
 

Ildikó Ila

Who will be our host and head chef! She is from a nearby village, currently working as a radio editor and presenter and is a wife and a mum of three kids. Her cooking is only comparable to my mum's!
 
 
 

Jóska Baksa

Who has his own company not so far from our village; he will lead the hiking trips.
www.baksatanya.hu
https://hu-hu.facebook.com/baksatanyapanzio/
 
 

Gábor Vida

Who is a writer and editor, as well as a cyclist who will lead the bike trips.

 
 
And myself, Mihály Suba who will organise the holidays, help out wherever needed, and run the official side of the business.
 

Now let me show you where is Transylvania and how great it is:
It is in the middle of Romania 

Transylvania is the best region of 2016!

 

Where you have plenty to see.

 

 

In Transylvania you can find:

Niraj Valley in the Land of Seclers (Ținutul Secuiesc/Székelyföld):

Our microregion is the Nyiraj Valley

Land of the Saxons (Pământul Crăiesc/Szászföld):

Máramaros (Maramureș):


My plan is to offer you an unforgettable holiday, employ local people, and keep the amazing traditions alive.

Similar idea to what these two gentlemen talk about here:


but my way of doing it is more focused on the community level, as I plan to work with the local people, especially local youngsters.

 

To make this dream come true I came to the UK. To make international relations. To make my English better. To make money. And of course see this really special country of the world.

During my holidays from work I carried out the preparation work for this business, such as, field observation, finding team leaders, finding locals to host and discover and plan all interesting sites.


It is a great project, I started it, and now I need your help to make it all ready for YOU to try!

 

All of this is possible because of YOUR help! Thank you very much!


 

What do I need and what is it for?

So the business side is coming!

I'm writing down all the expenditure I'll have.

With a final goal of £60 000!
 

1st - I have bought a traditional house in the village which is in need renovating, I'll carry out the renovation paying particular attention to keeping the original and existing style!!!
The barn will be turned into a 4 bedroom apartment as well, offering the best view of the village.
This two renovations will cost me £15 000. This is the first step and will enable us to accommodate our guests and create 2 new jobs in the village. The reason why this is so cheap is because my family usually work together on these kind of projects, so there will be not much labour costs or company profits involved.
Pictures, of the preparation works for the renovation, and the safety of the place.

2nd - Bikes and minibus for tours
- for the bike trips: 20 bikes and helmets, a first aid box, and water and baggage carrying cart. All shall be high quality bikes, recommended by my friend who will lead the bike trips. These bikes will support a church owned bike charity, who import used bikes from the western countries. Helmets will be normal bike helmets and a basic first aid box. There will also ba a horse drawn cart for carrying baggage and water for bigger teams. All together this will cost £4000.

- for the hiking and minibus trips: 1 Ford Transit minibus what is a wildly used and reliable van, a nine seater will give me the capacity to either carry a smaller team, or attend a hiking or biking trip. With additional first aid boxes. A used but good condition one is usually around £6000.

That is an other £10 000.

 

3rd - Land

Land in Romania is £1000 on average, however this is on the cheaper side, as there are mountains rather than fertile plane lands. However because of the poor recording of ownership additional costs may apply. So the 20ha (200 000m2) the farm and the horses will need is no more than £10-15 000

 

4th - Horses

Even though there are a lots of horses in Transylvania it is not that easy to find calm, reliable, and good nature horses which are easy to ride. My preference would be to buy 'Hucul' horses. The 'Hucul' is a small breed, which has origins in our area in the Carpathian Mountains, very reliable, and can be extensively kept. From Lucina breeding centre the likely cost would £800-1000 per horse. However most horse prices are between £500-1000. Ten horses is a perfect number to start with, enough for a circle of friends for a trip, and not too many to cause problems with feeding and looking after. That means £10 000

5th - Farm Animals, and farm buildings

Our farm will be an organic, and traditional farm. Therefore it is important to have animals, and plants which are traditional, and are protected species.

This is an organisation where most of the Transylvanian species are bred.

All our animals and barns will cost £15 000

This price includes cows and or buffalos (most expensive), pigs, sheep, rabbits and chickens (least expensive) as well. All of these animals have requirements about their living conditions, so the buildings are a must have in this case.




 

Where will your money go if I don't reach the goal?

Not a single penny will be wasted!

It is all going to go into this project, I bought the house, and love it way too much to give up! So my hope is in you! And I can't wait to see you around! The amount of the expense however may vary, so I can serve whatever customer requirements we'll have.

Where your money will go if I get more than I need to start?

If it will be more than the £60 000 which is the absolute success it is going to a charity organisation.

http://szentferencalapitvany.org/

In Transylvania there is a monk 'Brother Csaba' who has established a huge childcare organisation for children from poor/complicated/orphan etc. background. I really admire what he is doing and want to help the children myself.

 

The plan itself!

As I have shown you the economic side, This thing is going to be something very complex.
It is really important that I will employ only local people, and as many as possible, which will help them a lot!

Our plan is to do farming and tourism, and combine the two so you can have a taste of the realm of the country.


With all our services you will have home-made food, home made Pálinka (the local spirit), fresh air, and wells. Accommodation will either be at the house, in tents, or in different villages in the case of longer tours.

 

The company will have 4+1 main services:

- 1st Bike and minibus tours, hiking, horse riding
2-28 days long trips with all the interesting places on our routes, but mainly in the nature instead of busy roads. Many programs, sightseeing, living history and culture and of course all that while riding a horse/bike, walking or travelling by a minibus.

- 2nd Farming (holiday and educational courses)

This service will be the most diverse and the one the local people will most widely involved. You can watch, touch, taste all of it!
From making hay, to harvesting, from cutting trees to wood carving, from milking to making cheese, to cut comma to wicker a basket, and many more.
At a local friendly host family you would have nothing to do; but you can do everything. Try it out for yourself!

In the courses, you will be able to learn the traditional/ecological way of farming, building, and general living.

- 3rd Handicraft courses
- Felting course; how to make felt from the shearing of the sheep through to the cleaning and colouring of the felting
- Basket weaving; how to make a basket or any object from comma, from cutting through cleaning, weaving and colouring
- Making cheese; how to make cheese from milking through preparation, tasting, making and maturing.
- Local straw hat weaving; how to make a hat from harvest through selecting, to sew.
- Blacksmith lessons. With the local gypsy blacksmith.
- Pottery; how to make your own pot from digging and grinding through to making the pot.
All you make can be yours!
Home made food, home made Pálinka (local spirit), fresh air, and wells. Accommodation in the house or tents.

 

- 4th Summer camps
- 9-11th century child camps with my Uncle, and his team, who has got over 15 years of experience.
- surviving camps with ex military camp leader
- dance camp, there is a folk dance and music camp in the village every year and we'll provide a translator for you
- team building weekends
- and many more

 

- The extra one..... A run away home from £23 000 to £50 000

As I'm very committed to saving traditions my base will be an old village house restored in the traditional way. I will be doing that as i have some experience and, in my family, there are a few guys from the building industry. So in the future you might be able to own a restored house in this or a similar village for as little as £23 000.
I'm happy to do a maintenance for use deal with you if you want so you have a free service, and I can have more accommodations.
You can choose this service also as a perk! Don't miss out!

 

Risks & Challenges

As your help makes me independent from banks, pushy investors, or anything like that it gives me a good starting point! It is the most important bit! Thank you!

The language problem: is also a good reason to employ more people, especially local young people, who mainly study at universities. Also I've got connections all over Transylvania through my mother and her family, and my own trips, as I spent most of my holidays hitch-hiking all over the place. And of course I speak a few words and picking up more and more each time.
 
Competitors: Not many of them. Closest to us, which is similar is in the high mountains in the Hargita County.
 
What if there are not enough guests in the first years. This is where the farming has an important role. As the plan to employ people I can't rely on tourism only or agriculture only. The two together will definitely make a whole so even if the first years are harder, there will be no minuses in the balance.
 
Wolves, bears or even vampires!: well, I hiked Transylvania, for all-together more than 2 years, most of the time off road, and never had a problem. Anyway there will be a leader with every team, and GPS, phone, and attendant following you, at all times. So we will pay very high attention to your safety!

 

 

It would be a really big help if you pass through the info about this plan! Tell it to all around you, family, friends, whoever you see on the roads and all the people on the bus! ;)



It is really important that this site, and later the company get good marketing, so now, soon or even later than that  please spread it!



Please hit Like and Share for us!
https://www.facebook.com/tarnsylvaniakerekerdotours

 

Website is coming soon, as well!



As I really appreciate your effort sharing this news I set up an extra PERK so if you have supported us, by even just £1.00 and your friends who do as well comment your user name on this project you will be invited for the opening celebrations, and have the same goods as if you'd have supported us by £250.

Thank you very much!

 

Hope to see you hiking soon! ;)

 

Mihály Suba and the team!
story_txt:
Hello everybody! Frist at all let me thank Thomas Radcliffe, my English friend who polished up this project for me.
I'm Mihály Suba from Hungary, working and living in the UK right now and planning to move to Transylvania where my mum is from.I've worked in various industries from logistics, through cleaning, maintenance, worked as a caretaker and worked in hospitality and catering. I have gathered a lot of experience, and built great relationships.I also have several hobbies which have guided me to this plan. Because my mother is from Transylvania, every summer, as a child,  I got the opportunity to see the landscape, feel the smells and tastes, and enjoy this beautiful place I have also had the opportunity to meet awesome people  who live there in really poor conditions, but despite that they have all been open-hearted and hospitable. This is what I want to show you, on a more personal level than a normal sightseeing holiday.Ever since I can remember I was interested in farming, traditions, festivals, trips, and adventure. story:
Maybe a Cupcake Will Help? 

You've just read the new slogan for the Warrensburg area, folks! 

SmallCakes, A Cupcakery, started in Kansas City and is still ran by a dynamic duo spreading sweet treats across the country. Recently, named Top 10 Places to Try from Business Insider and USA Today as well as other publications. 
         Local restaurant group, Zoomie, has the passion and vision to bring quality places for the Warrensburg community to have access to. After having one of the largest & successful Grand Openings in Orange Leaf history, the group opened Pita Pit with another bang up success of a Grand Opening. 

Because of these successes and community support, the group is thrilled to bring another sweet success! 

What's in it for YOU?:

We want to bring Warrensburg amazing new places to keep the community alive and fresh with the best our group can offer. This funding is to show us just how quickly you want us to open shop! The faster we reach our goal, the faster we'll open our doors. Show us you all WANT us to bring cupcakes and more exciting places to the area! The best part about SmallCakes? We are here to serve YOUR needs. Your party theme is our baker's challenge. The sky's the limit on what we can help you create. 

     

         

How This Works:

We want to give you the first opportunity to be our guest. This account is here for you to feel stress-free in planning your parties and holiday events. Let SmallCakes give your guests, family, or friends something smooth and decadent to talk about days after your event ends. Birthdays, Thanksgiving, Christmas, work parties, etc! Bring the best and newest dessert to the party with our premium, moist cupcakes. More than that, show us you're ready for us to open in the Burg by participating in this special pre-sale! Watch for fun perks and offers throughout the pre-sale on our Facebook & Twitter.

What to Expect: 

Pre-orders will be accepted through the week prior to Grand Opening. Orders can be picked up starting Opening Day and will be confirmed via email. We will be offering the signature flavors SmallCakes always has as well as fun, seasonal flavors. 

Flavors to Choose From: 

Mule Kicker: (LIMITED OFFERING) red velvet cake with buttercream frosting and crushed oreos on top
Pink Vanilla: vanilla cake with our signature pink buttercream frosting

Pink Chocolate: chocolate cake with our signature pink buttercream frosting
Choco-holic: chocolate cake with chocolate buttercream topped with valrhona (a fine brand of chocolate) chocolate sprinkes
Vanilla-n-Chocolate: vanilla cake with chocolate buttercream topped with valrhona chocolate
Cookies-n-Cream: chocolate cake with our signature oreo vanilla buttercream topped with oreo cokies
Lemon Drop: lemon cake filled with tangy lemon buttercream and a dollop of tangy lemon
"Famous" Red Velvet: grandma's red velvet cake with our signature cream cheese frosting
Caramel Crunch: chocolate cake with caramel frosting topped with sea salt and pretzels
Hot Fudge Sundae: chocolate cake with our signature buttercream frosting, roasted pecans, hot fudge, and a cherry on top
Peanut Butter Cup: chocolate cake with peanut butter cream cheese frosting topped with crumbled peanut butter cups
Chocolate Cream: chocolate cake filled with our signature fudge frosting with a dollop of buttercream
Birthday Cupcake: vanilla cake with buttercream frosting topped with sprinkles

PLUS fun seasonal offerings! Comment on our Facebook page to let us know what you want to see!

story:
NAUTICAL TOURS BUSINESS PROFILE


Mission Statement

Today's consumers want the most value for their money and Nautical Tours will offer the greatest value possible by combining land tours with water ride. We shall strive to make each tour an unique and memorable land and water sightseeing tour experience, giving Nautical Tours a strong competitive edge in today's tourism market. Nautical Tours will operate the best and safest vehicles in the tourism industry providing the customer with unlimited creativity and  professionalism. An amphibious tour that can take the client through all the city's sights on the roadway, while adding picturesque views from the water makes this a must ride. A fun filled adventure for the whole family!

                                           - Nautical Tours, A Voyage to Remember

                                             http://www.nauticaltoursofboston.com

Commercial Information

Nautical Tours is an amphibious sightseeing tour business providing:
  • Unique luxury motor coach Land and water sightseeing tours
  • Features the Amphicoach GS1 Euro 6 amphibious touring bus
  • Foremost U.S. Coast Guard safety approved vehicle of its kind
  • A quality state-of-the-art product, that is safe and reliable

  • (www.amphicoach.net)                                                                                        

Nautical Tours will deliver the following:
  • Prime objective is to create a solid domestic/foreign customer base
  • Worldwide Network to sustain long-term company profitability
  • Each tour vessel is equipped with an animated GPS intercom system
  • Two forms of tour narration each offering comfort/audio performance
  • Basic format is comprised of the Bose Surround Sound System
  • Non English speaking patrons may choose a translated version
  • We offer the Bose Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones
  • Overhead HD/DVD screens
  • DVD screens will display our tour narration through sign language
  • In concert with numerous summary clips of various historical events

  • Center for purchase of tour tickets by travel agents worldwide


Objectives & Strategies

Nautical Tours has set its marketing objectives on increasing its market share by 15% in the next three years. This will be achieved in three phases. The first phase concentrates sales efforts at the Convention/Cruise Ship Industries. The second phase will target our sales efforts toward Specialty Events  - July 4th celebration, the "Grand Prix" & "Tall Ships" events.  Phase three will deploy our sales strategy based upon demographic assessment of International Tourism statistics. In the next five years U.S. airline carriers and their counterparts are expected to double their number of flights between the U.S. and other countries worldwide.

The conceived strategy for the above outlined business objectives will be to apply an aggressive public relations and marketing campaign through direct sales.


AMPHICOACH DESIGN AND TECHNOLOGY

The Amphicoach GS1 Euro 6 is the first certified amphibious vehicle in the world to boast the Euro 6 emissions package with automatic and semi automatic gearbox. The Amphicoach tour bus is able to operate both day and night whether in fresh or salt water. All passenger models of Amphicoach are capable of competing with most known manufacturers of passenger motor coaches and city tour vehicles, with regards to the vehicle performance on the road, and passenger expectations. 

The major impact of this unique product is that due to extensive research and development and with a completely new design in 2014, the Amphicoach excels in the water with superior stability and maneuverability while under sail. The opinions of marine experts involved in the production of previous models, are that the latest models are even more refined.

The hulls are built using 6mm and 12mm marine grade aluminum, (Hydro 5083). This is the best suited material for this application, due to its lightweight an superior strength. The uniquely designed watertight compartmented hull design, includes collision bulkheads that help make this coach relatively unsinkable. In the unlikely event that the hull is breached and/or swamped this vehicle will remain completely upright and afloat. Each compartment has its own individual bilge pump system, or can be foam filled at the customers request making it the best and safest solution to Amphibious passenger transport in the world.

The vehicle is powered by one marine engine that initiates the wheels and a single or twin marine jet. This allows the vehicle to travel at highway speeds with ease and up to nine knots, (approx. 20mph) in the water depending upon engine horsepower. The Amphicoach can maneuver in the tightest of spaces in the water and can rotate 360 degrees in its own length.



WE ARE VERY PROUD TO SAY, NO OTHER TOUR CAN COME CLOSE TO DELIVERING THIS AMAZING LAND AND WATER SIGHTSEEING TOUR EXPERIENCE!


We invite you to join our family of Nautical Tours backers! Together we can make Nautical Tours an Indiegogo crowd funding success. Help us bring this new 21st century state-of-the-art technology to the U.S.A., create jobs that ultimately boost the U.S. economy! WE ALSO OFFER THE GREATEST PERKS EVER!!


DON'T MISS THE BOAT!  COME RIDE WITH US!

                             NAUTICAL TOURS, A VOYAGE TO REMEMBER!!!


              

               BAHAMAS VIP CLUB

Join our campaign and automatically qualify to become a member of our Nautical Tours Bahamas VIP Club. As a qualified member of our VIP Club  you will receive various notifications of the many free marketing promotions that Nautical Tours shall offer throughout each tour season!

              

                           HURRY!  DON'T MISS THE BOAT!               

              

              HAWAIIAN VIP CLUB  

Join our campaign and automatically qualify to   become a member of our Nautical Tours Hawaiian VIP Club. As a qualified member you will receive various notifications of the many free marketing promotions that Nautical Tours shall offer throughout each tour season!

                                  COME RIDE WITH US! 

WE INVITE YOU TO JOIN OUR FAMILY OF NAUTICAL TOURS BACKERS!


Please help us spread the word, visit our Nautical Tours Fans and Friends campaign on our Facebook Business page and don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share Tools!


                          FAQ

The issuance and delivery of Perks/Rewards are absolutely 100% guaranteed, but are subject to the best efforts of the Nautical Tours Corporation. We are very very confident that we will deliver to you all Perks/Rewards on or about the dates as indicated.

Each Perk/Reward shall be issued in the order of their respective contribution date.

When submitting your donation please indicate your preference as to which FAA approved airline you wish your gift card to be issued by.



THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR ALL YOUR AMAZING

SUPPORT AND CONTRIBUTIONS!!!!!


                       WELCOME ABOARD!

Mission Statement


Today's consumers want the most value for their money and Nautical Tours will offer the greatest value possible by combining land tours with water ride. We shall strive to make each tour an unique and memorable land and water sightseeing tour experience, giving Nautical Tours a strong competitive edge in today's tourism market. Nautical Tours will operate the best and safest vehicles in the tourism industry providing the customer with unlimited creativity and  professionalism. An amphibious tour that can take the client through all the city's sights on the roadway, while adding picturesque views from the water makes this a must ride. A fun filled adventure for the whole family!


                                           - Nautical Tours, A Voyage to Remember
                                             http://www.nauticaltoursofboston.com

Features the Amphicoach GS1 Euro 6 amphibious touring bus

A quality state-of-the-art product, that is safe and reliable 

(www.amphicoach.net)

story:
Agri Connexions Africa is a non-profit organization that provides solutions that improve the opportunities for resource-poor farmers in Namibia and allow them to strengthen their livelihoods.

We are currently fundraising for our program called "Namibian Market Gardens for Growth and Sustainability." This program works with the farming community in Mwanzi Area in Zambezi Region to develop new ways to earn income and produce food in a region where conventional rain-fed corn production is no longer a reliable option to provide enough food and income for rural families.

Background

Agri Connexions Africa founder, Courtney Dehn-Gurbacki, started this project in 2013. After completing her Honors Degree in International Development Studies and African Studies at McGill University and working and studying in East Africa, Courtney knew that she wanted to find constructive ways to contribute to improving the lives of others.

With this goal in mind, Courtney planned and funded a trip to South Africa, Malawi and Namibia to learn more about sustainable agriculture and community development. She became involved with the producers in Zambezi Region (the geographic focus of this project) after a friend invited her to visit his PhD fieldwork site where he had been assisting the community with proposals to improve sustainable vegetable production in the region. Courtney quickly became involved and decided to focus all her efforts on making this proposal a reality.

Agri Connexions Africa is about connecting people, ideas and knowledge with the tools and resources to develop solutions to pressing problems.

What are the problems are we trying to address? 

• Namibia is one of the most arid countries in the world, with only the northern and north-central regions receiving enough rainfall to support agriculture.

•  The farming communities in Namibia rely on rain-fed crop production of corn and other grains as their primary food and cash crop.

• Yet, the rainfall is highly variable and poorly distributed, partly due to global climate change, leading to frequent droughts and compromising the ability of the farming community to sustain their livelihoods.

• Farmers face many obstacles to diversify crop production, generate more income and reduce poverty. Producers lack knowledge of alternative crops and production methods and inputs, as well as a developed marketplace for these goods. 

What is our solution?

Alternative and diverse crop production, affordable irrigation technology, and water-conserving/sustainable cultivation practices

Looking for an alternative and more reliable source of food and income, farmers in Mwanzi Area (the geographic focus of our project) have been growing small amounts of vegetables, mostly irrigating with buckets in the dry season. However, the key limitation to more production is irrigation.

An irrigated farm means the opportunity to cultivate a larger area, to increase the number of growing seasons and to sell extra produce to the markets.

We have worked with the a group of small-scale farmers and vegetable producers, who have come together to form the Mashandilo Co-operative (meaning ‘the place you go to get help’). The community has devised this project to give farmers in the area an opportunity to cultivate different kinds of crops year-round with irrigation, training and market development.

We have started small with a pilot project called Tuyeleke (‘Let’s Try’) in the local Sifwe language. 

What have we done so far?

Phase 1: Tuyeleke (‘Let’s Try’)

• Feasibility study to ensure the project is viable and sustainable

• Developing new gardens and improving exisiting gardens with Mashandilo Co-operative members to provide food for family use for over 70 people in Kongola Constituency

•  Developing demonstration gardens- producers are trialling techniques that are not used widely in the region (compost-production, crop rotation and natural pest-management)

• Cultivating support from local partners- Ministry of Agriculture, Governor of Zambezi Region, Namibia National Farmer’s Union (our local partner), Mafwe Traditional Authority (local Chief), Namibia Organic Association and Kwandu Conservancy and Community Forest.

What do we plan to do next? (what we are fundraising for now)

•  Improve affordable irrigation by piloting manually operated treadle pumps and micro drip irrigation systems 

•  Production skills training- the co-operative members have identified key areas where they would like to strengthen their skills, namely soil fertility management and pest and disease management

• Develop market links- extra produce not consumed will be sold by the co-operative and we will provide business management trainings as they develop a marketplace for their produce

•  We plan to implement this phase from January 2016- December 2016

What impact are we making?

Independence: opportunity to grow and sell crops year round, increased income so farmers can afford food, education and healthcare for their families

Economic development: farm families sell vegetable crops in the market place, farmers become self-sustaining (able to buy seeds and other inputs), job creation

Food security: increased capacity to withstand droughts and sustain families with food and income, less reliance on food aid

Where does the money go?

• Treadle pumps and micro drip irrigation equipment to pilot

• Training (from Namibia Organic Association, Kasisi Agricultural Training Center) and exchange visits to learn from established vegetable producers

•  Seeds (until producers can save/buy their own)

•  Fencing (to keep animals out of the gardens)

•  Garden equipment- wheel barrows, shade net, sprayers


Well-established Fiscal Partnership

Agri Connexions Africa is waiting to become a tax-exempt non-profit organization. Until then, our partners at Global Resource Alliance, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, are acting as our fiscal sponsor. This means any donation you make to Agri Connexions Africa will be tax-deductible under our sponsor's tax-exempt status.

Our Team

Our project is managed and guided by an entirely volunteer team in Namibia and New York. 

Courtney Dehn-Gurbacki manages day-to-day operations and leads fundraising. Our US Board of Directors oversees the organization's fiduciary responsibilities and operations.

Trustees In Namibia

Sarah Rosen is a Community Economic Development Peace Corps Volunteer in Zambezi Region (2014-2016). As her community outreach component, Sarah is assisting to facilitate the ‘Tuyeleke’ project, alongside her work with the Namibia Training Authority.

Carol Murphy is the Zambezi Field Coordinator for the Community Forest Project. She has over 30 years experience in the non-profit sector.

Bennetty Busihu is Zambezi Region Field Coordinator for Integrated Rural Development and Nature Conservation and also the Manager of Kwandu Conservancy and Community Forest.

Richard Sihani is the Field Coordinator for Namibia Conservation Agriculture Programme.

story:
My name is Owen King and I am the owner of Warrior Woodworks.

              

My campaign is all about capturing your memories through woodworking. I have always had a passion for woodworking. My father taught me many things when I was growing up but one thing that may seem a little strange was his love for trees. You see, we had many maple trees growing on our family farm that were planted by my great-grandparents in 1910. Those trees are slowly dying off and so I decided to preserve them in some way that would be meaningful for my family.

     Photo on right above: root of dead maple tree with large burls at the base.
I decided to expand on that idea and bring my woodworking skills and passion to other like-minded people. Maybe the house where your grandparents lived is being torn down and you want to be able to salvage a piece of the house in a special way. Was there a tree in the yard that you loved to climb? It's easy to save just a small piece of that tree or even the seeds that drop every year. There are so many ways to preserve those memories! How about making a souvenir from a favourite holiday? Those who love the outdoors like hunters and hikers would be interested in knowing all the cool things that can be made from deer or elk antler, not to mention how beautiful these treasures can be! If you don't have anything like I have described then there are many options of historical and exotic wood from around the globe that will make the perfect wedding, birthday or anniversary gift.

                             Bolt action pen in brass with elk antler.

                    Sierra Stylus pen in chrome with Monkey Pod wood.

                                Ice Cream Scoop with elk antler handle.

                     Gillette Fusion Razor with red dyed Box Elder Burl.

In order to take Warrior Woodworks to the next level and fulfill my dream, I will need to upgrade some equipment and purchase some new equipment. I have the skills, the knowledge and the patience to make fascinating works of art on the woodlathe but this business can be expensive. Besides new equipment, there are supplies that I need to stock up on in order to offer a selection of products for customers. I have a solid customer base already, based on previous years sales and I know it will be easy to expand on that base with a wider product line. Contributing to my campaign will help me achieve my dream of creating unique and personal products that will be treasured for years to come. Thank you!

story:
Our Story ....

After over eight years in Silver Lake, The Spice Station had no choice but to close its doors due to increasing rent. It was not only a sad departure for us, but for the community we had become a part of.

We took pride in creating a fun unique and educational environment that allowed the home cook to feel like a top chef and at the same time working with LA's top restaurants and bars.

Challenges ....

As most know, small business owner (especially a woman owned business) have a difficult time receiving bank loans and often must rely on patron's and community for support to open the doors again.

After a year of searching for a new location, a great opportunity has come up for The Spice Station to return to Silver Lake, but I can’t do it alone. I need your help to bring back this unique retail experience and get you in the kitchen cooking again!

As most of you know, the Spice Station has been operating in many of your favorite local farmers markets around town since we closed our retail space.

One of the biggest challenges has been keeping up with consumer demand without a central location.

Where your money will go ....

Last month I was able to find an ideal affordable location with a long lease in Silver Lake . So, to get my business started, I will be selling pre-packaged products at the new location for purchase. With this new startup model, I will be able to open my doors right away and at half the cost .

As my business starts to grows, I will be working with the city to install the necessary equipment to be able to package our product on the spot as I did at our previous location.

With my new lease ready to sign and my spice vendors waiting to ship my product, the only challenge I have is the capital to get my new brick & mortar location started and that is why I am asking for your help.

Please Support Us Today ....

Help get the word out about "Bring back The Spice Station back to Silver Lake" on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and via email using the hashtag #BringBackSpiceStation

With this campaign, we have some really fun and customizable perks for you to continue your culinary adventure. 

Your donations and your sharing of this page is so crucial and will help this established and unique shopping experience reopen its doors.

With my new lease ready to sign and my spice vendors waiting to ship my product, the only challenge I have is the capital to get my new brick & mortar location started and that is why I am asking for your help.

Please Support Us Today ....
Help get the word out about "Bring back The Spice Station back to Silver Lake" on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and via email using the hashtag #BringBackSpiceStation
With this campaign, we have some really fun and customizable perks for you to continue your culinary adventure. 
Your donations and your sharing of this page is so crucial and will help this established and unique shopping experience reopen its doors.

story:
My family and I moved to the small town of Roxboro to give our kids a good start in a home of our own. We wanted our kids to have the special kind of memories that they will look back on with fondness when they have kids of their own. We wanted playing in the backyard, chasing fireflies, growing a garden, going to school with the same faces for years, making friends for a lifetime, local stores with familiar faces for special treats, favorite little hangouts in town with friends.

Unfortunately, not all of that is possible right now.

That is why I want to open a used bookstore. I want to provide a place to be that little local store with special treats, a favorite hangout for friends, young and not so young. Bookstores, and books, have always provided fond memories for me, which is why I earned my Bachelors in English from Arizona State University. The smell of old books mingling with the soothing warmth of coffee and hot chocolate, and the sweet tingle of cookies or cake always invokes those memories for me, drawing a smile, and I want to pass those feelings on to my children, and to other people.

With your help, I can provide a local hangout to a town working hard to bring life back to its self, and to give used books a second chance at the same time, in a building that once held fond memories for the older members for the community, but needs some love to be that place for newer generations. Roxboro used to be an up and coming, happening, place to be in the 50's, 60's, and 70's, with two gorgeous theaters, dozens of store fronts and restaurants. It has since fallen on hard times, and is now working hard to be that happening place again.

We can provide a warm place for a first time parent to pick out a book to read their newborn to sleep, Goodnight Moon. We can help a child to have their very first adventure in the Hundred Acre Wood. We can help an 11 year old receive their letter to Hogwarts along with Harry. We can help a preteen discover Narnia in the back of their wardrobe. We can aid a teenager on his quest to destroy the One Ring. We can have a space for children to safely hangout while their parents browse the shelves, perhaps looking for that guilty pleasure with a purple cover, or becoming that gathering place for meetings between friends, or book clubs. A place where students come to find just the right book for class, and to study. We can be that place where a local author sees their book for sale for the first time.

With your help, I can work magic.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal to reach is $10,000. The majority of the money will go towards leasing or purchasing the building, getting everything inside set up properly, and for paying utilities for the building. I will use a portion of it to purchase whatever inventory and supplies I don't already have. Any remaining money will go into a business bank account for use just for the bookstore.

Keep an eye out for exciting perks! Our featured perk is a large 100% cotton reusable canvas tote bag: fashionable, great for the environment, and great to carry your new books home in! Pre-launch contributors and those who contribute over $100 will get to show off their rock star status and have their name painted on the wall of the store!

If we don't reach our goal, the money will be placed into an business account, where it will be kept, and added to, until our goal can finally be reached, or an ideal location for the store can be found.

The Impact

Our town does not have a multi-subject bookstore in it, or within a 45 minute drive in any direction. The closest things we have are a Christian bookstore, or WalMart. We do have a public library, but as with most libraries, there are limited hours, and a limit to how many books you can check out. We will have longer operating hours, and, of course, no limit to how many books you can buy. With over 8,000 people in town, and over 39,000 people in the county, that's almost 40,000 people with no access to a bookstore within an easy distance.

Having a bookstore in town would give uptown a family friendly place to hangout together, a place for book clubs to hold meetings, and for students to study.

The store would also have a spotlight for local authors, helping them build their audience.

I am supportive of our First Responders (Police, Sheriffs, EMTs, and Fire Dept.), Active Military, and Veterans, and they are always welcome to stop by for a free cup of coffee.

Risks & Challenges

Anytime someone opens up a small business, there is a risk, which is common knowledge. Most small businesses don't make it past the five year mark, but with the love and support of family and friends, and the growing support of the community, I think we can make it.

I am a highly driven individual willing to put in the time and effort it takes to make the store a success. I graduated from college Cum Laude all while taking care of two young children, a husband, and a home. It has taught me time management and risk assessment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone can contribute monetarily, and that is okay! Instead, please get the word out. Share this page with everyone you know, and ask them to share with everyone they know. Use the Indigogo share tools when you can! 

Thank you everyone, so much, for your help and support. It means so much to me.

story:
My name is Bob, and I am the owner of BattleCityGym. Operating in the Long Island, NY area, it has been my dream for the past several years to open our very own gaming retail store so the Long Island players and families could have a place to share their love for gaming.

Our story started 10 years ago when my 7-year-old son wanted to play Pokemon. He found an event from the Pokemon website that was located about 20 miles away. When we arrived, our first impression was that it was a very small store that could hardly serve 20 players. He competed and came in 1st place, and we were surprised to find out it was a City Championship tournament that is only held once a year. Even more passionate about the game now, my son continued to search the Pokemon website for the next two years and couldn't find any events in our area.

After two years of still not having a location for the Pokemon players to gather and play, I decided to contact our local gaming store and The Pokemon Company Int. to arrange for us to start running weekly tournaments. After the first year, The Pokemon Company Int. decided to make me a Premier Tournament Organizer for the Long Island area. Since then, I have worked as a judge for their State, Regional, National, and World Championships, in addition to the events I was already running at our local gaming store.

Over the past several years I have continued to use my experience as a judge, organizer, and sales representative, to bring the best events possible to the gaming community. This now includes other trading-card and collectible card games, board games, tabletop games, and video games, in addition to our Pokemon events (which we typically attract at least sixty players to – the limit before we have can no longer accept participants due to space restrictions).

After 8 years of running events at local gaming stores and conventions, I made it my priority to listen to all the players and families, and their biggest complaint about other gaming stores is that they are either too small, not very clean, or don’t offer much to purchase other than gaming supplies. Imagine bringing your child to an event or store and the only experience you bring back is that it's overcrowded or unclean – no parent or player should ever have this type of experience.

Our events are extremely well organized, staffed, and run in a way that everyone goes home with a great experience. Quite often the players and parents mention that we should open our own store.

One thing to mention is I love the stores that we run our events at; we have made a lot of money for the stores in sales and commissions from our events. But over the years, the stores either started to ask for more money for us to run events in their stores or have had to cut us out in the attempt to run their own events. This hasn't gone over well with the players and most of them stopped going to those stores because of it.

It's now time to take that big leap and open a store that everyone will love. Our store will be spacious enough to handle 60+ players and still have space for the parents to be able to sit and talk with each other while they wait (or play themselves!). Features we’ll incorporate that other stores do not have are a rewards program for all purchases and event entries, family game nights, and special events.

 

Our mission is not to just open another game store but a place that the players and families will call home for all their favorite games. A few years ago we adopted the tagline "Tournament Central" since we run some of the best ran and organized events around, according to the players. We will continue to work with the gaming companies to bring even more events to the players. These event will help the players earn invites and/or points to even bigger events like Pro Tours, Regional, National, and even Worlds for games like Magic The Gathering, Pokemon, Yu-Gi-Oh!, Dragonball Super, Cardfight Vanguard, X-Wing, Star Wars Armada, Warhammer 40K, ARG special events, and plus much much more.

We are very happy about our brand and the players know that when they see our name or logo, they know they will be presented with a friendly qualified staff for any events we run.

 

Here are the basics of what is needed to open a new store:

  • Lease of a store that is around 1000sqft
  • Store fixtures and displays
  • Point of Sale system
  • Loyalty point system
  • Kiosk system for store singles. 
  • Tables and chairs for the players
  • Inventory

In return for your generosity, I've created some exciting perks for your contributions.


You help will do many things by funding this campaign, including:

  • Create a store that supports the gaming community
  • Support small businesses that can have a trickle up effect on the industry at large
  • Help to minimize debt undertaken in order to swiftly reinvest in the business
  • By supporting us you also support the local gaming community for the tristate area

People who have worked alongside me over the years knew this was coming. I cut my teeth with some of the biggest and best events in the world.

Now is my chance to apply all of my years of experience, my independent spirit, resourcefulness, and grit, to my own business and realize my own dream.


  • Open every day
    • Monday - Friday (1:00pm - 11:00pm)
    • Saturday (10:00am - 5:00pm)
    • Sunday (12:00pm - 5:00pm)
  • Multiple events daily
  • Special Premier events
  • Daily discounts
  • Loyalty point system
  • Space or table rental for private groups
  • Family game nights
  • Daily social media posts on Twitter, Facebook, Meetup, etc.

Loyalty Point System

We have chosen to go with the FiveStars loyalty point system. They have one of the best systems around. Our customers will never have to worry about carrying loyalty cards or even a key fob, all you need is your phone number. Customers and players will gain loyalty points for all purchases and event entries. The points earned can be redeemed for a variety of things.

As with any new business venture, there are always risks and challenges. The biggest risk is the business fails in the first year. The failure would be dependent on poor overall sales, which ultimately stems from both poor traffic and inventory. I’ve assessed these risks and have created strategies to overcome them.

Traffic. Successful retail is dependent on traffic (whether you are online or brick and mortar). In order to draw traffic, we plan on doing the following:

  • Be in a stellar location alongside other stores that we can draft off of
  • Provide special in-store events, collaborations, and cross-promotions within and outside of the gaming market
  • Added services such as rewards program that awards points for all purchases and event entries
  • Advanced preorders that will help us make sure we get the products in the hands of the players as soon as they are released
  • Online sales with pick-up from store option

Inventory. One of the biggest challenges will be keeping up with inventory and being nimble based on market demands. I plan on handling this by:

  • Paying close attention to what our customers are interested in.
  • Use a Point of Sale system to manage inventory and ensure we have enough of the right products during key times
  • Stay on top of new products being released and finding the best deals from our distributors 

 

No game store is complete without a good supply of merchandise that players love. We have designed a very Special perks for this Sponsorship level. Our Corporate Sponsorship program will provide your company with the maximum exposure possible, so we will provide the following service for your support.

  • 3' x 8' vertical vinyl banner displayed between every table with you company logo and graphics
  • Section dedicated for your products along with a light-up of your company logo
  • A good supply of inventory for your product(s)*
  • Company Logo w/link added to our website, newsletters, and flyers.
  • Company Logo on our table numbers
  • Logo on all live streams along with an automatic message in chat
  • $1k tournament held once per year for each Corporate Sponsor
  • Company logo added to the back of our t-shirts 
  • Social-media
    • Thank you Shout-out on all social media outlets and blogs
    • New product announcements
    • Promotions and Special Events

I have put together a special team that will strictly focus on marketing and exposure for your company.

 

We realize not everyone can give, but we hope you'll help us out by just getting the word out about us and the campaign. Share with your friends and family, and post it on social media!

Check out the Indiegogo share tools below and scream about it to your tribe. You never know what kind of impact it might have!

Thank you for your support!

 

Photos shown here are actual photos from our events taken at various locations.

story:
Why bra sized swimsuits?

As a co-owner of A Sophisticated Pair, a lingerie boutique in Burlington, NC, my ongoing goal is to provide customers with a range of products, styles, and sizes as well as offer expert fit advice in a "Judgement Free" space. For over seven years, I have been fitting people in the correct bra size, helping them choose the right style for their breast shape, lifestyle, and budgetary needs, and two years ago, we branched out to swimwear through another Indiegogo campaign. Our business was inspired by my personal bra shopping experiences and how much I struggled with selection, sizing, and fit, and swimwear is no different. Before opening the store, my swimsuit shopping escapades ended in tears more than success because nothing ever fit! I vividly remember spending an entire day driving all over the state trying to find something—no, anything—which didn't make me feel horrible about myself. Color, style, and print became irrelevant, and my confidence suffered. In the picture below, I am chilling at the lake in literally the best fitting top I could find. No support, no shape, and the halter straps pulled uncomfortably into my neck. But hey, I didn't fall out, so that's something, right? 

After we opened, I discovered many of the same manufacturers who created our awesome bras also had swimsuits in actual bra sizes. And no, these aren't generic "Fits to a D cup" type tops. These are suits in sizes like 30D, 34H, 40E, 44J, and so on. They lift! They shape! And they are freakin' cute! Last year, I bought this little gem from Elomi in my bra size UK 34H, and I couldn't get over the difference. I had been buying the wrong swimsuits my whole life!

As soon as our customers heard about the glorious world of bra sized swim, the requests came pouring in for us to include them. After all, NC is a beautiful state with lots of lakes, beaches, and rivers, to say nothing of private pools, and it's easier to enjoy warm weather if you aren't adjusting your boobs every few minutes. However, swim is super expensive, especially for a smaller shop like ours, particularly if we want to be more representative with size, style, and colors. 

Wait, didn't you just say you did this crowd-source thing before?

Yes! Back in 2017, we raised almost $5,000 to bring in a modest assortment of swim into the shop, and then we cautiously expanded to a few new styles last year as well. However, swimwear remains the single most expensive product we stock, and we received some criticisms about our selection. To truly do swimwear justice, we need the help of our customers. My open cash flow allows me to carry a few styles in select sizes, but if people contribute to the campaign, essentially prepaying for their new swimsuits plus gaining extra perks, we can do so much more for our customers. There are a wealth of styles, colors, sizes, and brands available, and with the last campaign, we were able to dip our toes in the water. This year, I want to dive in headfirst and explore. I want people to have the option of trying on multiple suits in different fits and sizes—to find that perfect confidence boosting piece that makes you feel beautiful and sexy and courageous. Without this campaign, we'll rely primarily on what we currently stock, four pre-booked style, and special orders, meaning you may not be able to leave the shop with a swimsuit on the day you visit. Crowdsourcing allows us to pull resources together to improve the shop for everyone.

How much do you need?

Because we only sell high quality products, the wholesale cost on a bikini top is comparable to the cost of our bras, but a one-piece or a tankini? The added material creates a wholesale cost almost double that of a normal bra. Now factor in over 125 different sizes to represent, and the investment total adds up quickly. The shop has allocated around $3,000 of our spring buying budget to supplement our existing stock and any fundraising results, but we are aiming for an additional $10,000 with the campaign. Aside from factoring in wholesale costs, we also have the following expenses:

  • $350-400 in estimated shipping costs from manufacturers
  • $300-350 in estimated storage and fixtures to accommodate the extra inventory
  • General cost of the perks, including the added store credit and the profit lost through discount coupons for larger contributions

  • Indiegogo fees totaling 8% of funds raised plus 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees)

  • Indiegogo now withholds 5% of the funds raised for six months to allow for refunds, meaning as much $500 of the goal will not be given to us until after swim season.

While $10,000 is our ultimate goal, I have tiered plans depending on how much we ultimately raise, each revolving around unique swimwear color groups from our brands. Coordinating collections usually consist of two to three top styles plus a few matching bottom options, and we will balance variety both in terms of shape and size but also in color and print.

  • $2,500: At least two collections
  • $5,000: At least four collections
  • $7,500: At least six collections
  • $10,000: At least eight collections

You'll notice I use "at least" in my campaign promises. No, I'm not going all politician on you. Like any retail business, sales fuel growth, and it is my intention for the campaign to essentially jump start our swim expansion. As we continue to sell items in-store, we can funnel the profits into more styles than originally planned, particularly because certain prints and colors do not release until well after the campaign ends. 

How much are swimsuits and what styles are available?

As with bras and lingerie, swim prices vary depending on size, style, and manufacturer. Generally, the more bells and whistles to the design, the higher the retail price. Our store price range will be as follows:

  • Bikini Tops: $50 to $80
  • Tankini Tops: $70 to $130
  • One-Piece Suits: $80 to $150
  • Matching Bottoms: $25 to $60

We'll focus primarily on bikini and tankini pieces and accompanying bottoms with one-pieces being fund-raising dependent. Sizes range from 28 to 44 bands with cups from B to UK K/US O. Check out a few of the many styles we're considering in the images section of the campaign.

Why should I donate?

We realize this an atypical request of a retail store. Usually, expansion is an internal decision by the business owner, and I personally wavered on the decision to revisit crowd-souring again for the season. However, a small selection disappoints people, and the ones who wait last minute (you know who you are) may be forced to settle on something not quite right for the sake of time. If we took a risk and used credit to expand beyond what cash flow allowed, then we could end up unable to pay vendors or place new orders until sales picked up enough to pay back the investment. I value my vendors and prefer to play it safe rather than mess up relationships I have spent over seven years cultivating. As a result, I thought all of us could work together to make this year a dynamic, exciting year for the Piedmont Triad region by bringing in a big selection of swim everyone can enjoy! 

I also want to stress that contributing to our campaign is risk-free. We have been in business for over seven years and have no plans of closing. What you donate will be made available to you via a downloadable gift certificate good toward any purchase in the store. That's right. You don't even have to spend your donation on swimwear. By paying it forward early, you afford us the opportunity to expand quickly and keep fresh inventory cycling into the shop as the season progresses. Not to mention, we're offering some sweet perks as a way of thanking you for supporting the store:

  • $25 Contribution: $30 in Store Credit
  • $50 Contribution: $55 in Store Credit plus 5% off an entire purchase coupon. 
  • $75 Contribution: $80 in Store Credit plus 5% off an entire purchase coupon.
  • $100 Contribution: $105 in Store Credit plus 10% off an entire purchase coupon.
  • $125 Contribution: $130 in Store Credit plus 10% off an entire purchase coupon.
  • $150 Contribution: $155 in Store Credit plus 10% off an entire purchase coupon.
  • $175 Contribution: $180 in Store Credit plus 15% off an entire purchase coupon.
  • $200 Contribution: $205 in store Credit plus 15% off an entire purchase coupon.

Every contribution nets you $5 in bonus store credit, and higher donation amounts gain added discounts on entire purchases, including items other than swim! Furthermore, the donations work in conjunction with our existing customer loyalty program, making the savings greater for early contributions.

When will the swimwear be available in the store?

We currently have existing inventory with planned arrivals for February, March, and May. Additional styles will arrive two to four weeks after the campaign ends. Check out this beautiful style from Panache called Portofino that we currently stock:

If I contribute, does that guarantee my size and the suit of my choice will be in stock?

Unfortunately, no. Our sizing assortment will be based primarily on our best-selling bra sizes and previous swim sales; however, contributors can guarantee their size in a style of their choosing by contacting me directly or leaving a note with their donation. I will personally include these in our orders, but keep in mind some swim pieces have release dates later in the season which may require waiting. If you have any questions about release dates or availability in your size, please email me or call the store. But remember: Your contributions are not limited to swim and can be used to restock your bra wardrobe too!

What if I like your store but am not interested in swimwear?

You can still donate to the swimwear fund because all donations are transferable to store credit. The flip side of the store's contribution to swimwear is that we are essentially funneling most of our intimate apparel expansion money for spring into swim. Consequently, we won't have much left over for adding new bras, shapewear, lingerie, or other intimate apparel until after swim season is over. I planned a few additions to keep the inventory fresh, but without a strong campaign, the shop will not experience the surge of new colors, prints, and styles as in past years. Swim is our expansion, but if we can offset the cost of adding swim to the shop, then our intimate apparel budget will rebound quickly and lead to faster expansion in other avenues. Profit directly supports growth and allows us to become stronger as a business by addressing consumer demands and filling gaps in the marketplace In short, profit is a good thing. 

What if you raise more than $10,000?

I'm not one to count chicks before they hatch or whatever your colloquialism-of-choice is for being overly and possibly naively optimistic about . . . well . . . anything. I was pretty sure the store wasn't going to make it a year, so taking my firmly realistic outlook aside, I do believe the campaign could exceed my high expectations. If we raise more than $10,000, I will poll our contributors about whether they prefer the extra amount be available for swim or for expanding to other inventory. In our recent annual survey, many customers asked for more options in shapewear and lounge clothes.  

I can't contribute now, but I want to help. What can I do?

As a small business owner who operates on a shoestring budget and has had one financial hit after another last year, largely due to my business partner and father's cancer scare, I totally get you may not be able to contribute within the window of our campaign. You know your budget, and as always, this is a judgment free space. That said, if you want to help, do so by encouraging others to contribute:

  • Share the campaign on social media as often as you can. Our shop has accounts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, and Youtube, and we will be posting updates often to encourage contributions.
  • Send the campaign to friends and family who could benefit from our goals. Or, let's get real for a sec, send it to the ones who complain every summer when it's time to shop. They will thank you.
  • Don't forget Indiegogo has easy share tools too, allowing you to email or post directly about the campaign.  

Not to be contrite, but every little bit truly helps and that applies as much to publicity as it does to monetary contributions. The more people aware of what we are trying to accomplish and can help us reach our goals, the better the results for everyone. I've been in this business over seven years now, and no one complains about having too much selection!

A Word of Gratitude

Finally, before we even get into the thick of promoting the campaign, I want to thank everyone who has taken the time to give your feedback to us regarding swim, who has been patient with us as we kept slowly expanding from year to year, who has referred the shop to friends and family (sometime forcefully dragging them in to be fitted!), and who supported us when we were just a small, barely stocked store running on the power of dreams. You have built us into the store we are today. and in so doing, you have given me a special gift for which I am eternally thankful.
story_txt:
Why bra sized swimsuits?
As a co-owner of A Sophisticated Pair, a lingerie boutique in Burlington, NC, my ongoing goal is to provide customers with a range of products, styles, and sizes as well as offer expert fit advice in a "Judgement Free" space. For over seven years, I have been fitting people in the correct bra size, helping them choose the right style for their breast shape, lifestyle, and budgetary needs, and two years ago, we branched out to swimwear through another Indiegogo campaign. Our business was inspired by my personal bra shopping experiences and how much I struggled with selection, sizing, and fit, and swimwear is no different. Before opening the store, my swimsuit shopping escapades ended in tears more than success because nothing ever fit! I vividly remember spending an entire day driving all over the state trying to find something—no, anything—which didn't make me feel horrible about myself. Color, style, and print became irrelevant, and my confidence suffered. In the picture below, I am chilling at the lake in literally the best fitting top I could find. No support, no shape, and the halter straps pulled uncomfortably into my neck. But hey, I didn't fall out, so that's something, right? 

After we opened, I discovered many of the same manufacturers who created our awesome bras also had swimsuits in actual bra sizes. And no, these aren't generic "Fits to a D cup" type tops. These are suits in sizes like 30D, 34H, 40E, 44J, and so on. They lift! They shape! And they are freakin' cute! Last year, I bought this little gem from Elomi in my bra size UK 34H, and I couldn't get over the difference. I had been buying the wrong swimsuits my whole life!

As soon as our customers heard about the glorious world of bra sized swim, the requests came pouring in for us to include them. After all, NC is a beautiful state with lots of lakes, beaches, and rivers, to say nothing of private pools, and it's easier to enjoy warm weather if you aren't adjusting your boobs every few minutes. However, swim is super expensive, especially for a smaller shop like ours, particularly if we want to be more representative with size, style, and colors. 
Wait, didn't you just say you did this crowd-source thing before?
Yes! Back in 2017, we raised almost $5,000 to bring in a modest assortment of swim into the shop, and then we cautiously expanded to a few new styles last year as well. However, swimwear remains the single most expensive product we stock, and we received some criticisms about our selection. To truly do swimwear justice, we need the help of our customers. My open cash flow allows me to carry a few styles in select sizes, but if people contribute to the campaign, essentially prepaying for their new swimsuits plus gaining extra perks, we can do so much more for our customers. There are a wealth of styles, colors, sizes, and brands available, and with the last campaign, we were able to dip our toes in the water. This year, I want to dive in headfirst and explore. I want people to have the option of trying on multiple suits in different fits and sizes—to find that perfect confidence boosting piece that makes you feel beautiful and sexy and courageous. Without this campaign, we'll rely primarily on what we currently stock, four pre-booked style, and special orders, meaning you may not be able to leave the shop with a swimsuit on the day you visit. Crowdsourcing allows us to pull resources together to improve the shop for everyone.

How much do you need?
Because we only sell high quality products, the wholesale cost on a bikini top is comparable to the cost of our bras, but a one-piece or a tankini? The added material creates a wholesale cost almost double that of a normal bra. Now factor in over 125 different sizes to represent, and the investment total adds up quickly. The shop has allocated around $3,000 of our spring buying budget to supplement our existing stock and any fundraising results, but we are aiming for an additional $10,000 with the campaign. Aside from factoring in wholesale costs, we also have the following expenses:

$350-400 in estimated shipping costs from manufacturers
$300-350 in estimated storage and fixtures to accommodate the extra inventory
General cost of the perks, including the added store credit and the profit lost through discount coupons for larger contributions
Indiegogo fees totaling 8% of funds raised plus 30 cents per contribution (includes platform and credit card fees)
Indiegogo now withholds 5% of the funds raised for six months to allow for refunds, meaning as much $500 of the goal will not be given to us until after swim season.

While $10,000 is our ultimate goal, I have tiered plans depending on how much we ultimately raise, each revolving around unique swimwear color groups from our brands. Coordinating collections usually consist of two to three top styles plus a few matching bottom options, and we will balance variety both in terms of shape and size but also in color and print.

$2,500: At least two collections
$5,000: At least four collections
$7,500: At least six collections
$10,000: At least eight collections

You'll notice I use "at least" in my campaign promises. No, I'm not going all politician on you. Like any retail business, sales fuel growth, and it is my intention for the campaign to essentially jump start our swim expansion. story:
Where We're At:

Due to the recent outbreak of COVID19, our restaurant is forced to temporarily close our doors. Because of this we are exploring different ways to keep our small business alive and pay our employees and asking for your help!

  • We are a small restaurant based in California's Central Valley. We have two storefronts located in Fresno and Visalia, along with several mobile catering food trucks and pop up tents!
  • We are committed to our staff and want to keep them financially secure in this time of such uncertainty.
  • Every purchase here goes straight to our payroll account so we can continue to pay our employees even when our restaurant is not operational. We have about 40 employees who depend on us and when you contribute to us you contribute to them!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We want to keep it real with you guys, to pay our employees for the duration we will be closed will take about 50k.
  • We never shy away from a good laugh so we made special merchandise just for the occasion!
  • We are offering deals like we never have before, including exclusive shirts and stickers, private catering, and free quesadillas for a year!

The Impact

Your contributions will be felt directly in the lives of our 40 person staff:

  • A lot of our staff is solely employed by us, we are their only source of income.
  • Just because our restaurant is on pause, doesn't mean that their bills are.
  • We are committed to supporting each and every member of our team, but we can't do it alone.

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that this is a stressful time for countless people around the world and within our community.
  • We believe in the collective resilience that our community around the valley and beyond has shown us throughout the duration of small business, and remain faithful that they will continue to support us through this time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? We get that! Here are other things you can do for us:

  • Share this with your friends! Tag us on our socials @quesadillagorilla
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools! There is a link provided where people can donate directly to us!

Thank you for your support, no matter the capacity it is in!
