story:
The Food Forest Project: Our History, Mission, & Goals

The Food Forest Project began a few years back, as a hopeful seed in our hearts...and now it has grown literal roots into Mother Earth! We are encouraged to see such progress and promise as our dream becomes reality, for the well-being of all Life. It all began with monthly camping trips to the woods along the Etowah River (near Dahlonega, Georgia). These fantastic retreats filled our proverbial cups with good fellowship, fun, and the restorative healing presence of Nature. We found plenty of creative projects to keep us and the kids active...blazing new trails, swimming, new camping areas, campfire music-making, and building a zipline across the river.

Our group however, was looking for purpose as well as fun. To fulfill our deeper desire, we wanted a way to help people, animals, and the environment. We commonly shared a vision to bring the beauty, bounty, and blessings of Nature to those in need. So we turned our sights to sustainable, permaculture farming...growing earth-healthy food for local charities, churches, and wildlife centers. After a gracious 5-acre donation from the land owners in 2014, we began planning and gathering donations, tools, materials, and knowledge.

Last year, with the generous help of our supporters, we prepped our 5-acre plot with an irrigation swale, to evenly disperse rain water to the Food Forest. We planted 20 young fruit trees (apple, peach, pear, and plum), a variety of berry bushes, leafy greens, and herbs. We added fencing to deter wildlife, and solar-power irrigation to draw water directly from the river. We now better understand the investments of time and resources that are needed to keep our Food Forest growing and able to fulfill it's purpose.

We are expanding the Food Forest this October with many new, mature fruit trees, as well as other projects that bring us closer to providing a solution to food-scarcity in our community. During harvest time, our supporters will be invited to participate in a 50/50 U-Pick, with half going to those in need. We will be partnering with local food banks, charities, and churches to insure that all the healthy food we've grown goes to use! Down the road when our project is in full swing, we plan to offer classes about natural remedies, healthy cooking, sustainability, and Earth-stewardship.

We're hoping to fund two projects THIS year....

1 - This coming October, we hope to purchase and plant 20 mature fruit trees. Although a bit more expensive, the mature trees come with a LIFETIME guarantee. This will increase our odds of success and help us produce food faster.

2 - We'd like to lay down a raised Cob floor in the barn. The barn is our main area for shelter, storage, teaching, harvesting, etc. Currently the floor is an undulating mix of red clay, dust, and weeds. We occasionally get water in the barn during a major rain event. Raising the level and putting in a cob floor will solve this and greatly improve the usefulness of the structure. Cob is a resilient mix of sand, clay, and straw that dries hard, like cement. This project will greatly increase the usefulness of the building and teach us more about building with cob, which we plan to use for other storage and shelter areas on the land. Our test batches of cob have turned out well and shown its usefulness.

This year we are hoping to raise $2500 to purchase mulch for the garden, 20 mature fruit trees, materials for the Cob floor, equipment rentals, and associated ground materials. If we don’t reach our goal, we'll purchase as much as we can with what we have.

Would you like to be a part of our project? Please consider a donation to the Food Forest Project. Even a small offering will have a huge impact in a couple years, when the trees are bearing fruit and ready to nourish needy families with wholesome food. We are also gratefully accepting donations such as tools, lumber, fencing, irrigation, or any farm/garden/construction related materials.

Thanks for your interest in the Food Forest. We hope you can lend a hand and be part of this love-in-action campaign!
story_txt: The Food Forest Project: Our History, Mission, & GoalsThe Food Forest Project began a few years back, as a hopeful seed in our hearts...and now it has grown literal roots into Mother Earth! We are encouraged to see such progress and promise as our dream becomes reality, for the well-being of all Life. It all began with monthly camping trips to the woods along the Etowah River (near Dahlonega, Georgia). These fantastic retreats filled our proverbial cups with good fellowship, fun, and the restorative healing presence of Nature. We found plenty of creative projects to keep us and the kids active...blazing new trails, swimming, new camping areas, campfire music-making, and building a zipline across the river. Our group however, was looking for purpose as well as fun. To fulfill our deeper desire, we wanted a way to help people, animals, and the environment. We commonly shared a vision to bring the beauty, bounty, and blessings of Nature to those in need. So we turned our sights to sustainable, permaculture farming...growing earth-healthy food for local charities, churches, and wildlife centers. After a gracious 5-acre donation from the land owners in 2014, we began planning and gathering donations, tools, materials, and knowledge. Last year, with the generous help of our supporters, we prepped our 5-acre plot with an irrigation swale, to evenly disperse rain water to the Food Forest. We planted 20 young fruit trees (apple, peach, pear, and plum), a variety of berry bushes, leafy greens, and herbs. We added fencing to deter wildlife, and solar-power irrigation to draw water directly from the river. We now better understand the investments of time and resources that are needed to keep our Food Forest growing and able to fulfill it's purpose.We are expanding the Food Forest this October with many new, mature fruit trees, as well as other projects that bring us closer to providing a solution to food-scarcity in our community. During harvest time, our supporters will be invited to participate in a 50/50 U-Pick, with half going to those in need. We will be partnering with local food banks, charities, and churches to insure that all the healthy food we've grown goes to use! Down the road when our project is in full swing, we plan to offer classes about natural remedies, healthy cooking, sustainability, and Earth-stewardship.We're hoping to fund two projects THIS year....1 - This coming October, we hope to purchase and plant 20 mature fruit trees. Although a bit more expensive, the mature trees come with a LIFETIME guarantee. This will increase our odds of success and help us produce food faster. 2 - We'd like to lay down a raised Cob floor in the barn. The barn is our main area for shelter, storage, teaching, harvesting, etc. Currently the floor is an undulating mix of red clay, dust, and weeds. We occasionally get water in the barn during a major rain event. Raising the level and putting in a cob floor will solve this and greatly improve the usefulness of the structure. Cob is a resilient mix of sand, clay, and straw that dries hard, like cement. This project will greatly increase the usefulness of the building and teach us more about building with cob, which we plan to use for other storage and shelter areas on the land. Our test batches of cob have turned out well and shown its usefulness. This year we are hoping to raise $2500 to purchase mulch for the garden, 20 mature fruit trees, materials for the Cob floor, equipment rentals, and associated ground materials. If we don’t reach our goal, we'll purchase as much as we can with what we have. Would you like to be a part of our project? Please consider a donation to the Food Forest Project. Even a small offering will have a huge impact in a couple years, when the trees are bearing fruit and ready to nourish needy families with wholesome food. We are also gratefully accepting donations such as tools, lumber, fencing, irrigation, or any farm/garden/construction related materials. Thanks for your interest in the Food Forest. We hope you can lend a hand and be part of this love-in-action campaign!

story:
Growing up I was raised by a single hard working mother who birth four kids, me being the only boy/ man of the house it was never the perfect life growing up. We lived in the inner city, a rough historic neighborhood call Overtown and Liberty City in Miami, Fl. I always dreamed of becoming an entrepreneur of my own big company ever since a young age.  I always imagined making life better on my mother and grandmother for raising an intelligent young man and my siblings. Being the only man in the household I grew up into adulthood quickly because I wanted to help out my mother. My entrepreneurship started quickly at the age of 9, I sold ice pops to the neighborhood kids, by 13 I started washing neighbor cars, and then at 16 I started cutting grass all as a part to reaching the American dream. After losing my great grandmother,  life seem to get harder and I was heading down the wrong road. My next couple of years was rough, I was lost in the world not knowing what to do sleeping from house to house wondering where my next meal was go come from. But me coming from a spiritual background with a praying mother who never lost faith, I headed back unto the right path. I enrolled into Miami Dade College, to study for a better life and career. After receiving my associate degree in Psychology, six months later after working as an assistant, I was laid off at my job due to the company downsizing. I couldn’t afford to go to school to complete my bachelor degree and support myself no more. That’s when I decided to go back to my younger days and become an entrepreneur again and started faabhome.com (an easier way to shop for anything you need for your household). I had this idea in mind for the longest. I explain the concept and process to several dozens of people and was praised by the amazing feedback. I use every penny I had to start faabhome.com for lawyer fees, website, registry, paperwork, etc. The company is set to launch in the summer of 2015. I need money for promotions and advertising, an app ($4000), servers’ fee, etc. Not only is I’m asking for funds, but also any advice to give me as I’m going down this long road of running a company. I really appreciate the time you guys took just to stop what you doing just to read my brief story.

For more information feel free anytime to reach me at waldedwayne@gmail.com. Also check out my website www.faabhome.com .

I’m just an ambitious young man trying to live the American dream to share with my family.

Word of Advice: Never Give Up On Your Dream. Your Dream Can Be A Reality.
Please help me spread the word even if you can't contribute. This is just beginning of my dream coming true.

story:
“There are a number of texts and traditions which hint that the monuments may have been used directly as instruments of the knowledge. They are spoken of as places in which the initiate might be ‘transformed into a god’ or into a bright star.” - Graham Hancock, in Heaven’s Mirror


WHO WE ARE:

We are a Dublin based tour company that believes that certain ancient sacred sites in Ireland hold the power of transformation and wisdom.  It is our goal to take you on these journeys.  Ultimately we seek to reconnect the individual soul to the divine source and to better enable visitors to make sense of their present and to find a vision to shape their magnificent future.

My name is Liam.  I am the founder of Sacred Irish Tours.  I am a former educator, business executive and entrepreneur with a lifelong interest in finding answers to the big questions of life, such as:  who am I and why am I here?

My quest has involved travel to sacred sites all over the world, and as such, I have garnered a special interest both in Celtic, Andean shamanism & energy medicine. My studies, travel and experience have led me to believe in the regenerative and inspirational healing power of these sites.  It's my  desire to create an Irish Sacred Sites tour company to both share the experience of Ireland and her sacred places.

THE PROBLEM

The world today is experiencing intense levels of societal and personal turmoil. It’s the belief of the founders of Sacred Irish Tours, that the primary cause of this malaise is the high level of disconnection between each other, the environment and our spiritual nature.

The ancients of Ireland and other civilizations understood the need to connect with these places of power; places where the spiritual energy was high.  They created both monuments and temples allowing for the spiritual regeneration of the individual visitor, further enabling those to find harmony, recharge and meet the challenges of daily life.

If we look at these sites and the numerous scientific studies conducted, (see Freddy Silva's  The Divine Blueprint) it is clear that the ancients understood that human kind, is their essence, is an energy being.  As such, many of the sacred sites use water, geomagnetism, sacred geometry, orientation, sacred dimension and stone (to anchor energies ) to create an electromagnetic environment impacting the energy field of the visitor.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We are seeking to raise $60,000 to cover the acquisition of a mini bus, marketing  and the first 3 months operating costs (we intend to restrict the tour numbers to a maximum of 16 per tour so as to ensure a more  intimate and enjoyable tour experience ). We also intend to develop our website as the "go to site" for Sacred Tours worldwide.

Currently, Ireland is going through a very difficult economic time.  As a result, traditional sources of funding are very restricted. It is our hope that we might find a sympathetic audience within the Indiegogo community .


PERKS AND FUNDRAISING

Our perks are simple, yet thoughtful. The funds will go to the purchasing of a tour bus as well as the initial operating costs to get the project off the ground .


THE IMPACT

We believe that Sacred Irish Tours can contribute to both the well being of the participants and the environment through the connection of these sacred places of power. 

We also believe that our efforts could ultimately raise the Global Happiness Index simply by insuring that all our tours are not only informative and transformative but also great Craic (fun).

The founder Liam Lawlor is passionate about the business’s vision and have the necessary experience and skills to make Sacred Irish Tours a huge success.

We would greatly appreciate the support of the Indiegogo community in raising the necessary funds.  If, however,  you can’t support us financially,  then please do tell your friends and family.  Especially those visiting Ireland. If nothing else, please just wish us well.  Thank You!


Slan agus Beannacht

Liam 

Sacred Irish Tours



Lia Fáil (Stone of Destiny) - Hill of Tara



Neolithic art - Knowth


Dolmen - Hill of Howth


Newgrange - Brú na Bóinne (Boyne Valley)

Another tour at Powerscourt - Enniskerry, County Wicklow, Ireland

story:
Our Story

Back in 2006, when Rocky and I were still young high school sweethearts, we had a dream. We wanted to open an independent bookstore. We talked about if off and on throughout the years, but it eventually fell to the wayside as daily life took over.
Then, in December of 2013, we did something that very few people our age do; We decided to put everything on the line and pursue our dream.

In March 2014, Rocky and I opened Phantastic Books. Our goal has been not only to create a counter-cultural environment in which people involved and interested in the arts can share their work and interests with others of a like mind, but to also offer something completely unique to the community; from a diverse selection of handpicked books, to Cards Against Humanity tournaments, to a little wine bar nestled in between the book cases.

Here we are a year later, boys and girls, struggling to keep our dream alive.

We Need You

We are trying to raise $15,000 to completely overhaul the store and keep us in business. The funds will be go to paying our overhead (and trust me, there's a lot of it), new stock, expenses, and of course, feeding Pluto!

To put it simply:
  • Our monthly bills (not counting taxes + fees) = $3,500 / multiply that by 2 = $7000 - This ensures we have 2 months while we are making the transition
  • New inventory= $8000 - This meets the minimum order requirements for the 2 new wholesale companies we will be getting our stock from.

Now, this may seem like a lot, but to put it into perspective, our initial investment into this bookstore was around $70,000; 2/3rds of that was in books alone.

If you are interested in the exact breakdown of where the funds are going, or if you have any questions/suggestions, email us at phantasticbooks@live.com.

We also have a surprise for you! With the complete overhaul of the shop, we have decided to revamp the store, but still keep the quirkiness that our customers find so attractive. We will be operating under a new name (that will remain secret until the unveiling) & our focus will change from new books to used books and novelty. But that's the best part, it won't be your average novelty items. You guys are in for a real treat.
Sneak Peeks:
http://accoutrements.com/shop/
http://www.bigmouthinc.com/

Now, what you are really waiting for: The Perks

The first 3 lovely people to give a contribution of $24 or more will receive an exclusive t-shirt with our new design & logo on it.

With every contribution, you have the opportunity to pat yourself on the back for doing something good for someone else. Hey, that's good karma.

You also get something special for every contribution $20 and up, ranging from a high five from Pluto, to your face as our computer desktop for an entire week. That's right, your face.

(Any perk you earn can either be shipped to you, or you can pick it up at the shop.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand that. But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Invite your friends to contribute.
  • Don't forget the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
All proceeds towards Enactus Seneca are going to

“Threads of Empowerment” Cambodia

We are the Enactus Seneca team. Our mission is to enable progress through entrepreneurial action. ENACTUS is a global organization that connects students, academics and business leaders through entrepreneurial-based projects that empower communities to transform opportunities in to real sustainable projects.

Our first international project will be taking place in Cambodia. Since the beginning of our startup we have known that this country is facing several severe inhuman issues. Therefore, we decided to use our expertise and experience to give families and children the ability to feel like humans again. Our main goal is to reach $5000 CAD in the next two weeks. This money will be used to finance Threads of Empowerment Project. 

Three years ago, a shy seven year old Cambodian girl who had never been to school, Nita was excited when her Aunt Sophy brought her to live in the big city. Sophy enrolled her in a private school, spending sixty dollars a month to give her niece a decent chance. It was hard. Nita was three years behind grade level and had no study skills. She had to repeat the first grade, but she worked hard and succeeded in the second try. Now, having almost completed the second grade, Nita has had to withdraw from school on March 23rd because her aunt can no longer afford the tuition. She wept when her Aunt Sophy broke the news. Without funding, she will have to live in the village where there is no education. This girl has come so far in three years. With our help, Nita’s extended family can start a business and support her education and that of her younger sister, Nikka. 

In the month of May 2015, three of our team members will be traveling to Cambodia to begin teaching Cambodians entrepreneurial skills, and the clothes we’ve collected will provide a better source of income instead of, in some circumstances, sending their children into brothels. Kristen Scharf, our main project leader, has been volunteering annually in Cambodia. Life is hard in Cambodia, there are many challenges that need to be faced, and Kristen is determined to face all of these risks and challenges to help the people of that country. Our team members are committed to changing the lives of these children, because change always starts with the smallest of things. And this time, change will start with your help and our expertise.  

“Be the change you want to see in the world” - Mahatma Gandhi

Please share this campaign amongst others and help us make a difference. Please donate. We would also like to thank you for taking the time to read about us, as the smallest amount of help can make a biggest impact for those less fortunate.

For more inquires you can go to www.enactusseneca.ca

story:
Bringing Awareness and Advocacy to Autism One Pedal At a Time

Hello! Our name's are Joseph Papalia and Dilan Navarajah and we are first-year students at York University. Raising money for Autism awareness is extremely important to us. Both of us have had very close friends with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) and we want to do everything that we can to bring forth awareness and advocacy for all of the children worldwide that are affected by the disorder. After a great amount of brainstorming and planning we have come up with a really awesome idea!! Our plan is to bike 1km for every $1 that is donated to this campaign! 
What We Need & What You Get
Our plan is to raise $5000 for Autism Speaks Canada!! And as an incentive we are going to bike 1km for every 1$ that is donated! Our hopes are to raise all 5000$ and as a result bike 5000km along the Trans Canada Trail in one go! Autism awareness is an amazing cause to donate and contribute to. The campaign that we have created is designed to be exciting and impactful. Is it not an awesome idea to send two ordinary guys biking across Canada?! 

The Impact

The impact that this campaign will make, hopefully, will be huge! We are just your average ordinary Canadian's that want to help wherever we can. And to us that means doing the extraordinary to raise whatever amount possible, to help those that we love and cherish. 

Risks & Challenges

We know that biking 5000km will not be easy. We are not super athletes. We are not celebrities. We are not superhuman. We are just average students. Biking 5000km will be rigorous, demanding, exhausting, and extremely difficult. If we reach our goal of 5000$, we fully intend to, without aid, bike the entire distance. We will do this entirely self-sufficiently. WE WILL NOT GET OUTSIDE HELP! We will do everything that we can to succeed in achieving this goal and as a result bring awareness and advocacy to a cause that affects so many children worldwide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's totally okay if you cannot donate to this campaign! All we ask is that you bring this topic up and join us in building awareness and advocacy! Sharing on social media and directing people here is all the better!

We are not super athletes. We are not celebrities. We are not superhuman. We are just average students. Biking 5000km will be rigorous, demanding, exhausting, and extremely difficult. If we reach our goal of 5000$, we fully intend to, without aid, bike the entire distance. We will do this entirely self-sufficiently. WE WILL NOT GET OUTSIDE HELP! We will do everything that we can to succeed in achieving this goal and as a result bring awareness and advocacy to a cause that affects so many children worldwide. 
    Other Ways You Can Help It's totally okay if you cannot donate to this campaign! All we ask is that you bring this topic up and join us in building awareness and advocacy! Sharing on social media and directing people here is all the better!

story:
Who Are We?

  • Founded in 2012
  • Trauma-informed
  • We have served over 260 women.
  • We have helped 14 leave the commercial sex industry.
  • Our founder is a survivor of childhood sexual exploitation and abuse.

  • Our vision is to end human trafficking and sexual exploitation.     

What's the Need?

  • Human trafficking is the fastest growing crime in the world.
  • There are hundreds of thousands of women and men being sold while there are only 686 restoration beds available in the US. 
  • Switch needs $595,000 to open programs that will allow adult women to realize they are worthy of a better life, receive the healing needed from sexual victimization, recovery from any form of substance abuse, life skills, and job skills needed to successfully reintegrate into society.

How Your Donation Will Help Make A Difference

  • You will help Switch create a holistic restoration home where women can regain their life through counseling by licensed professionals, substance abuse recovery, support groups, job skills, and life skills that will allow for reintegration.
  • You will help Switch expand their Outreach efforts.
  • You will help Switch implement a day program (Rahab's Program) for women still in the commercial industry.  This program will provide support groups, education, and opportunities for assistance from various community agencies.

Risks & Challenges

  • Being able to find employment for our women as many do have charges on their record.

Our Solution

  • We have begun working with business owners in our community that are willing to hire our women.  We also have a business plan to eventually start our own business that can employ our clients as well as help us be self-sustaining.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Join the movement! Partner with us by sharing this campaign with others who may want to make a difference!
  • You can use the indiegogo share tools to share this campaign through your social media platforms.

story:
We need your help, and are asking for your contribution!

Making good whisky consumes truck loads of capital.

Defiant American Single Malt Whisky was founded in 2010, and market launched 12/12/2012.

 Demand for Defiant Whisky is growing and we need capital to grow! 

We have to buy the grain, bottles, equipment, payroll, marketing, sales trips, oak, all well before the cash flows back in the doors.

Defiant Whisky has been financed out of pocket so far, and all of our employees are equity owners of the company.

We need funding for our new still, mashing equipment, fermentation tanks, bottling line, thousands of pounds of grain per day, and a scaled up sales and marketing campaign.

Defiant Whisky is virtually debt free and we belive in keeping it that way.
Defiant Whisky is currently available in 21 states and three countries, we plan to round out each existing state and continue to move into the remaining 29 states, and continue to engage foreign markets.
We also need significant capitol to expand our long term barrel aging program that is expected to consume tens of thousands of dollars per production month "laying down whisky" that will not be available to go to market for many years.
Your contribution will allow Defiant Whisky to continue to become a recognized household name.
As a contributor, you will be eligible to come in behind the scenes, make whisky with us, come relax lake side and explore our 550 acre campus.  
Visit us on Facebook and defiantwhisky.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! I hope you're doing super awesome, thanks for coming and listening to my spiel! 

If we haven't met yet, I'm Leah, and I'm a cosplayer, model, costumer, gamer, princess performer, and giant kid at heart from Arizona (but I now live in Hawaii) 

 

(das me ^)

While I really recommend you watch the video because 

1. it's easier to explain out loud 

2. it was a BEAUTIFUL day outside! 

3. I don't do videos often so that's like historic in and of itself 

here is the TLDNR of my situation, my project, and how to can has help! 

*Edited to save confusion and for brevity*

I had a prospective job that didn't work out, though it did seem all but finalized to me. No hard feelings to the prospective employer. I ordered the tail for this job specifically, but since it didn't pan out, I'm now in personal debt with no way to pay off this expense. 

What We Need & What You Get

SO to help me recoup this massive cost, I'm a mermaid for hire! All rewards are geared towards mermaiding, but feel free to replace "mermaid" with "cosplay" or "princess" in any reward tier. This does definitely include the charity sponsorship tier! 

My rewards include ultra exclusive prints, video, special Hawaiian gifts, sponsoring charity work, event appearances, and literally anything you can think of. If you donate and have another idea in mind, just let me know!  

All prints, underwater and otherwise will be shot by some of the most talented photographers in the state and may include turtles, dolphins, and more! 

This is Natsu, and she was made by Lily of Syren Studios! 

Note: the full cost of the tail + shipping + the accouterments was actually about $3000, but I put my funding as flexible so I can make it a little easier! Any amount helps make my student loan payments not late. I'm not about to get my kneecaps broken for this debt, but it's going to be a struggle to pay off this personal debt along with my normal expenses without a consistent mermaid job. 

Risks & Challenges

The tail is already done and here and this funding IS the challenge! If I don't get fully funded, I stay in debt longer. I'm going to be working hard no matter what, but the less help I get the more I'm behind. 

If I drown, well, that sucks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help, that's TOTALLY okay. Like I said in the video, I Want to make sure that you're okay financially before even thinking of helping me out. 

That said, if you know any events- clubs with a pool, grand openings, mermaid bars, large scale birthdays/quinces/etc, resorts that might need a mermaid- anything like that, put me in touch! 

If you're in Hawaii, please tell everyone you know that you know this awesome mermaid looking for work! 

Also, please share this with anyone you know that might be able to give me a hand... er, fin? Word of mouth is huge, not just for crowdfunding, but for me to find work.

story:
Who are these dudes 

(Chef Carlos Chombolin Alba doing chicharrones)
We are a group of young dreamers from Panama in Central America. We have seen the potential of growth in our country. We are gastro-addicts that have discovered our rainforest an opportunity. We believe in our customs, traditions, resources and produce. We are in search to define locality and food that encounters produce cooked with techniques that tell a story of our region. We acknowledge that is kind of an stretch to ask the world to trust in us but we kind of feel that food is a form of global art.
Introducing first FIGHTING out of the blue corner with experience as head chef at Atelier and Humo in Panama City, having worked with Chef Mario Castrellon of Maito and Chef Mikel Gallo of Ni Neu in San Sebastián, Spain... It is Chef Carlos "Chombolin" Alba. And now FIGHTING out the red corner with a record of 100 drinks in 7 minutes, the most awesome hair in the country and expert craftsman in drinks, fighting out of Hotel Chantelle NYC... Robert A. Martin. 
 OUR PLEDGE

(Locally sourced pixbae)

What we are going to do is discover what our country and region has to give to the world in terms of fruits, new flavors, old cooking techniques and preparation. To develop a cuisine around the history of the biodiversity that involves Panama´s emerging from the sea. Panama little country in the middle of the continent since we have been a region of transit, we have some mad flavors and cooking styles  that we want to show the world.

In order to challenge ourselves we pledge to cook with 90% local product. We will be working directly with farmers and give them a fair price eliminating the intermediaries also guarding endemic product from this land. 
WHERE IS THE FUNDING GOING TOWARDS

(The crew making it happen!)
The investment needed will go towards 
  • Rent
  • Making the PATIO awesome
  • Paying our awesome Architect and No. 1 believer in us James Chung and builder extraordinaire Mr Roberto
  • Funding the Patio´s national edible flowers garden
  • Most Importantly not having to add a business partner that will demand this place to be a cash machine and not what we really look forward to
CURRENT NEWS

(Our Architect! We love him.)
We need right now funds for permits and paying our Architect and builiding team. Although they love us they cannot work with limited material and funds for much longer. Some of the funds here will be needed towards plates and the Patio. If we get funded by you, we will do our best to deliver an amazing experience focused only on quality an fair priced. WE DO NOT BELIEVE IN EXPENSIVE BILLS FOR FOOD. This is our passion, we do not want to compromise and taint it with greed. 

Other ways to help us

If you cannot help or will not be in our country in the foreseeable future we encourage you to share our passion in your networks and be proud when you visit us someday that you have helped to create something original and made us be free of business investors that only care about numbers. We care about flavor and authenticity.

story:
Twin Tiers Honor Flight is a 501(c)(3) organization that is part of the Honor Flight Network, a non-profit organization created solely to honor America's veterans for all their sacrifices. 

Our mission is to transport our heroes to Washington, D.C. to visit and reflect at their memorials. Top priority is given to the senior veterans – World War II survivors, along with those other veterans who may be terminally ill.

In 2014 we took almost 100 WWII and Korean era veterans on a trip and in 2015 we will transport our 100th veteran!   When these conflicts ended, many of our war heroes simply came home and returned to work.  There were few parades and most didn't talk about their time in the service.  Our hub and many like it across the nation are working to honor the service of those who gave so much by taking them on the trip of a lifetime at absolutely no cost to the veteran.  The trip includes everything, transportation, all meals, souvenirs and tremendous send-offs and welcome homes.  Guardians come on every trip to ensure the safety of each veteran.

Our goal, and the goal of honor flight hubs across the United States, is to provide this experience to as many veterans as possible.  Most of us are currently focusing on WWII and Korean era veterans, who range in age from 80-95.  

We are losing these heroes at an alarming rate and for this reason, time is of the essence!

A typical mission costs anywhere from $40,000 - $85,000 depending on the number of veterans traveling, the price of transportation (flight, buses), etc.  On average it generally costs to $500/veteran.  

Your support can help honor the service of those who gave so much and asked for so little in return!

story:
What does it do?

MediaBox is the Swiss Army Knife for Media on a TV or monitor. The only device equally happy in a boardroom, hotel or home. 

But what about Roku and Apple TV?

Roku and Apple are great if your in the US or even Western European markets, however they lack a vast number of Features required in more developing countries.
No analogue output for older screens and no connectivity built-in.
This is why we have developed an LTE and Fibre version of our device, Launching in November. So you will get a 2x2 Wifi Hotspot with built-in fibre or LTE as well as Mediabox. A total home connectivity and entertainment solution. 
Here is a teaser image: 


I don't get it?

Think combining a WiFi Router / LTE or Fibre and a Mediabox. Whether its Netflix, Hulu, HBO, iPlayer or mirroring your PC, MAC, Android / IOS phone & tablet we have a device for you. We provide the worlds best fan-less, small form factor machines for home entertainment, digital signage, hotels and industry.

Have a look below at our original campaign and see how far we have come and will still go:

Original Campaign:

Why variable funding?

We have spent the time, effort and money getting our product ready. The perks are already in final pre-production and once we have final numbers we will hit the order button, so your hardware and OS are guaranteed to be delivered on time.


With the MediaBox, you can watch any video on-demand services, play anything from a USB/MicroSD, listen to streaming radio, surf and browse the net, even gaming and much more...your TV becomes your complete media platform. 

Perfect for home / hotel entertainment, boardroom or digital signage applications.

MBX allows you to play any on-demand services, such as Netflix, Hulu+, HBO, Youtube, Vimeo, BBC iPlayer, TuneIn,  Spotify & VIDI. The device has been developed to support any future changes or growth in the market place.


Perhaps you don't have an internet connection? No problem, the MBX-3G is also a hotspot with up to 21.6Mbps download speed, so you can connect your laptop, phone and tablet while watching, playing, listening or surfing so you can unleash your entertainment experience.  


With built-in 1x MicroSD, 2 x USB ports, Ethernet, WiFi & Bluetooth (including being a hotspot), we have got you completely covered. Watch movies, stream TV, surf and play games anywhere you want.


Whether you want to watch on a High definition (HDMI) or standard definition (red yellow, white RCA's) you can use the MBX on any TV and still experience the best digital entertainment wherever you are.

With models that have Android, Windows or Linux pre-installed. Whether your needs are for media, desktop or M2M we can fulfil your requirement. Our MBX units also include the ability to mirror your mobile device's screen content, regardless of brand or manufacturer (provided the device supports mirroring of some kind). 


We are a team of dynamic technology innovators based in Cape Town, and our aim is to create low-cost, low-power computing solutions. We design and produce quality technology driven products, software and services, based on cutting edge platforms.

Our company is made up of a group of young professionals specialising in software, engineering, finance and design. We are a passionate team that brings together our various skills to create new products that are disruptive, essential & fun.

But our business is more than media...

It is connecting people to an information age. With the development of the MBX range, we can help create a low-cost-high-quality product in terms of media and hotspots all over the developing world, especially due to the integration of 3G connectivity into our units.


We need your help to take our current products into full scale production. 

The more support we get the faster we can do this.  

Our product components are ready for tooling & mass production. With the help of the campaign funding we will finalise the necessary applications, final product packaging, testing and shipping to your door.

Below you will find out just what a powerhouse you will be getting... Just click the image to enlarge.

With the MBX you will have a complete Android / Linux / Windows based computer that works on your TV/Monitor/screen in HD or Analogue (depending on model). 

Over and above all this, we are also developing a Linux Ubuntu / Chrome OS low cost sub $200 all-in-one PC Including screen, keyboard & mouse, using the same hardware ecosystem as our Android unit.



The technology sector is filled with giants that control their own products to only work with other products they produce. 

We believe that technology is meant to help make life easier not more confusing. This is why we are creating a link between multiple brands / ecosystems and products and we will continue to provide this whatever the trends and wherever technology moves and leads us from here. 

If you can't contribute financially please help us by spreading the word about what we are trying to do among your friends, family and entire network. Mention us on a Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp or any social media platform you can, to help us spread 'Entertainment Freedom' throughout the world.

With your help we can have an immense impact on the future of computing in developing countries and the world in general.

story:
Our Purpose: To Connect People with Great Local and Online Black Owned Businesses

BlkTown was founded in 2014 to help people find great local and online black owned/co-owned businesses like restaurants, contractors, clothing designers and hair care products. You can use BlkTown to find awesome black owned/co-owned local and online businesses, network with other like minded individuals and discuss important topics in the BlkTown Forums.

The Facts

43 million African Americans in the United States, 13.7 percent of the total population, the second largest racial minority in the country.

With an estimated $1.1 trillion in buying power by 2015 and $1.3 trillion by 2017.

So what does this all mean in business terms?
It means African Americans wield tremendous economic power.

The Problem

With over 2 million registered black owned businesses in the United States the NAACP says “Currently, a dollar circulates in Asian communities for a month, in Jewish communities approximately 20 days and white communities 17 days. How long does a dollar circulate in the black community? 6 hours!!! African American buying power is at 1.1 Trillion; and yet only 2 cents of every dollar an African American spends in this country goes to black owned businesses.”

13-percent of the U.S. population, just seven-percent (7%) of small business are owned by Blacks. Access to capital, clientele, and other resources hinder many Black folks from starting business, despite our long history of entrepreneurship.

The Solution

Welcome to BlkTown.com where we provide a means of connecting people with awesome black owned/co-owned local location based and online businesses.
BlkTown focuses on Rebuilding, Encouraging and Empowering Black Owned/Co-Owned Businesses, Entrepreneurs and CEOs through our interactive and user friendly web and mobile platforms.Check it out today and support our Black Owned/Co-Owned businesses. 

What We Need & What You Get

So how does your contribution help us:

  • Not a single dollar will be paid to anyone at BlkTown as every dollar we receive will be used for marketing via our social platforms on facebook, twitter, instagram, pinterest, etc. managed by persons of color.


The Impact

Your contribution greatly helps us spread the word about BlkTown, to encourage other Black Owned Businesses to promote and share their products/services with our community.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share and follow our social media pages as we truly count on your support and word of mouth to help spread the word.
  • Our social media pages are below.

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/BlkTown

Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/BlkTown

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/BlkTown

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/BlkTown

Again, we'd like to thank all of our supporters for helping this become a success.  Remember to support and encourage each other as we strive to build an empire of successful Black Owned businesses.

-BlkTown Team

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Thank You for taking the time to read a little bit about us and what our dream means! Here we go!

The Gypsies Trunk started as an Etsy store in 2012, selling handmade bohemian jewelry as well as vintage clothing & accessories. We have now proudly grown into our own online store, which launched May of 2014. The pieces that we carry are tribal inspired, for example, beautiful fair-trade bags from Thailand & Morocco. We will also be selling handmade items from independent, local artists in our physical store, such as jewelry, clothes, soaps etc.


The dream of shop owner Katie Acampora is to have a boutique here in San Diego to sell beautiful things that inspire women to travel, be simple, be free, and to find their own unique style. The items in the shop are ethnic, bohemian, beachy and easy to love. Each piece should make your soul happy!

We would be forever grateful for each and every donation, big or small! You will be helping us achieve our dream of a life time, bringing The Gypsies Trunk to life!  

Our website: http://www.thegypsiestrunk.com

What We Need & What You Get

The funding amount of $10,000 won't cover all costs to open our store but will majorly help us so much on getting our feet off the ground. This money will go towards contributing to paying rent, purchasing inventory, insurance costs, advertising,  store displays and more. 

We are offering discounts and free stuff to our amazingly kind contributors! Promo codes to our website and free jewelry!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still go towards everything listed above, we still won't quit our dream!

    The Impact

    The Gypsies Trunk will contribute to helping people around the world by purchasing fair- trade inventory, for example purses from Morocco & Thailand and jewelry from India. With our support, we help them create a more fulfilling life. We will also take pride in supporting small, local, jewelry designers & fashion designers by carrying their special handmade treasures in our shop. 

    Our successful track record has so far been:

    >Opening our Etsy store in 2012

    >Launching our online shop in May of 2014

    >Having almost 6K followers on Instagram , over 1K likes on FB, & 1K on Pinterest. 

    >Selling at flea markets & trunk shows

    >Being featured in Disfunkshion magazine with a full-page ad as well as a few features with our products in their photoshoots!  This is an awesome bohemian inspired mag that is sold at Barnes and Noble stores nation wide!

    >Our jewelry has been featured many times in photo-shoots with Disfunkshion!

    >Our jewelry has been sold at a few independent boutiques in different states. 

    Risks & Challenges

    We know we are taking a risk by taking the leap to open up our store, and it scares us a bit(maybe more than a bit)too, but we can let fear hold us back. "If your dream doesn't scare you, then it's not big enough"-Unknown. How can we get to where we really want to be if we don't try!?

    Our plan for solving our challenges ahead, such as not making enough sales to make rent, and not getting customers into our store is to constantly be proactive in our advertising! We will always be posting info and pictures on all of our social media accounts announcing new sales, inventory and when/where we will be having our trunk shows. We will do everything and anything to get our lovely customers into our shop! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help by making a donation, that's ok! We will love you anyway! Here are some other ways you can help:

    Please share our campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools & also share on any social media accounts! Follow us on Instgram, Twitter & Pinterest and Like our page on FB!

    As always, thank you so much! We love you! You are appreciated!

story:
Solar Energy is the best support we can start with.
So help sharing it and also build a solar powered offgrid Maker Space as a public place for "making" and "education" in africa.


With your support we could:

- build a new building as an earthbag structure
- buy tools and materials, like a 3D-printer,a computer, a soldering station, plywood, arduinos, LEDs, wires, solder-wire, screws&bolts and much more
- start a new public maker space in uganda
- give away some solar energy systems
- initialize an open-source support fund as OSWF

We as a community need to get together and give back to the Open Source Community and spread the maker movement by starting a new Movement:
The Open Source Energy movement:
Be part of it.


We recently anounced the "Open Source Energy Movement" and started the idea of the "Open Source World Foundation (OSWF)"

We thought a long time about this Movement and how to support the Open Source World.

As it turns the only wayto do that is that we as a community make a decision.


And while energy is key also to Open Source and the maker movement we want to spread open source energy concepts and products, meaning solar energy systems, especially to developing countries. To enable Maker Spaces where they are needed.

Find more information about the movement here:
Open Source Energy on G+:   Open Source Energy G+ page


If you like the idea and want to be part of this movement join and support us now!
Just make your decision.

We hope you will decide for Open Source and our Ideas and we appreciate every support, sharing this campaign with your friends on facebook or with your follower on twitter would also help.

Thanks a lot. :-)

Anyway you can follow us and our mission to see what we will do with the supported money, or get involved. Our website isn't launched yet but there is a G+ Profile and Community.

We are on G+: Open Source World G+ community
We are on G+: Open Source World Foundation G+ page
Open Source Energy on G+: Open Source Energy G+ page



Interested in more Details?



Campaign targets

- founding the “Open Source World Foundation” and build up a small fund to support Open Source projects and developer. Based on Community decisions the Fund will support Open Source projects and developer especially for Open Source Hardware.

- build up an offgrid maker space in africa

- developing a User friendly Open Source platform which will provide access to Open Source Soft- and especially Hardware and offers a free to donate option which will help support and accelerate Open Source Projects. To spread Open Source Hardware to non-tech users we will also provide access to professional and User manufactured Open Hardware via a small online shop.

- Of course develop and implement much more features in future

- Bring all the Open Source Projects to an Offline Web-Server for off-grid use

- develop an easy Arduino based DIY solar energy solution to give away in Uganda. This will be a complete and compact solution to power a whole house.

This will be a first production and completely open source. 


Extended Targets

- Will get decided by the community!

 (After the  target of this campaign reached, the rest of the supported money will go in the fund. If you have a project or you are a developer need support for building a prototype, prepare for a short inquiry for your project to get to the list. The user voting will decide which projects we will support with the fund.)


OSWF - Mission

As the maker movement gets where it is right now, and Open Source especially in hardware is spreading like never before. We, the community, will need to make sure to support the Open Source developer and projects. And we need to make a change now. Enable access for two third of humanity to the open-sorce world by spreading the maker-movement to developing countries


The OSWF Support Fund

The OSWF will be a non-profit oriented organization that will support the Open Source Movement to get a sustainable financial support and spread to developing countries.


OSWF Platform

  • Good Company, bad company directory
  • Project directory
  • Developer directory
  • Discussion Groups / Community directory
  • Community Features (feedback, rating, voting, surveys)
  • Support Fund (projects and developing)
  • Open Source Energy movement repository
  • Offline project repository for developing countries
Supporting Open Source developer to benefit while companies make profit with Open Source is the way it goes anyway and it’s good
But with a little change in the management driven by us, the whole world wide community, it would change everything.

More?

One more thing we are going to do is doing some projects of our own like we would at first spread the Open Source Maker Movement to Uganda by supporting our partner, a registered non-profit self-learning institute to build up a solar system, a school house and a workshop. And start spreading the idea of our Open Source Energy Movement we initialized some days ago.
So we will try to build up a sustainable eco-cycle for open-source support and development but also community projects to enable self-education as access to tools and knowledge. Everything Open Source.

If it gets even more money as needed to give away a lot of them we also will save some money to support other projects on the platform in future and by user voting’s and design competitions.


Perks

- Every supporter of this campaign will get a digital co-founder badge on his profile on our project platform and will get beta access to the platform. Of course we will have a web page listing all supporters .



Funding Target(s)

10.000,- EUR would help us to set our Development Ninja free from his student job for one year while developing the platform we need and more features we will add.

2.500,- EUR will cover some costs we would have for hosting and setting up a legal registered Foundation which is called “Genossenschaft” in Germany to make sure everything is legal and official. As we will need some money compensating the time we take free but need to pay for a living trying to realize this idea.

4.500,- EUR will be the indiegogo provision

The rest will get to the support fund which also will pay for the board production and shipping.


If we don't hit the target

We will try do it anyway and have very concrete plans on the extended goals as we work on that almost over 6 month right now, but without your support it will take like forever to get this running and not to mention to get people donating money for supporting those projects will take another forever.

While we targeted at 50.000,- EUR we also decided to make it a flexible campaign. We will build up the Foundation anyway but every EUR will help to do that and also help us start supporting as soon as possible.

If we do not hit the funding goal but have collected some money we will decide depending on the money you are willing to support what to do with it first, while we guarantee that your supported money will get to one or more Open Source projects.


We are on G+:   Open Source World G+ community

We are on G+:   Open Source World Foundation G+ page

Open Source Energy on G+:   Open Source Energy G+ page


Our website isn't launched yet but the Domain is allready registered:

story:
BE A REAL LIFE HERO 

(That is me...)

My name is Carlos (25 years old). In 2014 I traveled as a UNESCO volunteer to Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda (http://www.unesco.org/new/es). As a volunteer, I lived in Shining Star orphanages and met victims of HIV, drought, diseases and crossfire. On that trip I realized that my contribution as a volunteer was not about what I did during my stay there, it was about what could do after returning to my country. By gathering tools, finding opportunities and resources I realized that I could truly help the kids I met, and others in need on the other side of the world. I could raise awareness and make sure they are never forgotten and left behind.

I can no longer turn a blind eye on orphans in need of help in Kenya, Uganda and Sudan. I am determined to bring awareness and continue helping. 

That's why in November I started gathering money to build a Secondary school for Shining Star Orphanage in Muhuru bay Village in Kenya. With it I can support their education services and help them thrive. Shining Star Secondary School opened its door in February 2015 and today it has the highest numver of students in the region.There is still plenty of work to be done:  build latrines, buy desks, build beds, provide food, provide safe drinking water and provide mosquito nets. Kenya is a country threatened by HIV, poorness and drought, so every month Shining Star Orphanage  keep receiving more orphans ( on average 10) and we have the responsibility to accept them and provide basic nourishment. We are their only hope and we are determined to continue helping them thrive. 

          
(This is how it looked in November)

     (This is how it looked in January)                                               

    (This is how it looks today)

After finishing the Secondary school we will build a medical clinic (also in Muhuru Bay). Villages in rural Kenya are threatened by diseases such as malaria and diarrhea. They have no access to medical or education resources to help control and reduce these easily disease.

THE DECISION OF  A HERO

You can also be a Real Life Hero from home. You don't need to go to war or a to a volunteer mission. Take this chance and support Shining Star oprhapage rescue and continue helping orphans.  Don't turn a blind eye on these kids, please help raise awareness and donate to Shining Star. 

Currently only a few people that support this children. Thats why each month we need to choose from the list below the things that we can afford.

The money will be used to support the following:

 

1. Shining Star Orphanage (in Muhuru Bay, Kenya), which curently provides food, basic education services and a home to 300 orphans. Money will help the orphanage with the following: provide meals + clothes and support education services.

2. Childrens Village (in Nimule, Sudan) which curently provides food, basic education services and a home to 200 orphans. Money will help the orphanage with the following: provide meals + clothes and support education services.

3. Finish building Shining Star (the secondary)

4. Begin biolding a a medical clinic to treat Malaria in Muhuru Bay Village in Kenya.

.

(Discover more about our children at Shining Star )


 

BE A REAL LIFE HERO

Hero from home. You don't need to go to war or a to a volunteer mission. Take this
chance and support Shining Star oprhapage rescue and continue helping
orphans.  Don't turn a blind eye on these kids, please help raise
awareness and donate to Shining Star. 
Currently only a few
people that support this children. Thats why each month we need to choose from
the list below the things that we can afford.



The money will be used to support the following:



 
1. Shining Star
Orphanage (in Muhuru Bay, Kenya), which curently provides food, basic education services
and a home to 300 orphans. Money will help the orphanage with the following:
provide meals + clothes and support education services.
2. Childrens Village (in Nimule, Sudan) which curently provides food, basic education
services and a home to 200 orphans. Money will help the orphanage with the
following: provide meals + clothes and support education services.
3. Finish building
Shining Star (the secondary)
4. Begin biolding a a
medical clinic to treat Malaria in Muhuru Bay Village in Kenya.
.
(Discover more about our children at Shining Star )

 
BE A REAL LIFE HERO

story:
Hello!
My Name is Mike and I am the owner of The Vault Bicycle Shop. I am a forty year old father of one and have been happily married going on 15 years! I have been riding bicycles for 37 years both for competition and recreation. I have also been working in the bicycle industry for the past 10 years. I am a 2003 graduate of The United Bicycle Institute and I am a certified bicycle mechanic.  I do not just want to "pitch" a campaign as much as I want to tell you the ideas and passion behind what I am creating.

At The Vault Bicycle Shop, we are not interested in just selling you a bike, servicing your bike or just selling you a tube to replace your flat one. Simply stated...we are "bicycle crazy" and want to make sure you feel that effect when you are here and long after you leave.

Our Motto here at The Vault Bicycle Shop is to CREATE, INNOVATE, and INSPIRE! Cycling is such a positive, energetic freedom that most of us have felt early in life as children.  Remember the first time you rode you bike around the corner in your neighborhood out of the watchful eye of your parents and the feelings that came along with that? 
A lot of adults lose that feeling, and one of my greatest joys in this industry is helping them rediscover it.  Those of you that know me, know that I am crazy about bicycles...its not about how many I own, or what models they are....Its a feeling about everything related to a bicycle: The freedom, the fresh air, the escape of everyday stresses and clarity that you feel as you propel yourself away on the most noblest invention EVER!


Whether you are an avid cyclist with dreams to ride the Tour De France, A weekend warrior who likes to just pedal around the neighborhood or someone thinking of purchasing a bike to help rediscover one of your first childhood feelings of freedom. Let me and my "bicycle crazy staff" help you on your journey.

 Please understand when I tell you that your contributions are greatly appreciated and humbly accepted! Any amount helps. For every dollar that is contributed, gets us one dollar closer to achieving our dreams! The contributions will go toward helping to create a crazy bicycle atmosphere where anyone can come, relax with no pressure to buy something, sit down, talk about, or simply be...just inspired by bicycles.



We are trying to create something different in a bike shop environment, from the decor, old bikes on display, movie posters vintage books and magazines, memorabilia, and many different pieces of bicycle art.

Whether your an avid cyclist or not.... You WILL be inspired!

Contributions will help toward finishing our unique store sign and the costs of approvals and labor of installation, completion of decor, tools and equipment needed to have a top notch repair department, as well as business fixtures and displays.

Thank you for taking the time to read my campaign. I hope to cross paths with each and every one of you real soon. Until then...Enjoy the ride!
Mike

story:
Books N Things is an independent bookstore, which has occupied an historic building on the quaint Main Street of Norway, Maine, for almost 10 years. I own the building, as well as the business. In fact, I moved the business to its current location from a strip mall.

What We Need & What You Get

We have a roof that has been deteriorating over several years, and in the most recent rain storm, there was a significant leak into the Yoga Studio on the 3rd floor. Unfortunately, the roof is beyond repair, and needs to be completely replaced.

  • This building has been standing since the 1890s, and is on the National Register of Historic Properties. It was one of the few buildings to survive the Fire of 1894, which devastated most of Main Street.
  • The cost will be approximately $18,000, some of which I hope to raise through the business, but the total is completely beyond what the business can support.

The Impact

  • Books N Things has been one of the few constants in Norway's Downtown, which has slowly become more of a destination for shoppers, with a revitalized center. It's a privately owned business, with new and used books, newspapers, magazines, greeting cards, and quality toys. We're members of the American Bookseller's Association.
  • Your contribution will be supporting our 'buy-local' economy, with an emphasis on supporting local independent businesses, and the strong sense of community that we generate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please donate as much as possible to help us reach our goal, and share our plight with your friends and on social media. We could use all the help we can get!

story:
Information about shipping to other countries at the end of the text.

Kustom sunglasses are now available in the United States, allowing you the opportunity to match your sunglasses to each look or style.

Our product is simple to explain: We offer affordable, high quality sunglasses that you can design according to your own preference and taste. To get started click on our customizer. Here you can choose either a printed design (Kustom diseño) or solid color (Kustom color) for the frames. There are more than 1680 combinations possible, the real problem will be deciding how many to order!

Unfortunately, at this time our website is not fully navigable in English. However, we'd like you to understand that our Crowdfunding campaign is focused primarily on improving our shop features and media. A few examples of that would be text translation or multilingual website features.

We would like to be able to continue creating designs for you in the future. Eventually including those you send in & create yourselves.  In order to achieve this we need to buy new materials and machines. This is why we need your support.

Here we give you the closest translation for every reward we offer (Indiegogo does not provide any multilingual feature to their perk text). 

When purchasing your own sunglasses not only are you supporting a small local business but here are some of the immediate rewards for you! 

All our sunglasses meet the EC standards and we use UV400 protected lenses. 

Free sunglass case to protect your glasses

10% off on your next order

Shipping costs for United States are 13 € via certified mail. 

If you live in any other country and you’d like to get your Kustom sunglasses leave us a comment in this campaign. 

1. Choose your favorite reward

2. When the campaign finishes we’ll sent you a promo code for the whole price of the product you choose.

3. Go to our shop and create your own design 

4. Apply the promo code. You’ll only have to pay shipments cost.

5. That’s all! Enjoy your Kustom sunglasses

Kustom Easy: Pre Made, one colored glasses.

Kustom Color: Customize lenses, frame and arm with different colors.

Kustom Diseños: Customize lenses, frame and arm with textures and drawings.

Kustom News:  Sunglasses designed by inspiration from  newspapers.

Pack Arcoiris: 3 premade, one solid colored sunglasses (Black, Red and yellow)

Pack Kustom Equipo: Design your own official team sunglasses and get 10 of them. (Kustom color and diseños)

Pack Kustom Serigrafía: Print numbers, names or your team glasses. Same features as Kustom equipo.

Pack distribuidores: Are you interested in distributing our sunglasses? This pack includes 20 sunglasses with every design you want. Contact us for further information.


1. Almudena Sánchez Fernández, Subcampeona de Madrid y Subcampeona de España de Boxeo, 2014

2. Nácar, banda madrileña de Rock alternativo.

3.Angel y Yiannis

4.Viudas Negras


Unas gafas que peguen con tu estilo o tu ropa. A un precio asequible. Y por supuesto con lentes homologadas.  Llevar este producto al mercado es el objetivo de Gafas Kustom. 

En nuestra web puedes ver el abanico de personalizaciones para hacer tu diseño único. Pintamos cada parte de las gafas por separado y a mano para asegurar la calidad de cada envío.

Las  recompensas que ofrecemos  durante esta campaña son solo  una muestra de lo que podemos llegar a hacer. Nos gustaría ampliar el repertorio de personalizaciones y mejorar nuestra producción para ser capaces de hacer las gafas de sol que a ti te gustan al mejor precio.


Hemos aprendido a hacer las gafas que a ti te gustan, las hemos puesto en nuestra web, pero nos hace falta un pequeño empujón para empezar a producir de forma competitiva.

En la actualidad nos hacen falta 3.500 € para continuar comprando monturas, pintura y material para serigrafiar nuevos modelos, es decir, continuar con nuestra actividad. Si conseguimos sobrepasar esa meta, nos gustaría comprar nuevas máquinas para poder empezar a crear nuestros propios diseños de monturas e incorporar lentes polarizadas.

Durante la campaña de Crowdfunding puedes beneficiarte de precios especiales en todas nuestras gafas y nuevos modelos, además de una edición limitada.

El apoyo de la comunidad nos abre la puerta no solo de continuar con nuestra línea de gafas personalizadas, sino también de mejorar para conseguir modelos que encajen exactamente con el estilo de cada persona.

Durante esta campaña puedes conseguir unas gafas como a ti te gustan y a buen precio, pero ¿Por qué no seguir mejorando estas dos facetas? Nos gustaría que tener gafas de sol diferentes dependiendo del look que elijas  sea asequible para tu bolsillo.

Nuestro gran desafío es llegar lejos con esta campaña para que más personas alrededor del mundo empiecen a diseñar sus gafas.  Aunque somos de un pueblo de la Comunidad Valenciana, nos gustaría llegar a todo el público interesado en tener unas gafas únicas. Los países de habla hispana son nuestro primer objetivo para difundir nuestro proyecto.

Por este motivo necesitamos tu apoyo. Cualquier ayuda es bien recibida: puedes comentar la idea con tus amigos o interactuar con nuestra página de Facebook.  ¡Cuantos más seamos más lejos podremos llegar!

Si has leído hasta este punto ya has contribuido un poco a la difusión de este proyecto ¡Muchas gracias, nos encantaría conocer a más personas como tú!

Para comenzar elige tu recompensa a través de nuestro perfil de Indiegogo. Una vez que la campaña finalice, se alcance la meta o no, recibirás en tu email de contacto un cupón de descuento. Una vez que recibas el email simplemente tienes que ir a nuestra página web, elegir tu modelo y personalizarlo.

Cuando tengas tus gafas diseñadas, añádelas al carrito, en esta nueva pantalla tendrás la opción de poner tu cupón de descuento. Introduce el código y continúa con el proceso de compra ¡No queda nada! Para terminar pon tus datos de envío, facturación e indicaciones especiales si las necesitas, por último paga los costes de envío y acepta, en las próximas semanas recibirás tus gafas Kustom

story:
Update: YOU DID IT! 

We are absolutely thrilled to share this very exciting news with you: we have reached our goal and raised the funds needed to open our 1st stationary clinic in Guatemala!

Thanks to the generosity of 70 contributors to our Indiegogo campaign, numerous mail donations we received and hundreds of social media shares, we raised over $35,000, which was matched by one of our long-time donors. We look forward to seeing you in Antigua so you can see for yourself the impact your support has made! 

Thank you. We couldn't have done it without you!
Your support will change lives.


Why Guatemalan mothers need your help?

Guatemala struggles with exceptionally high levels of inequality and poverty. The fertility rate of 3.8 children per woman (4.6 in indigenous communities) is the highest in Latin America and the Caribbean. 75% of the indigenous population lives in poverty, which means they survive on less than $2 a day. 

Maternal and infant death, teenage pregnancy, chronic malnutrition and gender inequality rates in Guatemala are extremely alarming and among the highest in the world. 

Even though Guatemalan women report their ideal number of children to be 2 and many wish to delay or space their pregnancies, poor access to health services and information means they have more children than they can provide for, are unable to finish primary school, and face serious health risks. You can help us change this!

Our work

Since 2001, WINGS has worked directly with marginalized and indigenous communities, offering mobile clinics and providing reproductive health education and services, to give women the tools they need to have control of their lives and to make conscience decisions about their future. 

 

We are now raising funds to establish our first permanent clinic in Antigua Guatemala, which will offer family planning information, contraceptive methods, and cervical cancer screening and treatment.

Make a contribution in the name of a special mother you'd like to honor and help us build the clinic to change Guatemalan mother's lives!


Double your impact! 

Help 2x as many mothers with a single donation!

We are very excited to share this incredibly generous offer from one of our long-time donors: every donation you make will be matched up to the amount of $35,000! This means that no matter what contribution you make, your impact will be doubled! 

Check the "Perks" section to see the difference your contribution will make.

The Impact

We're expecting to provide a total of 1,436 patients with a variety of services in the first year of the operation of the stationary clinic in Antigua.


Visit us in Guatemala and meet the mothers whose lives you're changing!

Independently of the amount of contribution you make, we are inviting you to visit our clinic in Guatemala and see the impact you're making for yourself!

For those donate who $1,000 or more, we would like to take you on a trip to Sololá to meet our voluntary promoters and learn about their work in the communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word! Share this page on Facebook and Twitter and spread the word to your friends, colleagues, communities, and families to help ensure this campaign is a success.
Write about the campaign. Are you a blogger/journalist/writer? Can you help by featuring our campaign? 
Host a fundraising event. Host a screening of our documentary film or run an event that will raise funds and spread the word about our work! 
Subscribe to our mailing list to receive news from WINGS right into your inbox.
Contact Anna at azatonow@wingsguate.org with any questions, read more about WINGS here: www.wingsguate.org.
