story:
We are Naked Indiana. Our mission is to serve our community by using food and art to connect us to our bodies, our Earth and each other. We are launching our latest project :

Native Kitchen & Bar 

A restaurant, wine bar, bakery, event space and community hub in the Blue Mountains (Lawson) - Designed to facilitate sustainable consumption, generate environmental awareness and encourage genuine community connection. Our plans are in place but we need your help - please read our story and the way we think about food!

NOTE***
ALL DONATORS WILL BE INVITED TO OUR PRE OPENING PARTY - EXCLUSIVE ONLY TO CAMPAIGN DONERS. WOOD FIRED FOOD, BEER ON TAP, AND ENTERTAINMENT (KID FRIENDLY). IN ADDED APPRECIATION FOR YOU SUPPORT WE WANT TO MAKE YOU KNOW HOW SPECIAL WE ARE




WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE ARE ABOUT

Native Kitchen & Bar is the latest project from Rebecca and Frank at Naked Indiana, an emerging social-enterprise that promotes organic farming and sustainable urban lifestyles in Australia.

Naked Indiana emerged from our passion for food, our love for the earth, and our enquiry into the processes that connect us to our planet through how and what we consume. More of our story here: www.nakedindiana.com.au/aboutus

We have explored cultivating more nourishing relationships with our bodies, our earth and each other, through food and art, in a variety of small-scale projects (more details below) - culminating in :

         Native Kitchen & Bar                             www.nativekitchenandbar.com

A restaurant and dynamic community space in Lawson, the Blue Mountains, serving a delicious, all-Australian, organically grown menu which is:

  • Kind to the earth
  • Nourishing to our bodies
  • Fair to our farmers
  • Community focused

OUR MENU is in constant creation as we flow with local farmers' crops. Our priority is to create a regional palate true to the Blue Mountains: fresh, flavoursome and organic. Enjoy our long grazing menu, quick take aways, fermentation bar - full of living foods, and the sourdough bakery (using wild bush fermentation, Leura spring water, and freshly milled organic grain). Our drinks menu is similarly unique with slow extraction juices, kombucha on-tap, boutique Australian wines, beers and spirits, a unique cocktail list, and quality coffee.
  • Local and organically grown 
  • Highlights Native Australian ingredients
  • Fermentation bar - the natural art of preservation
  • Boutique & batched brewed all Australian liquor
  • In house batch milled organic sourdough 
THE SPACE is carefully designed to facilitate community, connection and conversation, and will be used to run creative events aimed at generating environmental awareness and genuine social connection.

Native Kitchen & Bar will embody our enthusiasm for food, people and sustainable agriculture. We are committed to our planet and our community - so please come share in great food, new ideas, and a sustainable future - with creativity and community at its heart.

"Life is a series of choices. Three times a day we make a choice of what to eat, that’s already our ritual. If we can change the way we approach food then we can change the way someone interacts with the world three times a day."          - Frank Meura

WHY SUPPORT? 

Discourse around environmental issues has become as heated as our climate! The information is often overwhelming, and it is easy to feel powerless and paralysed. Our belief is that though food and community we can make meaningful, immediate and pragmatic shifts towards a sustainable future.

Our mission is to serve our community by:

  • Supporting, and encouraging individuals as they embrace sustainable alternatives, what seems insignificant can have enormous effects.
  • Facilitate an immediate and personal relationship between farm and consumer.
  • Cultivating a sense of community that encourages genuine connection, sharing of resources, and collective action.
  • Generating momentum and support for other community and environmental initiatives

THE COMMUNITY INITIATIVES OF NATIVE KITCHEN: 

OPEN OVEN
As part of an ongoing commitment to our community - we will open our commercial oven to our community fortnightly to allow an opportunity for home bakers to try out their loaves in a professional baking oven.

To empower our community and encourage an attitude of generosity - we encourage locals to develop the cooking skills and share them.

The service would be free with a  $2 donation to feeding the homeless.

FARM SPONSORSHIP & TRAINEESHIPS                                                                  We are hands on with our farmers and suppliers. Learning their passions and their struggles has helped us to better understand our role, as restauranteurs, within the supply chain, and to support sustainable agriculture as a whole.

Native Kitchen & Bar will help communicate and strengthen these relationships by facilitating 

  • on site excursions
  • farm stays
  • harvest events
  • farmer interships
  • fundraisers for farmers in need

We will be working intimately with Aaron Brocken of Hawkesbury Hampers. Aaron has made it his mission to change the argricultural face of the Blue Mountains/ Hawkesbury region transitioning under-utilised and or conventional spaces into thriving organic market farms. 

Linking with Aaron to support these efforts Native Kitchen & Bar will offer its staff the opportunity to do a paid apprenticeship on the farm under Aaron, learning the ins and outs of organic agriculture and sustainability, whilst growing crops for the restaurant.  

Our vision with Aaron is to see the Blue Mountains/Hawkesbury showcase how a true, sustainable network can support a growing Sydney Metropolitan population.


COOKING WORKSHOPS 
Sustainable food supply is important - but the community needs to know how to cook it. We need to readdress the way we, as a culture, approach food. In monthly workshop events we will cover topics such as: How to eat seasonally, resourceful fermentation, and creative cooking.

ARTS & CULTURE
There is no better way to communicate an idea, inspire change or simply trigger innovative thought than through art. Native Kitchen and Bar will serve as a pop up gallery space, open mic and live drawing venue for local and visiting artists who have nature & community at the heart of their work. 

WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO?

We have secured our location and have commenced fit out, we will be opening this coming Christmas Eve (24/12/2015). We are appealing to you to assist us in funding the completion of the fit-out and our in-house, small-scale commercial bakery.

FIRST 
$25 000 Shop Fit Out - Firnishings 

  • sustainable outdoor furnishings by local craftsman
  • Sustainable Australian made earthen ware by Vaughn Baker
  • Industrial Bongard spiral dough mixer, we would like upgrade to a 45 L
  • up-cycled carpentry by local artist
  • botanical sculptural installation by local artist
NEXT                                                                                                                                                      $5 000
  • Resurrect the decapitated green house on our rental property to its former glory so we can grow all our own organic an heirloom seedlings and establish our commercial composting system for the restaurant

NEXT
$4 000

  • Support the launch of our traineeship program with Aaron Brocken to establish productive organic farming and educational facilities to support local agriculture
NEXT
$45 000

  • 'Miwe' three deck steam hood baking oven. A heavy duty backing oven that allows for optimal conrol, steam injection and heat retention.
  • Sigma Laminator
  • Bongard prover retarder, single tray
( the baking equipments costs exceeds $100 000, we are seeking funds to embark on a rent-to-buy contract)
ADDITIONAL FUNDS...
.. If you believe in what we are doing and want to continue to donate funds these will go directly into our kitty to establish our agriculture programmes based in education and resource support.  Our a vision to create harvest events and farmer support programmes predominately need a budget for coordinating, advertisement and contingency management.


WANT TO KNOW MORE?? …. TAKE A CLOSER LOOK 

OUR SOURDOUGH CULTURE                                                                                     Our sourdough culture was created just over a year ago, in the bush of Wentworth Falls, Blue Mountains. For three days the freshly milled rye mixed with local Leura spring water sat to ferment under the Eucalyptus trees picking up the unique nuances of our native bush land and, most importantly, its life giving yeasts. From then on we fed this starter making each loaf with these two pure ingredients: Leura spring water and freshly milled grain. 

When we create breads from our starter we often add native ingredients like bush tomato, pepper berry and salt bush, hand harvested pink river salt & activated cultures like kombucha, yoghurt, fermented veggies & fermented grain.

When we open Native Kitchen & Bar all our sourdough offerings will be baked in a wood-fired oven, that we built ourselves out of mud brick.



Our repertoire will include:

  • 100 % freshly milled grain sourdough loaves
    50 / 50  - rye / whole grain white & spelt loaves

  • Kombucha sourdough on a rotating recipe

  • Sourdough focaccia with native spices

  • Organic sprouted sourdough loaves

  • In-house cakes

  • Native wattle & bush honey granola.

With enough support we would love to expand to create:

  • 100% sourdough ciabatta & ficelle

  • Sourdough croissants

  • Sourdough puff pastry

  • Sourdough pies


GROWING TO ORDER - A NEW SYSTEM                                                                  Over the last few years we have been networking our suppliers on a grassroots level. We value these relationships dearly as they are paramount in delivering an authentic farm to plate service, and attaining a more sustainable food future. At Native Kitchen & Bar we have the very unique opportunity to work side by side local organic farms, who are pioneers in sustainable farming and like-minded visionaries for our agricultural future. Our farming partners have made themselves available to grow much of our menu to order, a concept that enriches the farmer and chef relationship and which is vital when it comes to understanding how to achieve a sustainable food system on a commercial level.


WHO WE ARE & PAST PROJECTS

Rebecca is a chef with a variety of experience. As head chef of popular Sydney cafe Revolver (2009 - 2012) Rebecca was struck by the sense of confusion that her customers, and the wider public, felt in relation to food and health. Leaving the cafe Rebecca studied naturopathy and nutrition and in doing so discovered her passion for using food to heal our bodies, connect us to the larger ecology of nature, and encourage mindfulness in how we consume. With Frank, she designed the unique and memorable menus at their Surry Hills pop-up Naked Indiana, with it’s emphasis on raw-food, and Little Indi, the closed system cafe in Alexandria. Rebecca cooks from the heart, and her enthusiasm, commitment and playfulness manifest in her creations.

Frank is a fine-artist and industrial/product designer. He has a depth of experience in hospitality as a barista, bartender, chef and cafe’ owner. Frank approaches food, drink, coffee and service with the unique passion and insight of an artist. He is always creating. His innovative approach to all things is balanced by an appreciation of tradition - especially that of his Italian ancestors and their approach to food. The previous manifestations of Native Indiana have embodied Frank’s journey as an artist in their construction - seeking to relate with kindness and integrity towards people, the Earth and it’s resources - full of raw, recycled timber, organic lines, and communal spaces. For Little Indi Frank designed an innovative in-house composting system that allowed for the cafe to be zero-waste.

Our daughter Saskia is currently 1 year old. She is brave, cheeky, joyful and full of love. She is our inspiration. We want her to inherit a healthy, kind, fair and sustainable future.

More of our story here: www.nakedindiana.com.au/aboutus


PAST PROJECTS

Naked Indiana – Surry Hills pop up Dec 2013 – March 2014

A simple raw-vegan menu. Designed to offer time and space for positive discussion with strangers around a communal table settings.

Review : http://www.broadsheet.com.au/sydney/food-and-dr...

Little Indi – Alexandria pop up Nov 2013 – Feb 2014 

A closed-looped café. We composted and recycled 100% of our waste in-house. We served a simple deli styled menu showcasing ingredients from Australian providers and offered all these products for take home.  This concept was greatly inspired by Julia Butterfly Hill and her contemplations on throwing things away, as in truth, "where is away?"

Review : http://www.broadsheet.com.au/sydney/food-and-dr...

Orgbox 2012 – current - starting as a back yard project in 2012 we now are officially re-launching Orgbox with Native Kitchen as its HQ. Orgbox is a community box share where we pack seasonal, organic and predominately local fruit and veggies. With Orgbox we strive to offer support to expand  our communities knowledge and appreciation for food, as well as our local organic economy. We also offer a variety of picnic hampers that can be delivered to your door (Australia wide) or picked up from Native Kitchen.

www.orgbox.net.au

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to from ASHEs Peer Support Network. We are a new organization that is working to expand mental health peer support within Texas. We hope to work to Advocate for improved mental health care, Support those living with and caring for someone else who deals with mental health issues, inspire Hope that things can get better, and Educate our communities about who we are and how we can contribute to society. We will have a lot of projects in the near future as we work to get this organization off the ground, establish a legal non-profit status, and build a support network for our cause. 

This is the beginning of great things in the way of changing and advancing mental health for Texans. We have many goals and a strong vision. We aim to become an independent non-profit so that we can establish a peer support warmline number for after-hours support. This warmline is not meant to replace the crisis hotlines or traditional mental health services, but supplement them for when individuals facing difficulties need additional help and support but can't access it due to being outside normal office hours. We are hoping to get this up and running in a timely manner, but we have a lot of steps to accomplish before we can get the warmline up and running. Please share this page with others to help spread our message of advocacy, support, hope, and education for mental health and psychiatric issues.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to form a non-profit organization.  This includes:

* Finding and retaining a lawyer to assist in the legalities involved in starting this type of organization including filing the federal tax paperwork for 501 status.  

* Networking.  We are located in a smaller town in Deep East Texas and a lot of the advocacy and action is in Austin, the state capital.  We need to be able to afford travel to and from Austin to be able to network with other, larger, organizations, find partners to assist us in our mission, and speak with legislatures to impress the importance of our project and overall goal to create the warmline.

*Advertising. We need to get the word out!  This will include getting a domain name purchased and a new website professionally developed and maintained, among other forms of advertising.

The Impact

I am both an individual with a diagnosis and a professional in the mental health field.  As both a client and a provider, I have noticed that mental health does not fall into black and white definitions.  There isn't just stable and in crisis. There is a grey area, an in between, an area of distress if you will.  Our ultimate goal is to establish a toll-free "warmline" to offer peer-guided support and resources to help move an individual out of distress and to help prevent them from going into a mental health crisis situation.  This warmline will be staffed with individuals with a mental health diagnosis, experience with treatment, and considered in recovery who are comfortable sharing their personal stories.  They will be supervised by Certified Peer Specialists who are trained in mental health recovery.

The impact that we hope to see is an increase in knowledge about the importance of taking care of one's mental health needs, offer support and guidance to others, and share our stories to help prevent crisis situations from happening or provide needed intervention should a crisis occur.

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of risks.  This will be a large and expensive venture.  There is a lot of funding needed for this, and this campaign is the first step.  The primary risk is not being able to get the support we need to reach our overall goal, but that risk is worth it if we can help stir up the conversation about mental health.

If We Go Over Our Goal

Any additional funding we receiver will be set aside and used for the actual structuring of the warmline - physical location, phone lines, database software, recruiting and training staff and phone supporters, and expanding our original idea from telephone support to online chat support and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, spread the word about this.  Mental health is very important to everyone, not just those with a diagnosis, and those with a diagnosis need to know that they are NOT alone.  Share this campaign and its associated facebook page with others on social media.  Help us start a conversation about mental health.  Let's stop hiding from what is right in front of us.  We all have brains and we need to learn how to take care of them.

http://www.facebook.com/fromashespeers

    Risks & Challenges There are a lot of risks.  This will be a large and expensive venture.  There is a lot of funding needed for this, and this campaign is the first step.  The primary risk is not being able to get the support we need to reach our overall goal, but that risk is worth it if we can help stir up the conversation about mental health.

If We Go Over Our GoalAny additional funding we receiver will be set aside and used for the actual structuring of the warmline - physical location, phone lines, database software, recruiting and training staff and phone supporters, and expanding our original idea from telephone support to online chat support and more.
    Other Ways You Can Help Please, spread the word about this.  Mental health is very important to everyone, not just those with a diagnosis, and those with a diagnosis need to know that they are NOT alone.  Share this campaign and its associated facebook page with others on social media.  Help us start a conversation about mental health.  Let's stop hiding from what is right in front of us.  We all have brains and we need to learn how to take care of them.
http://www.facebook.com/fromashespeers

story:
About this campaign

"I'm here to bring connection, creation, inspiration and beauty to the world. That is who I am. Sometimes in life we're given a rare opportunity to expand ourselves in a way that is far beyond our imagination. It's a culmination of all of our dreams. This is one of those times." - Ele Keats

Hello and thank you for visiting our campaign. My name is Ele Keats. I am an actress and jewelry designer.  My original jewelry shop was a small pop-up and we had a wonderful successful business that we so loved. After over a year in our 100 sq. ft. space we felt the need to expand and create something bigger and create more opportunities for the community. By expanding into a space over 10 times our original shop we will be able to include other artists work and more. I will be offering designers a place to showcase their work as well as introducing the community to fulfilling workshops.

This will be a new space that will provide opportunities to learn from prolific teachers, yoga, good health, exploring love, and connecting to yourself and others. We all need a place to land feel ourselves fully and just breathe! I am opening my shop to be just that.

My dream of this new space is that it will be a place to connect to yourself, a place to unwind, breathe, ground, transform, and inspire. A place where you know you are safe and supported and you can spread you wings and find yourself and be yourself.

This new space is a huge gift and that is why I decided to launch this campaign - so we can all share in the fun and celebration of this together! I'm inviting you to be a part of it. If you feel moved to help create this new space and provide growth opportunities for the community please consider a contribution. We have some great incentives to show our gratitude, too! 

Our funding goal

We need funding to completely remodel the space, to provide scholarships for the workshops that we present, and to bring in teachers.  We need a total of $45,000 to achieve our total goal for this space. $30,000 for remodeling the empty, raw space; $10,000 for teachers fees; and $5,000 for scholarship funding. We will use what fund we do raise to do the work we need to open up and offer a great new place to grow! We have many levels of contributions and great perks for each level!

Planned workshops at Ele Keats Lifestyle

Here are some of the workshops we already have planned for the new space:

• Mediation workshop : meet yourself inside and find the peace you have always sought. On going class in deepen your inner experience

• Yoga class opening and awakening your body We will on goingly have classes with some of the best teachers from around the world offering classes and workshops exploring all realms of yoga 

• Dream workshop what dreams may come and how your dreams are gifting you messages

• Sacred space workshop-Creating your personal mediation space and alter

• Nourishment healthy cooking — step by step way nourish yourself from breakfast to dinner

• Book launch workshop with life coach and mindfulness meditation teacher Ora for her new  Book

• Crystal workshop with world renowned crystal expert Judy Hall Author of the Crystal Bible

• Creating a clutter free life steps to simplifying and creating space in your life and world

• Unlocking your Voice - Dive into your dreams of singing and writing music an uplifting workshop the will open your heart and having you singing freely find your Voice

• Sacred sexuality-delving deepening into your sacred self deeping you connection to your partner

• The work of Byron Katie - A simple way to create inner and outer peace

• Animal Communication Workshop Turning in to the gifts of our pets and the creatures who share the world with us

• Gardens Alive! Create your own food forest 

• Attune to the Moon: a Workshop about living a life in balance with the phases of the moon

• Healing workshop with Howard Wills releasing the conconcious beliefs and family linage and re-receive your health

• Sensual movement for women exploring and celebrating your feminity and curves

• Love, Sex and Making Magic In Relationships Completely transform your experience of authentic Love  with Bryan Reeves

• Tea as a meditation workshop explore the medicinal spiritual life changing language of tea.

• Present moment How to stay grounded and awake in a world or distractions

• Prayer : Authentically connecting to your higher guidance

• Living the life of your dreams: Create your world to match your greatest dreams with ease and grace

• Letting Go: A heart Healing workshop how to release and move on when its time to say goodbye

• Sleep workshop: setting yourself up for restful nights

• Practical Health keys to taking care of yourself from the inside out

• Aromatherapy Workshop with Botanical Master Persephanie 

• Ancient Rosery Beads Craft workshop … Learn how to in the rare opportuninty to make them with  Persephanie

...And much more planned!

Contribute and get great perks!

I'm offering some fantastic incentives including jewelry and crystals which you can check out below but we're also have two really unique experiences at the higher contribution levels.

The highest level incentive is that I'll be taking you on a special journey. We'll fly you to LA, put you up in a beautiful hotel and we will  design a day uniquely for you... a day of love. And I will personally take you on an experience of nurturing yourself from the inside out.

The second incentive is a love workshop - this is going to be a heart expanding day full of inspiration in a small intimate group setting. There will  be lots of surprises and you will get to connect with amazing like minded people in this workshop.

Other ways you can help

Even if you are unable to make a contribution at this time or decide not to contribute for whatever reason, we would still love your help getting the word out about this campaign to your friends and others in the community. You can share on facebook, twitter, and with Indiegogo.

Thank you for your time.

Ele

story:
Short Summary

My name is Paula Cranmer-Underhill, and I am 'Namgis and Nlaka'pamux.  My grandfather Raymond Thom left me our family farm, which has been resting for around 60 years now...it has a heritage orchard and beautiful setting, with good water nearby.

Funds raised will help get the farm restarted.  It needs much work...to become the healing destination it will be known for.  We will grow food in a good way that is gentle on the Earth using good farming methods and modern technology for sustainability of the land and water resources.  We will create abundance with a strong social outlook, and will Potlatch with each harvest to others who need nutritious food to fuel a healthy life. 

Tools, irrigation equipment, seedlings, seeds, and prep of 2 - 1 acre gardens, leasehold improvements, well, staff HR costs (plant, weed, harvest) CSA boxes inventory, hydro and water hookups, wind dry (salmon), canning areas (veggies and fruit) and root cellar will be supported by this Fundraising.

Perks will vary based on levels: A listing on the Living Legends page of Spapium 'Little Prairie' Farm media pages; invitation to a Feast at the Farm; Gift Certificate for fresh produce, jams or tea - redeemable at Farmers Markets SLPF attends; Sponsors of preserving areas will have a specially designed plaque.

All funds raised will be put to use in the farm start up and any amount is very welcomed and will give lenders a reduced risk with higher potential for any shortfall loan approvals at the end of this campaign.

Please help in any way...promote to those interested in food security, building agriculture communities, and assisting rural/ Indigenous farmers get back on the land.  We have the potential to be leaders.  Please join the team.

story:
What were you doing at the age of 12?

At the age of 12 Ashleigh wrote a letter to an organization that offers dolphin therapy after reading an article in a magazine on behalf of her friend who had been diagnosed with San Filipo disease and asked for the chance for her friend to swim with dolphins. This is just one example of what an exceptionally giving, caring, and passionate person Ashleigh was. Each year after that, she created her own jewelry and sold it in order to fund a child every year to go to Florida and swim therapeutically with the dolphins as well as to donate to local and national charities.


In October of 2004, at the age of 17, Ashleigh Delia Woodfield died suddenly in a car accident and every year since then her family has maintained this Memorial Foundation and Scholarship fund. Although she isn't with us anymore, we want to carry on her tradition of living and loving selflessly, constantly succeeding in making the world a better place, and touching as many lives as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

We continually appreciate any donations - this is a 60 day campaign but the Foundation is continually accepting donations in order to annually meet our goals.

It has been 10 years since her passing and we are asking for donations of $10 (of course, we won't say no to more if you'd like!!!) within the next 60 days.

It costs about $2,200 for the unique opportunity for each child to go to Florida and swim with the dolphins. Our goal is to send one child with the funds we earn in the next 60 days (and every year after) and hopefully, if we are able to raise additional funds, we will be donating to charities that Ashleigh was passionate about.

For your donation, we would like to say thank you in a way Ashleigh would. Check out the perks section to see what we're offering! Items from homemade jewelry to cards with her artwork to poster size prints of her artwork as well as artwork of her friends and family.

The Impact

Not only will your donation support Ashleigh's cause but it will help us keep a part of her here with us. It isn't about the quantity of years in a life, but the quality - and for those who didn't know her she was an angel on earth.

Help us maintain the tradition of providing high school juniors with scholarships to help them go to college, sending sick children to therapeutic dolphin therapy, and donating to important causes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Share this link and/or the link to the Memorial Foundation page on your social media. If you knew Ashleigh, share the moments that you spent with her. There is a testimonial page on our website (see link below) where we ask you to share these stories with the world.

Click here to visit our Foundation Page

story:
Sowing the seeds of the story…

On January 10, 2015 Massey Creek Farms lost their barn to a fire. Besides the building itself, the blaze also claimed the lives of four Karakachan pups and their mother, Markey, Garland’s beloved livestock guard dogs. As a customer and friend of Garland McCollum, owner of Massey Creek Farms, I raise the call to supporters of local, sustainable family farms and the food they grow. Let’s rebuild a barn! 

We’ve got a tough row to hoe…

We need: $25,000.  This will cover all materials needed to rebuild as well as expenses, such as electricians and carpenters that may be unable to donate their time. The barn will be designed to house orphaned baby livestock as well as Karakachan puppies—adorably fluffy guard-dogs-in-training.

Reap what we sow…

Garland started out as a commercial farmer, and has seen what devastation overcrowding of farm animals can wreak. As a result, 6years ago, he quite literally opened the stalls and reformed his entire philosophy of farming. Massey Creek now proudly prioritizes sustainability and pasture raised livestock, home to pasture raised chickens, sheep, pigs, and turkeys living large under the shining sun. Garland maintains his livestock on a strict NO, NO, NO model of: No Antibiotics, No Animal By-products, and No Added Hormones.  All his efforts are aimed at leaving our little part of the world better for us having been here, so generations to come will enjoy the products of this resource we humbly call home. Contribute to this proud tradition of small sustainable farming by Raising the Barn from the Ashes!

story:
One Idea Can Change The World

Thinkified is what you need if you're the kind of person that has ideas all the time but never writes them down and forgets them, or worse yet, never does anything with them.

We believe that one idea can change the world, but that many of the best ideas have been lost a few moments after they were thought up because they were never written down.

Thinkified's purpose is to capture your ideas, and create an environment where those ideas can be stored, worked on, and made into real-world projects.


We Need Your Help

Thinkified will store your ideas privately in a secure place for your eyes only. It will also allow you to free your ideas into the world if you're not planning on doing anything with them. 

Thinkified will be free to use because we believe that ideas should be free and that an open exchange of thoughts makes the world a better place. Everyone should be allowed to think, dream, and share their ideas.

So far, we have invested more than a year's worth of time and over $50,000 on research, development, and programming of the current Alpha version.

Now, we're asking for your help so we can hire additional staff and pay for servers that can handle the influx of ideas and keep them safe for their Thinkers.

Our goal is $50,000 which will help us complete the project within the year.  If we don't reach our goal, we will use the money in exactly the same way; to keep the project going as long as possible until we can personally raise the resources to finish it.

Thinkified is happening.  We will not give up on it no matter how long it takes, and we hope you are as excited as we are and want to help us make it happen sooner rather than later.


Platforms

We want Thinkified to be as universally available as pen and paper, which is why we want to release Thinkified on as many platforms as possible. We will launch on iOS first, followed by Android, and then continue to go where the Thinkers are including WatchOS, WindowsPhone, Google Glass... BlackBerry? Sure, why not?

We're also building a web-based application which will launch just a few short months after the Android version is released. The web-app will give Thinkers  access to more advanced editing capabilities and options for managing their stored ideas.


Development & Timeline

We plan to launch the iOS version of Thinkified 3 months after this campaign ends. We will begin development of the Android version right after the iOS version is released and publish it to Google Play 2 to 3 months later. 

6 months after of reaching our goal, Thinkified will be accessible on 500 million iOS devices, 1 billion Android devices, and every computer with an internet connection on earth. 


Our Founders

Will Royall is the thought leader and CEO at Thinkified.  Will Royall's intensive background in marketing, advertising, and internet technology, coupled with his successful business ventures has led Will to want to create the app that helps connect like-minded Thinkers and entrepreneurs.  

Will started Royall Advertising in 2004, a successful Orlando and New York based advertising agency, an ecommerce firm Factory Bunk Beds that has done more than $40,000,000 in revenues, a 30,000 person music festival in Oklahoma called Backwoods Music Festival, and even a computer repair company Nerdy Repair.  His time tested and proven experience leading start-ups to success has helped to create Thinkified as a platform that gives entrepreneurs what they need most, the ability to connect with the right people they need to get things done.


Shaun Whalen is the lead designer for the Thinkified brand and all things UI/UX. He started using Photoshop as a kid when version 3 came out in 1996. Not CS3, that came out 11 years later! He's been using Photoshop pretty much every day ever since. Shaun thinks of himself as a pioneer of online culture because he spent so much time in IRC chat-rooms after he got his 386sx box with a 14.4bps modem. 

After graduating from Stetson University's Digital Arts program, he joined Will at Royall Advertising where he quickly became the Creative Director and managed every kind of project from ad campaigns to development of multi-million dollar e-commerce websites. Shaun strongly believes that the internet is the greatest achievement in human history and that ideas really do change the world.


Vikram Singh is Thinkified's lead developer and has coded every bit of the application so far.  Vikram's background includes 10 years experience as a code guru with degrees from Barkatullah University and Rajasthan University.

Vikram has worked with both Royall Advertising and Factory Bunk Beds for several years, which sparked the relationship with both Will and Shaun to pursue Thinkified together.  In Vikram's spare time he enjoys spending time with his family and church.   


Become a Founding Thinker

We believe in history and giving credit where credit is due. Everyone that gets involved in this initial round of funding is going to be remembered forever as a Founding Thinker.

As Founding Thinkers, you will get early access to Thinkified, along with various perks from t-shirts to a commemorative plaques, all the way up to your name in the app credits. 

We printed a few t-shirts and they turned out great!



We Will Be Idea Care-Takers

We want to launch Thinkified as soon as possible but the biggest challenge for us has been getting the app to work as well as perfectly as it needs to. Ideas are precious, and we have to make sure that Thinkified is as stable as possible in order to keep your brain-children safe.

We have the know-how, between all of our founders, we've built hundreds of websites which handle hundreds of millions of dollars in sales each year, but we need to hire some additional programming help to get Thinkified launched as soon as possible.

That's where you come in! All money that comes in to help us reach our goal will be used to expand our team and infrastructure, and get the app launched as soon as we can.


Please Spread The Word

If you are a creative person and have ideas all the time, we know that you understand what Thinkified is really for. If you know someone who is has a vivid imagination, tell them about Thinkified, they will appreciate it. 

  • Share this IndieGoGo Campaign.
  • Share our video on Facebook or Twitter
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, or Instagram 
  • Sign-up for our email newsletter (The signup form is on Thinkified.com)
  • Tell your friends about Thinkified

Help us build a community of creative, engaged, and ambitious people. A community of Thinkers.


"The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter - for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way."

- Nikola Tesla



One Idea Can Change The World. Join Us.

6 months after of reaching our goal, Thinkified will be accessible on 500 million iOS devices, 1 billion Android devices, and every computer with an internet connection on earth.

Will Royall is the thought leader and CEO at Thinkified.  Will Royall's intensive background in marketing, advertising, and internet technology, coupled with his successful business ventures has led Will to want to create the app that helps connect like-minded Thinkers and entrepreneurs.  
Will started Royall Advertising in 2004, a successful Orlando and New York based advertising agency, an ecommerce firm Factory Bunk Beds that has done more than $40,000,000 in revenues, a 30,000 person music festival in Oklahoma called Backwoods Music Festival, and even a computer repair company Nerdy Repair.  His time tested and proven experience leading start-ups to success has helped to create Thinkified as a platform that gives entrepreneurs what they need most, the ability to connect with the right people they need to get things done.

Shaun Whalen is the lead designer for the Thinkified brand and all things UI/UX. He started using Photoshop as a kid when version 3 came out in 1996. Not CS3, that came out 11 years later! He's been using Photoshop pretty much every day ever since. Shaun thinks of himself as a pioneer of online culture because he spent so much time in IRC chat-rooms after he got his 386sx box with a 14.4bps modem. 
After graduating from Stetson University's Digital Arts program, he joined Will at Royall Advertising where he quickly became the Creative Director and managed every kind of project from ad campaigns to development of multi-million dollar e-commerce websites. Shaun strongly believes that the internet is the greatest achievement in human history and that ideas really do change the world.

Vikram Singh is Thinkified's lead developer and has coded every bit of the application so far.  Vikram's background includes 10 years experience as a code guru with degrees from Barkatullah University and Rajasthan University.
Vikram has worked with both Royall Advertising and Factory Bunk Beds for several years, which sparked the relationship with both Will and Shaun to pursue Thinkified together.  In Vikram's spare time he enjoys spending time with his family and church.   


Become a Founding Thinker
We believe in history and giving credit where credit is due. Everyone that gets involved in this initial round of funding is going to be remembered forever as a Founding Thinker.
As Founding Thinkers, you will get early access to Thinkified, along with various perks from t-shirts to a commemorative plaques, all the way up to your name in the app credits. 


We printed a few t-shirts and they turned out great!



    
We Will Be Idea Care-Takers We want to launch Thinkified as soon as possible but the biggest challenge for us has been getting the app to work as well as perfectly as it needs to. Ideas are precious, and we have to make sure that Thinkified is as stable as possible in order to keep your brain-children safe.
We have the know-how, between all of our founders, we've built hundreds of websites which handle hundreds of millions of dollars in sales each year, but we need to hire some additional programming help to get Thinkified launched as soon as possible.
That's where you come in! All money that comes in to help us reach our goal will be used to expand our team and infrastructure, and get the app launched as soon as we can.




Please Spread The Word If you are a creative person and have ideas all the time, we know that you understand what Thinkified is really for. If you know someone who is has a vivid imagination, tell them about Thinkified, they will appreciate it.   Share this IndieGoGo Campaign.
Share our video on Facebook or Twitter Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, or Instagram 
Sign-up for our email newsletter (The signup form is on Thinkified.com)
Tell your friends about Thinkified   Help us build a community of creative, engaged, and ambitious people. A community of Thinkers."The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter - for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way."- Nikola TeslaOne Idea Can Change The World. Join Us.

story:
Synopsis

Have you ever said to yourself... "Self, I wish I could rent out a movie theater, play any film I wanted and invite all my friends to come hang out and have a drink with me."

Opening this Fall, Monstrosities will dare to provide you with that unique, fun-filled experience you crave and more! 

With this fundraiser, you can help contribute to the start-up of Monstrosities and even earn some cool perks while doing it!   

*UPDATE*  All Contributors will be entered into a raffle to win a FREE 3 Hour Party upon opening!  Winner will be announced at the end of the campaign.


Perks

$10-$50 Rewards

$100 Reward


$150-$250 Rewards


$300-$500 Rewards

                     



Plot

The scene opens on a quaint storefront. 

Counter Culture Collectibles

Stocking current and sought after collectibles as well as one of a kind goods, with a focus on Horror, Sci-Fi, Fantasy and more, Monstrosities will appeal to all fans of counter culture entertainment.   

Browsing our merchandise consisting of Action Figures, Toys, Posters, Board Games, Novelties and more sure can make you hungry...

                         


Little Snack Shop of Horrors

Pop on over to our little snack shop where you're sure to find something to satisfy your cravings.  Featuring: A candy buffet, freshly popped popcorn, homemade baked goods, and thirst quenching refreshments to take on the go or enjoy in our cafe style theater...

                                          

 BYOB Movie House

The Screaming Room  will be a compact theater with non-traditional movie seating. It can be rented out for private events at a rate of $100/hour for up to 30 people.
Pick any movie of your choosing to screen for you and your guests. All events are BYOB and outside food can be delivered from nearby restaurants.

When it's not being rented out for private events, The Screaming Room will serve as cafe seating where customers can hang out and devour their treats, pick out a board game from our shelf of free play games or watch whatever film may be showing, free of charge                                             


Cast & Production

Katie Loncar is a loyal horror fanatic who loves to bake (and eat) desserts and collect movie memorabilia.  With her appreciation for the counter culture, schooling in the baking arts and 10+ years of experience working for small businesses, she's never felt more prepared to begin this venture.

Monstrosities will be a way to combine all the things I love into a business geared especially towards people just like me. Even if the goal isn't reached, all funds raised will go to the start-up of Monstrosities.  I want to bring a new and unique entertainment destination to Chicago.  This business is FOR YOU and anyone who helps spread the word, donates or patronizes Monstrosities will forever be a part of it!


Reviews

Let us know what you think!

Monstrosities would love to hear your opinion on what would make this business idea even better.

There are other ways to contribute!

Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to help spread the word.

Like us on Facebook!

Follow our progress at www.facebook.com/monstrositieschicago

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ranjith Kumar Pandranki and I am working with Aga Khan Rural Support India (AKRSPI) NGO at Niwali Block of Barwani Dist, MP. I have joined this NGO as part of a 1year fellowship programme - SBI Youth for India. Prior to this I was working with Infosys at Bangalore. Currently I'm on a year long sabbatical.

AKRSPI been working with the tribal communities at Niwali block for the last 8 years. The NGO has a very strong hold with the community here since it has been working on different programmes like SHGs, Watershed, Agriculture etc.  

I seek your help in a new programme that I intend to start at this block in the area of Rural Self Employment. In this regard I would want to identify few farmers who are interested in getting trained in 'Bee Keeping' and would want to assist them through the different phases of starting a project on bee keeping and honey processing unit. This I believe will be a new income generating activity for some households and help them improve their livelihood. 

The Economics

To get this project started I would need somewhere close to INR 50,000. I have zeroed on this figure after discussing with other NGOs which have already started a similar project in their work locations.

I have realized that for mobilizing the community, conducting an exposure visit and to get them trained on beekeeping I need to spend about INR 6,000 to 8,000 per farmer on logistics and training.

The Impact

  1. Agriculture is the principal source of livelihood for more than 75% of the population in Niwali block.
  2. There is an urgent need to uplift this sector and improve the socio-economic condition of the farmers.
  3. Beekeeping will help increase the crop production anywhere between 30% -80% thereby putting more income in small farmer households.
  4. Beekeeping products (honey and beeswax) raise the income of beekeepers, contrary to non-beekeepers who depend mainly on commercial/cash crops.

Challenges

The major challenges I face at this juncture are

  1. The community fear the wild bees(Apis Dorsata) which exist at some locations.
  2. The lack of awareness of the community about the benefits of beekeeping.
I am planning to conduct village level meeting where I will show some videos to the community which would first remove the fear for bees and also raise awareness about the benefits of beekeeping. In this regard I have visited a nearby place where the farmers have started beekeeping with the help of an NGO. I have created a documentary of an interview with one of those farmer at his farm with the beebox.

story:
Short Summary


  • Mamma Lucias Italian Kitchen. Introduced to Granada Hills in 1956 across the street from its present location.I'm Mario Macro owner/operator/chef...! The great grandson of Mamma Lucia.  
  • We are trying to install an A.D.A. restroom. In a attempt to serve all of our customers better.
  • Mamma Lucias just wants to make "Dining in for All" simple !!!!!!!!!!


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • A A.D.A. restroom costs more than we thought. We are trying to raise $25k. Costs add up (permits, materials,plumber, framer...).
  • Here we have some perks for your Donation.
  • $5.   - LOVE.......HUG FROM MARIO!!!!!
  • $25. - DESSERT......FREE CANNOLI !!!
  • $50. - GROUP COOKING LESSON...MAMMA AND ME. 6 PEOPLE MAX.
  • $100.- GIFT CERTIFICATE ......DONATE $100. RECEIVE A $25. CERT. 
  • $500.- FAMILY STYLE.....$100. GIFT CERT. & INDIVIDUAL COOKING CLASS WITH MAMMA ON "HOW TO MAKE HER "TIRAMISU"
  • $1000. -LA FAMILIA - ADD YOUR NAME TO YOUR FAVORITE DISH ON OUR MENU.
  • All funds will go to the completion of the A.D.A. restroom.
  • Risks and Challenges
  • We have bids in place (more are welcome), just short of funds to complete.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 And GRAZIE MILLE !!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
Please choose your language   
  English     Deutsch


---------WITH FULL MONEY BACK GUARANTEE---------


Jump to (click to select) 

  1. What`s NEW, Better and Different: COOLED wet food
    2.
  2. Tech for Pet: How it Works
    3.
  3. Crowdfunding target
    4.
  4. Exclusive PERKS/pre-order conditions for our supporters
    5.
  5. Referral program
    6.
  6. Investors and resellers program
    7.
  7. Full purchase REFUND if we do not meet our goal
    8.
  8. FAQs
    9.

FOR CAT FRIENDS, CUDDLE CHAMPIONS AND CANNED FOOD OPENERS



Incredibly easy

CATSOMAT wet food feeder simplifies & ensures feeding while giving your cat the consistency they crave!

We enjoy our fuzzy friends, and want the best for them.

But there’s one problem many have not been able to solve: Feeding nutritious, properly cooled wet food to different cats at different times — maybe in different amounts. CATSOMAT can help you solve this problem.

As our pets age and their needs change; or if we add a second cat or more: CATSOMAT will help you care for them as much as you love them.

We know you want to provide the best possible feedings and care to your pets. We do, too. CATSOMAT is here to help.



Of course, it can't replace us. 

And it's not meant to.

But it can reliably cover for us.

when we are not at home. 

CATSOMAT: Truly unique and truly helpful

  • COOLED WET FOOD: CATSOMAT is the ONLY thermo-electrically cooled WET FOOD automatic feeder in the world! Unlike others that attempt to use ice packs (we think using ice packs is totally ineffective), CATSOMAT continuously cools and preserves fresh and healthy food.
  • MULTI-CAT HOUSEHOLDS: CATSOMAT is perfect for multi-cat households: Using RFID technology, CATSOMAT allows each cat to receive only the food intended for it. Need to prevent one cat from stealing another cat’s meal? CATSOMAT is the answer.
  • PROMOTE GOOD HEALTH: CATSOMAT will help keep your kitties healthy: It is ideal for safely feeding elderly cats or pets with special health needs — such as cats that need regular and reliable medication.
  • WEIGHT CONTROL: Ideal for diet management: If your cat is overweight and you would like to gently control intake, CATSOMAT will ensure that only the food you serve will be available when you want it to be.
  • NATURAL FEEDING PATTERN: Some experts believe multiple, small feedings throughout the day is a more natural and healthful feeding pattern. CATSOMAT allows you to mimic natural feeding patterns.
  • ALWAYS ON DUTY: CATSOMAT is on duty, ready to serve your pet 24/7.
->> back to top 

Tech for Pet: How it Works

The CATSOMAT II is unique and cannot be compared with any other cat feeder.

Current wet feeders (except for our original CATSOMAT) do not deliver constant and reliable cooling. All other feeders use ice packs to cool food, and this is only a temporary measure lasting at most 12 hours. CATSOMAT II uses thermoelectric cooling. What is that? 

THERMO-ELECTRIC COOLING: WHAT IS IT?

Thermo-electric cooling is very similar to standard refrigeration, except it does not use a compressor. Thermo-electric cooling is also known as a "Peltier" device. Peltier technology uses electricity to transfer heat from one side of a metal plate to the other side. The heat transferred is ejected (via a whisper-quiet fan), and the cooling is accomplished. It seems like magic, but it is not. It is the miracle of a solid-state refrigerator.

CATSOMAT II uses thermoelectric cooling technology to efficiently cool your pet’s food, keeping it at a safe temperature of 42.8 degrees fahrenheit. For comparison, your household refrigerator might keep food at between 42 and 47 degrees fahrenheit. Thermoelectric cooling is far more energy efficient than standard, compressor-based cooling technology.

Because CATSOMAT II has seven feeding compartments, you can easily serve dry food, too. You can choose to turn off the cooling whenever you want, or use it to serve wet food at one time, and dry food at another. All in one convenient setting.

Your cat won’t eat food that's too cold? We have you covered: CATSOMAT II can preheat wet food just before serving!

Since cold food sometimes can upset a cat’s stomach, we’ve created an integrated innovative heating function that turns on to preheat the food right before it is served at feeding time. You can turn the preheat function on or off, depending on your cat’s preference. Or, if you are using dry food, you can turn it off altogether.

With the CATSOMAT II, the safe and reliable feeding of several cats in a household is incredibly simplified.

CATSOMAT identifies your pet using RFID technology:

If you have “chipped” your cat — the grain-sized transponder inserted into most rescue pets today — CATSOMAT II uses that to automatically recognize each cat, individually. Each feeding bowl inside the CATSOMAT II can be mapped to an individual pet’s transponder, and only the bowl you designate will be presented. This works for up to seven cats!

Older cats particularly require small food portions distributed throughout the day. For ill cats, regular and safe intake of their medication is crucial. In combination with our RFID technology, an intelligent locking mechanism ensures that the feeding bowls are automatically locked in and cooled after feeding. 

This way, each cat can eat what they want and then come back to the same food later. CATSOMAT II ensures that only the food — perhaps containing medications — for a particular cat is presented to that cat, and that cat only.


Why multiple small meals are ideal for cats

CATSOMAT II ensures that your cats do not overeat because they learn that they can eat whenever they want — up to the portions you allow.

This is important because, unlike dogs, cats stomachs do not “dilate” — they do not expand to accept a lot of food all at once. Cats naturally prefer several small meals, and CATSOMAT II makes it possible. There is some evidence that feeding your cat in this naturally-occurring way leads to better health.

 -> back to the top

Do you also have a hungry dog in your household that nibbles at the kitty dish? 



No problem!
CATSOMAT II not only ensures that individual cats are fed their designated meals, it also makes sure that Fido does not eat kitty’s food. None but your RFID-identified cat will be able to eat your pet’s food.

Uneaten food is returned to be properly cooled after you cat eats only a portion — automatically!
One cat or many, CATSOMAT is definitely the right choice!

Extremely easy to use — while at home or away!

The touch screen is incredibly easy to use.

You can choose to program the CATSOMAT II with the simple and intuitive touch screen.

Other feeders can be defeated by clever cats. Not CATSOMAT. The touch-screen interface makes sure that not even the cleverest of cats can modify the program.

Does your cat use a smartphone? Didn't think so. But CATSOMAT II does: It is the ONLY wet food feeder in the world that allows you to control it using a smartphone or tablet interface!

You can rest assured that your kitty will be served food on the schedule you set.


The WiFi-enabled CATSOMAT App

CATSOMAT II is the only cooled cat feeder in the world that can be controlled at any time and from anywhere in the world using an internet-connected desktop computer, tablet or smartphone.

The CATSOMAT II App that this campaign will help fund will allow you to control and reprogram every setting, from anywhere. This is especially useful for unexpected changes in your schedule. The only thing that must be done manually is refilling the device.

For finicky cats who insist on just the right food

Using seven 13.5 oz feeding dishes, you can present any one of them to your cat(s) at any time — from anywhere in the world (using your internet connected device and the smartphone app we will build with this campaign). The feeding tray is food-safe, acid-resistant, and dishwasher safe.


We will make several standard, pre-programmed menus (e.g., the “weekend menu”) that quickly and easily ensures your pet is lovingly cared for while you are away. Your cat will be thrilled, and you will be confident you are showing them all the love they need until you are able to return.

-> back to the top


Knowing that everything is okay.


The integrated camera allows you to look in on your pet at any time, from anywhere. You can check in to make sure they are eating the food you provided.

The CATSOMAT II, using the funding from this campaign, will have real-time video recording (and single images) to let you know that your cat is feeding properly. You will also be able to receive a text message alerting you to when your cat feeds using the smartphone app. Or you could choose to look in on and even talk to your kitty when they are feeding.

Say "Hello kitty" - even when you are not at home

Our trigger call function enables you to individually setup a trigger call for each cat through the integrated microphone that plays when it is feeding time. Cats love rituals and you will be amazed to see just how thrilled your pets will be when they hear your voice. 

And we have even gone a step further!

With the CATSOMAT II, not only can you individually call your pets during feeding sessions, you can also get to talk to them from anywhere through the integrated speaker and microphone function thanks to the WLAN connection. Through the integrated microphones, you can hear how relaxed your pets are and soothed to hear your voice.


Tamper-proof locking technology

Most cat feeders simply DO NOT secure food against clever kitties. The CATSOMAT II guarantees through its tamper-proof design that even your cleverest kitty will not get into food not actively presented. The body of the device uses a dual locking mechanism that can only be opened by human hands.


CATSOMAT II has an integrated battery backup 

BATTERY BACKUP

In the event of a power failure, the integrated battery supplies power for up to 60 hours of operation (when fully charged). Although the cooling is deactivated when on battery power, the meals will still be presented according to your programmed schedule. The CATSOMAT II is well-insulated and will keep food properly cool for the limited duration of most power failures. Once power is restored, the cooling function automatically returns and food is then maintained at the temperature you have selected. Importantly, your program is preserved, so you will not need to reenter information after a power failure.

Important (and obvious) note: If there is no power for an extended duration, owners must replace perishable wet food in the tray at the earliest opportunity to ensure the health of your cat. Cats will not eat spoiled food.


Form follows function - It works with 100% confidence and is stylish at the same time.

FORM FOLLOWS FUNCTION

In the best German way, our motto is “form follows function.” The main challenge was to be in the highest degree certain that the CATSOMAT II would work every time, all the time, exactly as you programmed it. The CATSOMAT II is made with tested, food-safe materials and safely operates so that you can be sure your pet can use this machine safely with absolute confidence.

Happily, the device turned out to be attractive thanks to its appealing and timeless design.

The first CATSOMAT IIs will be produced in an elegant shade of grey. Later, we will offer other designer colors — and perhaps even unique, one-of-a-kind colors that you choose!

If you want a particular color, then you should take a look at our "Special Color PERK"!

->> back to top 


Technical specifications

Rated voltage:

12VDC

Power rating:

80 – 90 Watt

Power supply/adapter:

Input: 110V 60H / 230V 50H AC    
Output: 12VDC 5A
(North American + European Standard)

Protection class:

II, double insulation

Weight (netto) CATSOMAT:

approx. 15 lb

Capacity of the feeding bowl:

approx. 7 x 13.5 oz

Dimensions CATSOMAT (L x B x H):

36 x 36 x approx. 7/8 inches 

Diameter of the feeding bowl:

13 inches

Display:

Touch screen approx. 2.3'' x 3.1''

Color of the body / feeding bowl:       

grey/white

Power consumption:

an average of approx. 0,1 KWh


More benefits of the CATSOMAT II that you and your pet will love 

  1. Flies cannot infest your pet’s food because the lid is tightly secured!
  2. You control your schedule instead of your kitty’s tummy: It's okay if you are running late.
  3. Your pet(s) can be safely and securely cared for in your temporary absence without burdening friends or relatives, or paying a pet sitter.
  4. Your privacy is intact: You do not have to invite people in to your home or give them your keys to care for your pet during short vacations or outings.




The CATSOMAT I was the first thermoelectric-cooled pet feeder in the world when it was introduced 3 years ago. The CATSOMAT product is still unique. CATSOMAT I has given hundreds of people worldwide a safe solution to feed their pets.

We listened to our current customers, and now we want to take this wonderful device to the next level. That is the purpose of this campaign: To deliver on the promise of CATSOMAT by building an even better wet food feeder based on the valuable feedback of our current customers.

The 2011 CATSOMAT I, opened and filled

The CATSOMAT I has been through many product tests and has completely satisfied many people, worldwide. We are known as the best feeder in the world. 

Furthermore, in almost all of the current product tests, the CATSOMAT I still comes out on top.

Currently, our device is rated the best also among the big cat feeders test on the “hundkatzemaus” show (lit. “Dog-Cat-Mouse”; German TV Program). 



Where we are today

For over 2 years, our ambitious team of German engineers and product designers has been working almost every day on the vision of the new CATSOMAT. The basic development, technical feasibility studies and the preliminary tests have already been completed. 

We are strongly dedicated to have the device ready for you.


-> back to the top

Our campaign goal

We want to bring the CATSOMAT II to the world and especially to our friends in America. And not just the original, but a new and better product that incorporates all the best ideas we have learned. Join us to help us make this happen.

Through our experience and careful analysis, we believe it will take $550,000 to produce and deliver the Catsomat II. We will secure these funds from private investors as well as by this crowdfunding campaign.

As a young company, we know we cannot realize our vision on our own.  
We will only succeed with your help! 

Be part of our campaign. Take advantage of the unique opportunity to purchase the CATSOMAT II at these exclusive special prices. 

All the funds that we collect with your support will be used to... 

  • ... implement the complete technical drafts for the electronics, software and standard production details for delivery.
  • ... contract with fabrication facilities.
  • ... create production tools.
  • ... tests and certify the pilot devices.
  • ... certify the CATSOMAT II in accordance with American and European standards..

To get all this done, with your funding help, we will have all production conditions fulfilled to produce the first series of the CATSOMAT II from December 2015.

In the course of development, minor modifications to these features may occur. We reserve the right to modify the product as necessary to effect delivery. We will promptly inform you if fundamental features cannot be met, or if the delivery timeframe cannot be met. 

-> back to the top 


You can support us on any of the listed support levels. You hereby get to decide whether you wish to “push on” our project by means of a donation or whether you want to directly be one of the first purchasers of the CATSOMAT II (save up to 61%). The official selling price after the launch will be approx. $ 900.00. 

Simply select the amount you wish to donate in form of a PERK directly in the overview below or on the right side of this page (Here, you will also find a detailed description of the various PERKS). You can also book more than one PERK.

Our PERKS for you:

In the unlikely event that the production conditions of the CATSOMAT II are not achieved by the end of 2015, you can get back your purchase price. 
Regardless of whether we will reach our IndieGogo funding target or not.

The refund gaurantee excludes non-purchase donations (PERKS TINY HELP BIG & SMALL) and the $100.00 portion in PERK 'SUPER EARLY CAT'. Any other indemnity claims are excluded. 

Delivery and service in the USA is through Brisa America INC. 


-> back to the top

We cordially thank you for your support!


   About us - the story behind the story



As with many entrepreneurs and innovators, the idea that led to CATSOMAT came from the vision of one man: Donald R. Pilz (51). After more than 20 years as a successful manager in the transport and logistic industry, Mr. Pilz was looking for a new business challenge. 

After the prototype of CATSOMAT was developed several years ago, Donald Pilz became determined to build and distribute it. He started the company. 

Mr. Pilz knew that all products and options available in the market simply did not meet the needs of millions of pet owners. 

With the support of his family and an engaged team of engineers and product designers, Mr. Pilz developed the first CATSOMAT and brought it to market. 

On 17th June 2011 the first CATSOMAT was launched in Germany as part of “Maintier 2011” (German animal trade show) and was successfully marketed by the then newly established CATSOMAT GmbH & Co. Pet Products KG. 
-> back to the top 

Do you want to become an investor?

Are you looking for a future-oriented investment and wish to use your investment towards expansion of our company? If yes, simply write us a message at rp@catsomat.com. We look forward to hearing from you. 


Are you interested in a reseller partnership?

Are you a reseller and wish to be among the first ones who bring the CATSOMAT II to your country? The 10+1 reseller PERK secures you the exclusive ticket to our reseller partner program. You will hereby receive 10 devices + 1 for free before the official launch. Herewith, you will not just be supporting us, this will also secure you the pole position. 

-> back to the top 

FAQ

Q: Why is the CATSOMAT so expensive compared to other feeders?

A: For a device to operate independently and safely in your home there is a whole host of safety criteria, regulatory standards, and design specifications to be engineered.  CATSOMAT has done the engineering, regulatory compliance, and safety studies for you -- and then manufactured the device to those specifications.


What else do you own to make your life easier? iPhones? Expensive kitchen appliances? How about a gorgeous flat-screen TV? All these things serve to make our lives easier and enjoyable. Catsomat will make your life easier, too -- and help keep your cat healthy!

Q: Is the CATSOMAT safe to operate when I am not home?

A: Yes. The entire purpose of the CATSOMAT is to provide hygienically-cooled wet food to your pet, safely, when you are away.

Q: How long will food stay fresh?

A: Wet food is a perishable item. The CATSOMAT will maintain food freshness for the same amount of time an opened can of food can be safely stored in a household refrigerator (6°C). In general, up to 3-5 days for canned food. Up to 3 days for pre-frozen raw pet food.

Safe food handling (for humans and pets) is something we cannot answer here. But suffice it to say that safe food handling practices should always be observed.

Q: Can I use CATSOMAT with "raw food"?

A: Yes. Please note, however, that raw food has not been pasteurized nor treated, and is thus even more perishable than canned food. CATSOMAT strongly recommends pre-freezing raw food placed in the device so that it thaws for presentation in a cooled environment. Pre-frozen raw food should never be left in the device for longer than 3 days.

Q: Is the CATSOMAT expensive to operate?

A: Not at all. It is equivalent to a 90-Watt lightbulb in power consumption. Energy consumption is a mere fraction of standard, compressor-type refrigeration.

Q: Aren't plastics harmful to use in storing food?

A: Not all plastics are the same. The plastic we use is polycarbonate, a stable form of plastic that is exceptionally durable. It is dishwasher safe, and food safe.

Q: Doesn't plastic harbor bacteria?

A: The feeding tray is scratch-resistant, food-safe polycarbonate, and thus does not develop micro-scratches that can harbor bacteria. We have studied this in real-time deployments for three years on the CATSOMAT I. The feed tray material is safe.

Q: Is the CATSOMAT II self-cleaning and self-filling?

A: No. We asked our engineers to accomplish this. Sadly, they have not. You must fill and maintain the CATSOMAT. Happily, the CATSOMAT dish can be run through an automatic dishwasher.

Q: Will the CATSOMAT II smartphone app work if I do not have internet connectivity and a WiFi-enabled router at my home?

A: Nope.

Q: Will the CATSOMAT II smartphone app alert me about any issues, such as power failures?

A: Yep.

Q: Will I be able to track whether my cat is eating?

A: Yes. We think, particularly for cats with special health concerns, this is a marvelous advance. You will be able to configure smartphone alerts that tell you your cat is feeding, and view your cat feeding via the FREE smartphone app.

Q: Will I be able to review the history of my pet's feeding habits?

A: Yes. 

Q: What about internet security protocols and privacy?

A: You are a smart consumer. Everyone should be aware of devices that connect to the internet, and whether they are deployed with encryption and security. The CATSOMAT II internet-connected functions will have encryption and security built in.

Q: I do not know if my cat has an RFID chip in place, yet. How do I tell?

A: If you adopted your cat through a rescue shelter, it is very likely that the RFID chip is in place. The surest way to find out is to take your pet to a shelter or veterinarian and determine if the RFID signal shows up on the monitors there.

Or, if you get the CATSOMAT II (and we think you should), you will be able to see the RFID unique identifier via the CATSOMAT II display and interface, if one is there.

Q: What if my cat does not have an RFID chip? Or if I do not want to insert one?

A: There are readily-available RFID  collars on the market. But we do not recommend them. 

Q: I do not want to add an RFID chip to my pet, via collar or insert. Will the device work?

A: The device can be programmed to work on an automated schedule that does not rely on RFID recognition. But using the CATSOMAT II in this way defeats many of the values and purposes of the device. We think you should reconsider.

Have a question? If the info above doesn't help, you can ask one of our project creators directly.

Ask a question now

-> back to the top
